column3: Warm and welcoming - Reflective of the great Moroccan culture! Highly recommended.
column4: Abdallah (hotel manager), Hamdi, Yassine and the entire Hyatt team at Casablanca made us feel like coming back home after long hours of travel. This is my 5-6th stay with the Casablanca Hyatt over 15 years and I cannot recommend it higher. They took care of everything!

An beautiful hotel and amazing experience. Friendly staff and beautiful hotel, also had a beautiful Cartier shop at the hotel. The decor is beautiful and the location is excellent. Souks only a walk away.

I was surprised how attentive and helpful the staff were. Offering assistance wherever they anticipated we needed it, and when we asked for help they bent over backwards to offer solutions and help. Even though the outdoor swimming pool had been closed for the winter they even opened it up for the two of us to spend the afternoon by the pool in the winter sunshine. We couldn’t ask for any more from the hotel and it’s staff. Having also paid for Club Lounge access we really felt welcomed by the serving staff and the variety of food and drink available was super! We will use Hyatt more often for our travels.

Wonderful hotel. Very attentive staff. Some of them a little surly in reception. Fantastic the club and especially the waiter zaiatt not sure about the name. He offered a great service. It was my birthday. They sent a cake. Worth the money

Stay Report - 12/29 to 12/31 Location: The hotel is well located in Casablanca.  It's in a pleasant area of town with several restaurants around it as well as a tram stop and a big flea market behind it.  Red Taxis position themselves right out front so you can always get a ride somewhere too.  It's an easy drive to the mosque or the beach or any of the sights you want to see.  CMN is about 30 minutes away with no traffic but more accurately about 50 minutes if you drive during the day.  Hotel: Despite being an older property the hotel is extremely well maintained.  There's a gorgeous lobby with a library themed bar just off it that also has a limited bar menu.  Next to a Cartier store is another restaurant which has indoor and outdoor seating.  There's an outdoor pool around…

column3: Super well managed and friendly hotel
column4: Super well managed hotel with very caring staff. Absolutely friendly atmosphere from check-in, room-service, breakfast to afternoon happy hour in the Hyatt-club lounge. Booking a room with club access was a great choice as the lounge offers drinks and snacks included, making life easy.

column3: First rate hotel with great service
column4: We stayed here for a night before embarking on a week long tour of a few Moroccan cities. Well appointed hotel with impeccable service. Club Room is a nice get away with drinks and food. Wonderful breakfast buffet. Shout out to Mr. Rida El Idrissi, the Guest Relations Manager. He helped up from the moment we arrived and continued through arranging transportation/other logistics.

column3: Best place to stay in Casablanca!! Great location!!
column4: The hotel was very conveniently located, close to attractions and places of interest! Good food options available plus the Club in the 8th floor is services by possibly the best staff I have seen so far in similar clubs.

As we only spent one night in the hotel, this isn't an in depth review. I'll say that the family suites are really great for a party of 4-5. They combine an executive suite with a standard room to create a suite that just works. 2.5 bathrooms, central living room, lots of desks, and privacy when needed. The concierge service was certainly the cheapest that we received in Morocco, and the French cafe was delicious. I'd stay here again.

I travel with a group of 21. This was our last stop after travel all over Morocco. Started from Rabat, Chefchouen, Fes, Merzouga, Quazazate, Marrakech, Essouira and finally Casablanca. We stayed only one night. Wish we had stayed longer. Check in was fast, receptionist Omar, was efficient and accommodating with switching rooms. Dinner in the hotel - service was beyond excellent. We had a private room. About 7 staff served us. Food was not fantastic but consumable. Rooms were large, clean and well maintained. Bed was very comfortable. Highly recommended

As a non smoker, this hotel might not be the best choice even though non smoking rooms are available. Gym is open 24 h and has adequate space but temperature is warm (AC not working). Hotel is close to the Medina (market).

My experience at the Hyatt Regency in Casablanca was very good overall. I spent four nights at the hotel. My biggest negative was that they allow smoking in the restaurants which made it very unpleasant to have meals at the restaurant. The general manager was great. He checked with me on several occasions to make sure my state was going well. If I go back to Casablanca, I would probably try a different hotel just because of the smoking but if you do not have an issue with that the rooms are very nice there. Staff was excellent. The breakfast was very good in the bar restaurant was a lot of fun to hang out in. The location was good. You could easily walk to different places for shopping as well as dining.

column3: old rotting hotel, half of the things dont work
column4: staff semi hustlers - like the rest of this town, food absolutly horrible, you approvach the staff at reception they look away, i had to call reception maybe 5 times to get a tooth brush an hour later,

column3: A Gem In The City Centre
column4: The moment you enter the hotel you're greeted with genuine warmth from all the staff. The place is very clean with touches of Moroccan decor throughout. Breakfast caters for all palettes. All rooms are of a good size with excellent bathrooms. Enjoyed our 3 night stay.

The staff are friendly and helpful! Saddik in the club and other staff in the club were great! Very satisfied with the hotel but did not like the surrounding neighborhood Overall the hotel was worth the money we spent

Excellent business hotel. Very good lobby where one can have meaningful business discussions! Recommended for business travelers. A very well spread breakfast everything from bread eggs and traditional fare is available. I loved the fruits and the juices, and the fruit-based yoghurt was yum! Comfy room very spacious and good view too! Never had trouble falling asleep. Check in was super-fast and staff is pretty good! Pretty convenient to go sightseeing - just hire a taxi and you can cover most of the places without any hassle!

5* hotel. Comfortable rooms. Terrific service. The breakfast bar which is the only choice is ridiculously overpriced $30! The only food during the day is at the bar and it is awful! Overpriced as well. They cater to business groups so when you go to the pool there can be large conference group dining next to you. I would not spend the $ to stay here again

column3: Premium business hotel in prime location
column4: Whenever I have been to Casablanca on a business trip, always have been staying at the Hyatt. It remains by far the best business hotel and the club lounge is just perfect for quite business meetings and the hotel restaurant is good for business lunches. I recommend it highly for all business travelers to Casablanca.

Great hotel and experience at the Hyatt in Casablanca. Rooms are amazing, food selection spectacular, breakfast was exceptional, service great. It is also clean and worth the money. Would return for sure!

We had intended to spend a quick 1.5 days in Casablanca at end of our trip as our flight departed from there. Flight got pushed back a day so we ended up spending an extra day in town. This hotel was a very nice place to relax at the end of a trip. The staff were all very courteous, Seddik in the Club Lounge is a gem of a human being, one of the very best staff members I've ever interacted with over the years. Rooms were comfortable, location very convenient especially to visit the Hassan II Mosque. There's a lovely, large pool tucked into the corner of the property. We were "off season" (warm for us, not so much for locals) so there weren't any services beyond towels and chairs, but we still had a lovely afternoon lounging and swimming. Food at bar and at restaurant M were both…

Amazing hotel experience! I have been fortunate to have stayed in many beautiful properties around the world but this hotel stands out for its outstanding customer service. We were truly wowed by their white glove service, attention to detail, amazing breakfast buffet and delicious dinners in the Living Room. Definitely an experience to remember!

column3: Disappointing hotel in the center of Casablanca, not worth the Hyatt brand
column4: We came with a large group and booked more than 30 rooms and suites for several days. Obviously, rooms have neither been renovated for the last 30 years nor been maintained well. Front-desk staff was unfriendly. This hotel is neither worth the Hyatt brand nor 5 stars. Only positive experiences were the breakfast and lunch.

Hyatt regency Casablanca is an excellent hotel. Service when a problem arose was almost immediate. Breakfast offering was superb. Maintenance even fixed mt cane tip that was coming loose. The only negative thing was they allow cigar smokers in bar area. The smell permeates the entire lobby.

column3: a place to stay and feel as a GUEST
column4: We had a great stay at Hyatt regency taghazout and decided to visit the Hyatt in casablanca .It was a good decision !After a nice ride from taghazout to casa and it is easie to find the hotel .After a nice welcome and after a quick check in we first visit the restaurant for the sunday buffet brunch .a great assortiment and very tasty . Room was good and clean ,breakfast perfect service and again good assortment .parking was secure and spacious service was at high level and we decided to come back in january

6 stars in every way great service food and rooms.As far as I am concern, there is no hotel better .We have been to many Hotels around the world, this will classify as one of the best.The service is out of this world.The price is very fair

Nice to be back to Hyatt Casablanca after more than 20 years. Great service. Lovely people: Great service from Seddick at the lounge. Well done to Samir and Khadija also. Keep it up! Will be more than happy to come back as soon as possible. Thank you again !

column3: Amazing Experience at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca!
column4: Outstanding experience at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca. I travel internationally often and this was one of my best hotel experiences. Congratulations to the hotel staff for their excellent service and great facilities. highly recommended!

column3: Perfect Choice for a few days in Casablanca
column4: From the greeting as you get out of the taxi to turndown service at night, the staff at this hotel go out of their way. A special thanks to Mr. Hamdi, Concierge and Mr. Seddik in the executive lounge. We found everything to our liking in this hotel and the food in Dar Beida was exquisite. The only negative in an otherwise perfect stay was the street noise at night.

column3: A complaint Letter for bad Customer Service in your Hotel
column4: Monday 19th, 2022 From Mr Abdulalim Rakhyoot, the owner of Cesar Resort & Spa, Marrakech To the General Manager of Hayat Regency Casablanca, Mr Pascal Leprou Dear Mr Leprou, I am writing to bring your kind attention that I am extremely disappointed with the service provided by the reservation department. I have booked to stay in your hotel from the 20th to 23rd September, I immediately receive a detailed confirmation email No 54770646. Thereafter, I have received a phone call from Mrs Ikram, telling me that she made a mistake and she will cancel my reservation. I hope, you will take all of that into consideration, and take proper action, to prevent this happening again. Sincerely, Mr Abdulalim Rakhyout Owner of Cesar Resort & Spa

column3: Excellent Hotel right in city center.
column4: I stayed at 4 Seasons Casablanca & at Hyatt, & Clearly Hyatt is Much better, 4 Seasons Hotel is waste of Money with not much friendly staff or a very good Location & more expensive. Hyatt location cannot be any better with the old city & Souq/Medina just across the street, & all kinds of transportation right at the doorstep. Its French Restaurant is also good with reasonable prices. Room was perfect, very clean & nicely done. The only suggestion I would make is to have Smart TV apps installed in the TV. It gives you a complicated process how to do it with your cell phone I tried several times but could not, if they would directly install Smart TV apps in TV that would be easy. The hotel is at least 1 hour drive from Airport due to congestion & traffic so keep that in mind…

column3: When in Casablanca morocco this is the place to be
column4: I will definitely return over and over again when in Casablanca. This hotel is so well located the stuff are really kind and attentive the food is excellent the rooms are beautiful, the executive lounge is very spoiling and well equipped. The swimming pool area is beautiful and the spa is so cool. I would like to mention above all the amazing service by two employees: The first is Mr. Rida from the hotel’s Guest Relations department and the other person is Mr. Ossamma from the executive lounge. They definitely made my stay extra special and took care of every little need that I’ve had, these people makes a difference between just another hotel and a place that has been like your family’s home.

column3: Excellent hotel in great location with superb customer service.
column4: This hotel is superb and in a great location. The customer service was superb as well. The hotel went out of its way to accommodate my wife who had a serious fall and had to go into hospital in Tanger and accommodated her needs in an excellent manner.

This place is amazing, with superb location, friendly staff and marvelous rooms, best place to stay in Casablanca. Staff won’t disappoint you and Manager Ousama is outstanding. Breakfast is very good also. Spa and fitness center is worth seeing. Must stay.

column3: A nice and flawless stay @Hyatt Regency Casablanca
column4: Overall a flawless and great stay! The level of service was very good with great demonstration of morrocan hospitality and kindness by all staff. The location is perfect and the pool area was a revelation.

Sexist aggressive security and the staff plays along. Business Women are treated differently than business men. They grabbed a female colleague in the lobby and it went sideways. Then when I tried to get an apology they refused. I checked out early…. But literally they grabbed my bag in the lobby and put it back in my room. No apologies to my colleague or me. I don’t care what their beliefs are, but when you put your aggressive hands on someone for your belief it’s fundamentalism. They put their belief in front of my business meetings. I have no confidence in bringing a female colleague their. And most my business is with Women. It’s 2022 and women BullS*^T less than men.

Our stay at the Hyatt Casablanca was excellent. The hotel is In a good location next to the Medina. The hotel grounds are beautiful. Fabulous lounge and bar. The fantastic staff was extremely helpful at all times.

Great Location, great attentive staff, the outside pool was an unexpected surprise making you feel like you could be anywhere in a calm oasis ..beautiful surroundings, attentive staff, complimentary sun screen, a service to clean your sunglasses... amazing white sangria.. over & above

column3: Five star hotel with excellent friendly service. Highest recommendation!
column4: The Hyatt Casablanca is located in a perfect spot close to the Medina and Art Deco area. The hotel is elegant and sophisticated inside, as well as spotless. Welcome on arrival by the extremely helpful Abdellah the guest relations manager and that special touch continued throughout the stay. Room service food was excellent with polished service. Seddik in the lounge is a true gem, attentive and thoughtful, as you are in his 'house'. Was lucky enough to be in one of the best duplex suites I have stayed in with modern tasteful decor and very comfortable bed, sofa etc. Beautiful pool with excellent service and a relaxed vibe. One of the best Hyatts I have stayed at and up there with the best hotels. It should really be branded a Grand or Park Hyatt. Highly recommended.

The hotel is beautiful with an amazing staff, welcoming and always available to nicely assist you. One of the best hotel breakfast experience so far! While staying there you must assist to one of the Moroccan night diners they offer!

column3: The worst hotel I ever stayed at
column4: The hotel is so old, literally old door knobs are falling, door frame is broken. The hotel is managed by a person who doesn’t care about anything but their salary it’s so obvious. I will never stay in this hotel again. Door is broken Old furniture and torn Stinky Smelly towels with spots of dirt or something nasty. Carpet cigarette burns are everywhere Torn furniture is so visible Even the ice for soft drinks is dirty not clear 🤢 I’m so worried about my safety in this hotel after writing this review. When you enter the hotel you feel you are in the right place, but afterwards you will feel the old and worn out hotel. My advice to anyone is to try the hotel for a day or two and then decide if you will stay for the whole trip. I paid in advance for 5 days and I regret it.

Very helpful and welcoming staff. Room service was amazingly fast. In room food was great and so was the food and service in the on-site restaurant. I would stay there again if I am in Casablanca again.

column3: Smiling faces always around to you for Help
column4: Great Team , excellent support . Lobby Bar team & Bfast team GREAT X GREAT ! I loved their smiling faces. Try olives both bfast & bar lobby. Rich food taste and very clean service . I will stay again in this lovely Hotel.

column3: 5 stars all around - relaxing oasis in the centre of Casablanca
column4: Wonderful staff & service. Great location to walk to lots of things in Casablanca and we felt safe walking around this area as two women (also nice the hotel is gated and have staff on 24/7). They will also call you taxis if you want to go to the mosque or airport etc. Rooms were heavenly with big fluffy bath towels & robes. Separate toilet to bathroom and big bath tub to soak in. We had a higher level room with view of the mosque that was stunning. Pool is huge and was pretty quiet even though we went on a weekend. For $300 AUD a night it was expensive for Morocco but we felt we got our moneys worth as it is a 5 star hotel and lived up to it!

column3: Amazing hotel with outstanding and professional staff
column4: This is a top notch Hyatt Regency hotel. We stayed there couple weeks ago. It is centrally and very conveniently located near the port central train station, old town, central market and tram station in Casablanca. What impressed us the most, was the high standards of the hotel in every aspect and the professional and the so well trained staff at every level. The pool, lobby restaurant, Dar al Beida restaurant with great food and evening music and dance entertainments, the regency club and its staff were all exceptional, and so was everyone at the front desk, and really every one at the hotel. We felt very special and the staff treated guests and welcomed all so well. The facilities are so clean and well maintained from lobby to rooms, outdoor and indoor spaces. Many thanks to…

The location of this hotel is the best. It is within walking distance of all the places, and most of the city restaurants. Rooms are comfortable and spacious, and toilets well planned and stocked. The resident lounge is very comfortable for the evenings, and service is very good. Would highly recommend it.

column3: I don’t recommend anyone to go to that Hotel
column4: The front desk unprofessional They delayed our entrance for more than 1/2 hour although we came after 2pm The pool was closed almost all my 6 nights stay The room is designed in a very uncomfortable way

column3: Do not stay here if there is a conference on
column4: The staff at this hotel simply can't handle leisure guests and conferencing at the same time, so call in advance and make sure there's no conference on the dates you're looking at booking. On the second day of our two-day stay, we found the doors out to pool locked shut. A cleaner nearby told us it was because of the conference having lunch... but it was 3pm. On enquiring at reception, we were told the pool was open. After some baffled phone calls, the manager eventually told us that they had sent someone to unlock the pool for us. Unfortunately, we were met with a wall of conference delegates, and various barricades of benches and shelving arranged to block access to the pool and loungers. Upon negotiating those, we were offered menus by a lost-looking pool attendant. He…

We brought our 2nd group to stay at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca for a 2 night stay. Our accommodations were lovely and the breakfast very delicious. Only disadvantage was that a check in fir our 7 rooms took more than an hour although we arrived to the hotel at 3pm.

Everything was great from start to finish... truly a 5-star world-class operation. Espcially Hamdi concierge, Leila front desk and club room, Sekked club room - each of them couldn't do enough to assist me in every way requested. Certainly I will return! [security also top notch and professional]

column3: A great hotel in a great location
column4: A great hotel in a great location, opposite the medina and half hours walk to the mosque. We paid a modest amount extra for a club room that gave us access to the club lounge where we were looked after by very well by a very attentive gentleman in the evening and the wonderful Leila at breakfast.

column3: An oasis of calm in a busy city centre
column4: Wonderful hotel Right balance of service from the moment you walk through the door Main restaurant has limited choice but excellent food and fabulous outdoor space. Serves alcohol even during Ramadan. Breakfast fabulous and able to cater for dairy free diet Great gym

The location of this hotel is absolutely ideal. It is right in the center of the city and walking to nearby attractions is easy. I will note that the surrounding area can get a little weird at night, so keep your wits about. The concierge service is ideal, we were able to covid test for return to USA easily. Concierge helped with that process immensely and we did not even have to leave hotel. Concierge brought a nurse in to do it. Excellent service! Breakfast was very good, but a little underwhelming. It's a simple breakfast with not many options. But, what is available is really good. Finally, the rooms were some of the best I saw in Morocco. Very comfortable and clean.

I stayed in a junior suite and had an amazing view over the souk across to the mosque, exactly like in the advertising photo. The room is huge & well appointed, with a bath tub, coffee machine, big tv, iron & board, hairdryer etc. The welcome was friendly & warm, including welcome tea and a little later a plate of biscuits delivered to the room. My Covid test was easily arranged for my flight back a few days after. I forgot about the drinks in the lounge area 6pm to 8pm, oh well I missed out because my memory is failing me these days. The hotel is elegant and beautiful. Unfortunately for me the pool was closed, I did have plans to lounge around the pool, but I was able to take some photos and it’s a lovely area too. Across the road from the hotel are cafés and food outlets such…

Loved this hotel. All the staff were amazing - so friendly and helpful. We booked a room with free breakfast and lounge access- Seddik in the lounge was so friendly and told us all the good Hallam spots around town. I can’t wait to come back and spend a longer time.

Arrive at 23h with 2.children’s , room not ready even if I send 3 emails prior coming , bad incompetent people , had to wait, had people in the room to bring extra bed, all children want to sleep but was impossible, nobody is running this hotel, no answer to my complain to the hotel , very bad

My husband and I stayed here for two nights at the end of our Moroccan vacation. The hotel is in a convenient location that is easily reached by public transit. It's a large property with a grand lobby and staff who are generally helpful. Our room was large and comfortable, with lots of nice touches, but was a bit worn and in need of some minor repairs. Special thanks to the Concierge, who helped us secure onsite COVID testing and enlisted a courier to get our paper test results when there was an issue with email delivery.

column3: Fantastic location and extraordinary customer service
column4: Yassine one of the concierge was extremely great in helping us in obtaining PCR tests to return back to US. The hotel was close to many places of interest and a must if you are going to the mosque nearby.

It is very nice hotel. But more than that we want to mention that they have wonderful staff, Yassine!!! We really want to thank Yassine for all the help he has done while we stayed there!!! We arrived on the day when Morocco closed border to any outside country, which we didn't know anything about it. After we found out, Yassine helped out for us to find the way to go back home. Since the county was supposed to close for next 14 days, he found us for nearby apartment. Called all the train, ferry, airline for us to find out what can be done. Without his help, it could take us much longer to go back home if we could. For the hotel itself, it is very nice hotel. It has Cartier shop inside the hotel, so you can tell how nice and luxury the hotel is. they have compliment mint…

column3: Not what I expected from a Hyatt,
column4: This hotel is not what you expect from a Hyatt Regency. When we arrived to check in, we had to go looking for someone to help us unload our luggage from the rental car. We later found out the there is no valet and that you must park your own car. Once inside the hotel the gentleman checking us in asked if I wanted two rooms, since it is illegal for unmarried couple to share a room, even though I requested one room for my wife and myself. The lobby of the hotel is nice, but once we arrived on the 5th floor the hallway was dark and looked like it was stuck in the 1950's. In the room there was a smell of cigarette, (even though I requested a non smoking room) and there was a cigarette burn on the carpet. The chair at the desk was covered in scratches a looked like it had not…

The hotel entrance and lobby are grand. The service is very good. Restaurant has a good dinner menu and the food was quite good. Rooms however are very dated and in poor condition. Bathroom is old as is the toilet. The minute I walked in the room I was quite surprised and disappointed. Didn’t feel like a Hyatt and was to expensive for what it was. There are much better options for less money in Casablanca.

Worst Hyatt experience ever. I have stayed 200+ nights in Hyatts all over the world and this is by far the worst experience. After traveling all day, we arrived at 10pm at the hotel for a one night stay and we didn't get to our rooms until 11pm. As a Hyatt Globalist, I always get suite upgrades but the manager at this property Leprou Pascal refused to give us the suite upgrade. There were at least 7 suites available at the time of our check-in. My daughter slept in the lobby for 45 minutes because it took me so long to check-in. If you are traveling with family or expecting the same service as other Hyatts, DO NOT stay here!

column3: The place to stay in Casablanca!
column4: A superb oasis in the heart of Casa! Really close to the madina and the view (if faced west) is really cool. This isn't a Hyatt issue, but be cautious over the "sharks" at the madina pretending that they are part of the hotel -- they are not and will rip you off.

I had an amazing satay the stuff was so nice.the room was clean and tidy the most thing i liked was the view. The breakfast was the best part I really enjoyed the traditional food and especially “ Msaman” prepared by Ilham and she was super nice all the stuff was nice they took care of us. Thank you so much for all the team of Hayatt Regency. Hope to see you soon☺️

We had a great time staying in Casablanca. The hotel staff were amazing. The room had amazing views of the mosque. The Regency club was amazing. The hotel has a huge pool that the kids loved. It does not have a shallow end but the hotel provided huge blobs for the kids to float on. We would absolutely come back.

I had the chance to stay in this hotel and experience its good service and clean and tidy room . Guest service are very responsive and understanding. Best part was the breakfast, traditional food mixed with continental cuisine, we were served by ZKARIA , he was nice to us and introduced the buffet well . Restaurant bar DAR BEIDA was amazing, classy clean , DELICIOUS food and drink , definitely worth the visit.

Perfect location to walk in the down town. Very comfortable place to relaxe. The restaurant M is a very nice place to enjoy some music and great drinks, even to smoke a cigar. The food is good, and the service is very satisfying.

Exceptional service by all staff members. The breakfast buffet is wonderfull. Yassin, the Lead Concierge and member of Les Clefs d'Or was warm, welcoming and very helpful during my stay. A great pool (the outdoor/pool furniture could use an update)

First and foremost I would start with complimenting the hotel staff. From concierge, receptionist, room service and the spa manager all were so polite and genuinly hospitable. They are auch asset to the Hyatt company. The hotel is clean and located right in the center of the city. The bed is so comfortable and trust me i am not exaggerating. I slept like a baby. The fitness center is well equipped. A big spread out workout space with variety of new equipments. All I can say is that I had an awesome and comfortable stay. I am definitely coming back here. Shilpa

column3: A superb choice for a stay in Casablanca
column4: Outstanding service, a great hotel with all the facilities you could ask for. Excellent concierge. The breakfast options are tasty, including Moroccan options. The club room was closed due to COVID, but otherwise all was perfect.

I spent few night with my family in this hotel. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms are like new and very clean. Food in the restaurant was very good. Location of hotel is also very good. I highly recommend this hotel.

All was wonderful and fantastic however i do not recommend the restaurant for lunch or dinner the breakfast was fantastic! The staff was very helpful and professional the consierge gentleman was very helpful and the best.

I had the fantastic opportunity to stay at this wonderful hotel and the staff was incredibly hospitable and extremely accommodating. The hotel room and grounds were clean and well presented. The petite dejeuner (breakfast) was delicious (picture below for reference)! Unfortunately, due to health circumstances, the revered hotel night club was closed during my stay. However, you must visit le piscine (the pool) and see the jovial and friendly Simbo, who will kindly provide beverages and cuisine while you socialize (pool picture below for reference). Of course, if you care to venture afoot, the Medina Ancienne (bazaar) is merely across the street from the hotel grounds as well as many other sites, restaurants and social spots throughout the area to include Rick’s Café-…

column3: Wonderful Experience at Hyatt Regency Casablanca
column4: I recommend Hyatt Regency Casablanca. We would like to thank the whole team for the great welcome since we arrived every thing was prefect and the staff were helpful, whatever we requested was up to our expectations the rooms were very good and clean, the F&B team was prefect and helpful and the quality of the food was up to our expectations, really thanks a lot. We would like thank Chef Mohamed the Executive Chef and his lovely team for them support and the organization during our stay and they made our event went very well also for the quality of the food and the quality of the product that they are using and also the atmosphere that they let us to feel, really we appreciate and for sure will come back when we visiting again. Also we would like to thank Chef Habib the Event…

Very bad experience and very bad service this hotel is used to hookers and prostitutes so they treat everyone as such and do not appreciate paying clients. Never setting foot back in this hotel or giving business to them and worldwide for that matter. God bless Accor group

I found this hotel very underwhelming. When I entered the room, I was assailed by an extreme musty smell which was extremely unpleasant. Thankfully, I was incredibly exhausted or I do not think the smell would have allowed me to sleep. In addition, the drain in the bath took an incredibly long time to drain.

All and all is good and brand on rendez-vous just little hiccups from some of the staff maybe lack of experience which is understandable due to covid and low activity. Definitely to use for my coming buz trips. The gym is good.

First real vacation in over a year and we were not disappointed. Staff, food, beverages and hotel were wonderful. Great location downtown which made it convenient for travel and walking. Would definitely stay if in Casablanca again!

Very clean and employees taking care of several steps to meet tall the COVID requirement s, to keep every one safe. very helpful friendly employees to answer your enquires to find needed information as well as it is and excellent location .

Excellent stay and food. Hotel and restaurant staff were pleasant, helpful and very courteous. The rooms were very comfortable. The restaurant staff was very engaging and personable. Very warm and welcoming. The property was beautiful as well, well presented.

It’s rare to experience hotel staff with such great service from top to bottom. While there were some issues due to the language barrier, we could feel their effort to communicate and meet our needs. Due to the promo we booked, we were upgraded to the executive suite. After the promo period ended, we were offered a package that included breakfast and dinner, and were generally just treated quite well during our 2-week stay. While there were some extremely inconvenient issues with our plumbing in the suite, to the point we needed to move suites. To our disappointment, the issues continued. Given the difficulty of running a hotel during Covid-19, I find it unreasonable to fault the staff for the issues caused by the disrepair of the hotel, but we did ask for some compensation.…

I came to Casablanca for work, the staff was really good and I felt safe, I liked the late room service, I slept in a large bright room, we were with a small group and everyone liked the hotel in the difficult context of the virus, we will come back in June if the virus is finally over.

It was a real pleasure to visit this place. The hotel is awesome, clean and everything was in place. The food is amazing. I'd like to thank Saissi Hassani Imane from the room service. She is an amazing lady and does her work in an absolutely great way. Thanks for everything

I had wonderful stay at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca. Starting with the staff, they were the most welcoming and caring people I have met recently in an hotel. Wonderful service and they even modified the breakfast menu to adapt to my request. The facility was well prepared and ready for COVID-19. Sanitizer gels everywhere, tissues to use for elevator buttons, careful set up in the dining area with the right spacing of the tables. I felt completely comfortable being in the hotel.

So the hotel is what you expect from a Hyatt hotel, breakfast, rooms and amenities are perfectly fine. On top of that, you always feel welcomed by beautiful Aoula, Sirbane, Badi and Ayoub. They made my trip and my breakfasts so much better. Thanks guys, hopefully we will see each other again next month, when I come back!

Had drinks at the bar. Bassma was amazing. Drinks were terrific as well. Great lounge and atmosphere. The facilities are to die for. The best place to rock in Morocco. Moroccan tea and coffee is a must have at this place

Had a wonderful stay here, hotel was lovely, clean and safe and service was excellent. Enjoyed sitting in the lounge for drinks-servers Abdullah and Chaimaa were fantastic and very friendly! Highly recommend!

column3: First time in Morocco, but not the last
column4: Beyond expectation- I had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt Regency in Casablanca---what an amazing hotel and staff (thanks Amina, Fatima, Bassma, Doha, Mani......) I was there primarily for business but had the opportunity to see the surrounding city. I look forward to my next trip.

Very nice and professional staff. Very well cleaned rooms. Perfect food in all restaurant. Location close to the city center. Walking distance to ocean and attractive monuments like medina or mosguet.

Very nice hotel with fitness centre, spa and in house night club. Pool were down for maintenance. Breakfast is served in just small room at 8th floor with not so much of variety. In general. It is very nice hotel.

The hotel is located in a very central location, behind the old Medina and close by to the Hassan II Mosque as well as the central market. The interior is modern and beautifully decorated with local and international style. The greatest part of the hotel though is its employees. They were all extremely friendly and attentive, always with a big smile in their face ready to help us in any way. The breakfast team was great every day making our day start wonderfully. Aoula and Ayoub were there every morning to attend to us with honest care and wonderful sense of hospitality. We visited also their Moroccan restaurant Dar Beida which offers live music and belly dancers and dinng experience in a Bedouin tent like environment. There Driovish was our main waiter and host giving us a…

I’ve been here for two weeks and will be staying for more. This hotel have it all; from the entrance where you are welcomed by the friendly concierges, and the charming lobby where you are greeted by the receptionist to make the necessary to book the room. Then comes the large rooms where you feel comfortable and the room service stuff who makes sure that you never be in lack of any of your needs or the cleanliness of the room ( thanks to Bouchra and Karim). When it comes to the breakfast you are welcomed with the lovely smile of Aoula who makes sure you get your perfect spot and the service is just great you are always watched in order to be served. Comes the gym section where Khaoula greets you as great as the gym is equipped! Seriously nothing is missing in this hotel!

column3: Extremely happy with my stay at Hyatt
column4: I have to say that the guys here at Hyatt bend over their backs and do everything in their power to ensure that your stay is as pleasant as possible! They take on board your requests, your feedback and are very reactive to their customers. All the staff are super friendly, super warm, respectful and ready to help at any point during your stay. The rooms are a food size, well kept and if tou stay here... you must must try their moroccan restaurant on the ground floor and stay for the belly dancing spectacle!

I stayed for one night only in Casablanca on my way from Marrakesh to Fez and I am Glad that I made the choice of using one of the Perks of being a Hyatt Member. I wish i could sojourn longer . I definitely will go back .

My son and I stayed for 2 nights in February and would definitely stay again! The hotel is beautiful, the breakfast is ample and delicious, and the staff is excellent. Malika, Jonas, Hamdi and many other hotel professionals took excellent care of us - we felt relaxed and completely comfortable. Thank you for making our first trip to Morocco so unforgettable. Anthea

column3: It’s people who make a hotel great
column4: I’m a Marriott Lifetime Titanium member and an Ambassador Elite member . A very loyal marriottite ! So was skeptical staying at a non Marriott hotel. But was pleasantly surprised by this one. I rarely stay at Hyatt’s and didn’t expect to treated anything more than an ordinary guest. But Amina Marhoum - the front office manager took no efforts to make sure this trip was great . Old hotel, rooms can be better - restaurants great, so are the meeting rooms - what sets it apart is the well groomed and ever smiling staff that want to make sure you’re always looked after. Location is great as well!

A comfortable elegant property in an excellent location. Spacious lobby and rooms with all the amenities- robe, slippers, nice bathroom, plug adapter, quality linens. Standouts are a fabulous breakfast in stunning setting with extensive variety of choices and tea with cookies in the lobby. Only complaint was following the many signs along the long way to the pool only to find it is under construction.

My second home, services, food, the people are the most part of this hotel the smiles the good nature of Moroccan people , the breakfast is always variety of food for all taste , I must thank Younis for his help and dear friend Jamal I can not mention all since you walk to the door in this hotel and you feel like you are at HOME

Terrible, is putting it lightly. This hotel has not been renovated for many decades. Its a disaster. Hyatt should remove their name from the property. The rooms look old and 'tired'. The only saving grace is the location and the staff. Location..........Cant get better. Its close to everything and is perfectly located for tourists. Staff.........Superb. They did everything possible to improve our stay and cover up for the disappointing rooms. Thanks to them we put up with the bad rooms and even enjoyed the rest of the hotel facilities, like the lounge and the breakfast. However, I must add that the breakfast was lavish and delicious. Don't stay in this hotel if you are a family with kids.........the bathroom has glass on all sides and is see-through. I had to stand outside…

Awesome hotel. Brought a family, including 3 teenagers. Iron-clad security. Perfect location. Great service. Don't miss the breakfast buffet. Really glad that we stayed here. Good beginning to a beautiful trip. Really enjoying the Hyatt brand-consistently solid.

An awesome trip....awesome city.... awesome hotel in stay put....loved the authenticity of the moroccan culture embarked in...the hotel staff is extremely warm and welcoming special thanks to aoula,ayoub,sirban,badr and others....

We were staying on after arriving with a small tour group. The hotel was a standard, good quality Hyatt Regency, but the staff services were both personal and effective and with great follow-up. They helped with sightseeing, boarding passes, transportation to the airport and local restaurant recommendations

Not much more to add. The room, staff, eateries were all better than expected. If I had to find a negative, the bed linen was perfectly adequate but nothing special. Only stayed a single night but wished it could have been longer.

column3: Hyatt Regency Casablanca Home away from Home
column4: Outstanding service, respectful staff, willing to do better each time, everytime. Highly recommended in casablanca. tried others as well but these people are excellent even if they are busy and having full capacity,

The staff is very kind. The breakfast service lady called me by my name starting 2nd day :) Also the breakfast manager was so kind. He prepared a small box of dates that I liked so much. Thanks to the management that they have very good staff.

Right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city! The service given by the staff there is great! Friendly and helpful. They give out delicious Moroccan Mint Tea as welcome drink and some traditional snacks. The breakfast itself is not that good. Wish they have more variety and better taste.

This is one of the nicest hotels we stayed at in Morocco. Contemporary with large well appointed rooms with beautiful woodwork. Split bathroom with tub and walk in shower. Large ledge for suitcases. Excellent staff. Highly recommend. Hope this helps.

The Bar is cosy and classy with a relaxed and luxurious atmosphere. There’s a vast choice of drinks although the single malt selection was a bit limited the day of my visit. The service was impressive and impeccable under the commends of Marwa that makes sure you are provided a distinguished service with the smile and warm welcome.

column3: Bad experience stays at City view room for two nights
column4: We stay for two nights at the city view room. The reception did not provide any options for us to choose which side we want for the city view. We had to see the view without the Hassne tower which is totally not we want. The room facility was not functioning well and they still did not fix them until we left the space. Overall not worth the money at all.

column3: The Bar .... a MUST in Casablanca
column4: Since arriving in Casablanca we have enjoyed the Hotel Bar on a daily basis! Service is outstanding overseen by Marwa who welcomes you by name with a smile no matter what time it is. The service is white gloved trained! Congratulations to the Hyatt for having such a professional team overseeing the Bar!

Very pleased of.our stay in hyatt regency casablanca We had the 624 , very nice room We love the breakfast area and staff , very well.organized special.thanks to.all the hotel staff and specially malika in.the breakfast , zakaria and omar and hassan ,very professional and very.kind , also the.manager yuness very helpfull and professional See u next time Monica

Our family of four stayed at the Hyatt from December 24th till the 31st. We are grateful to the Regency Club team leader, Abderahim Houmiri. He welcomed us each day with a gracious smile and made all our requests come true. Hassan, our regency club staff was exceptional and always was a pleasure to talk to. He was great with the kids as was everyone. The concierge was excellent as were the front door staff. The hotel is beautiful and is in the best location of Casablanca. Highly recommend!

One of best staff service that I have received in all of my hotel stays. Specially, Club staff went above and beyond expectation. Selection of food both for breakfast and evening snacks was amazing. If you visit Casablanca, I highly recommend this hotel!

Overall good experience There is significant improvement in room cleanness and upgrade for some utilities of the rooms and hotel Resturant need more attention in the diversity of offered food and freshness of food

We stayed in Hyatt Regency Casablanca in between 03-04.12.2019 , We would like to thank you very much for the perfect accomadition. All stuff were perfect , A special thanks to Ms.Merve and Ms.Şeyma from Lobby Bar who were really professional and perfectly to know how acting on costumer requests, always smiling face , ready to answer for all questions , Thank you once again. Mehmet Gencoglu - Ozan Aksel

Hi I would like to thank you for the excellent service at the time of my stay in the hotel .. Especially the employee, Asmaa room service, was very kind and quick to provide the service thank you ....

column3: 5 star hotel in centre of Casablanca
column4: Hyatt Regency is a prestige hotel in the centre of Casablanca. Rooms are beautiful. Hotel is within easy reach of many attractions, restaurants, etc. Hotel has all amenities including free wifi ad internet.

The hotel was rather good and the services were awesome. I had one of my best time during my stay by picked up to stay this hotel. The bar was really amazing to have all sorts of beverages. Additionally, the breakfast was amazing. Based upon what I have been cited above is that I liked this hotel wide spectrum of reasons that I have attached. Despite of the fact that this hotel was so expensive to stay, all the reasons definitely it was worthless to stay.

We stayed here as part of a tour. The breakfasts in the morning were very nice. It was nice having different items available & tasting local specialties. The room was very nice and we enjoyed our stay. It was close to alot of things and we felt very safe & secure here at the hotel.

The hotel was very good and clean the services excellent, the lobby stuff was very supportive espacially Basma she give me very good service and support thank you alot also i recomend always to stay there

column3: The best of my experiences in very good hotel with great location
column4: I had best time during my stay with fantastic friendly staff from the reception to lobby Bar and specially in room service Ms Asmaa gave me very good service and support. I would like to thank the Hotel management for this type of service .

As a Globalist, I prefer having tea and coffee in the Regency Club in the morning but this Club doesn't open until 11:00 AM now. I really don't like going thru the lobby for this. Please reopen the Regency Club in the mornings again. Also, it seems that they cut the staff to the Club as well. I really liked having a staff member always there to help with anything needed or questions. Otherwise they stay was good and the staff are excellent, especially, Houmiri, Hamdi El Khaoua, Abdellah in the Regency Club and cafe M, Naciri in the Regency Club and Cafe M, and the rest are great.

The hotel is simply great, whats makes it even better is the staff, during breakfast we had the best service they were all friendly specially Ayoub and Hana with their lovely smile, Younes teaches you about morrocan food and ofcourse the chef Shams el den that prepares the best food of the moroccan cuisine.

Best experience.. we had the best time in the hotel ... best staff they were very freindly and helpful especially Ayoub, Younes and chef Shams il deen in the breakfast erea. Thank you a lot ... highly recommended 😍❤

Friendly and welcoming greeting with water and cookies upon arrival, inviting lobby with nice furniture and good music (especially in the evening); responsive staff, convenient location, great bar/atmosphere.

We arrived at the hotel and were quickly provided our room. A nice spacious room with small refrigerator, large shower and separated toilet. A writing desk also was found. We slept comfortably and got up early for our flight. A bulb blew in the bathroom in the early hours of the morning. All lights failed except for the two floor night lights. The phone was providing a dial tone but none of the hotel contact numbers were operable. Mist frustrating!!!!

Let me start by saying. The staff is excellent, from the easy check in, by the nice front desk to housekeeping, everyone was pleasant and trying to make our trip great. We were upgraded to a suite, which is huge. The bathroom was clean and there was lots of room. They include robes and a hairdryer. The internet is fast and easy to sign on to. Tonight we will try the hotel morrocan resteraunt. The location is in the middle of everything. The only drawback is thevyour ride from the airport, besides that this is a nice place to stay in casablanca

column3: A place to stay in Casablanca
column4: Very well located in the heart of downtown. Aimable staff always happy to help and support. Thé restaurants offer very tasty dishes. The Hotel is a bit old fashioned but still very clean and well kept!

First, the staff is wonderful an that makes for a good experience. The hotel is high end appearing with a very good feel to it. There is attention to detail and a nice feel to the place. Rooms are a little tight, but still quite nice. The hotel is busy and some fleshing up is needed in a few areas. Like worn hassocks in the rooms and safes that are well used.Very nice breakfast buffet. All-in-all, a good place to stay in Casablanca.

Aside from the location, this Hyatt has little to offer. The rooms were clean, but the hotel is somewhat run down. It was quiet, but that may because our room was away from the street side of the building. If you are in Casablanca, look for a better place.

column3: The worst experience in Hyatt or any 5 stars hotel ever
column4: In general the hotel's hygiene is disgusting: 1 -there were cockroaches in the breakfast area 2 - the hotel corridors stink of sewage 3- the condition floor/carpet is disastrous 4 - the lunch experience in the lounge was disgusting: i was served a salad with rotten and very old vegetables. the cutlery's smell was horrendous ( I had to change it two times) and the hygiene in the lounge (sofas and floor) was filthy. 5 - The staff's general dress code and demeanor was poor to say the least and attitude even worse.

Been there just for one night as we were finishing a tour and spending the last night at the Movenpick, such a difference, the Hyatt being not just a better hotel but the service quality was also years light. Location was good for what Casablanca is, the sitting for breakfast was not the best as well as the food variety seen in others Morocco hotels (ie. Sofitel)...but it was a good place to spend our last night in Casablanca/Morocco.

I stayed at the Hyatt at the beginning and at the end of my trip. The hotel stored my luggage and took care of it very well. The service was excellent. All the personnel were very courteous and always helpful. The rooms were huge. And they were clean. The beds were very comfortable. But I felt the hotel was old and half renovated. The cookies at the entrance tasted fresh and was a huge plus. Breakfast was okay but not worth the price. Too many options outside with delicious pastries and coffee for much much cheaper. I was not happy with the toilet though. It was separate from the shower area. The toilet was so tiny that u cannot use the doors without touching the walls. I stayed in 2 rooms and both rooms had a problem with the toilet size and doors. Once closed it was…

I have stayed again at the Hyatt in Casablanca, a really nice hotel in the middle of the center of the city. Excellent service and very friends staff. Most stay here I only can say. The view to the Moschee is stunning. Just opposite you have the authentic souk. At the hotel, please visit Cafe M. The menu is great, food& service outstanding.

We checked in after 5 pm and one of our rooms was not ready- a first after many years with Hyatt. I asked to change some bills but they told me they had run out of cash. The next day I got a tour through the hotel, I asked them if I could charge it to the room and they said yes. After the tour was over with, they charged me 8% because I wanted to charge it to my room. I told them that I was never told that, but they still charged me the 8%. I asked again, to change some bills and again I was told that they had run out. When I aked them why they never had any bills- she relied "Sir we are not a bank". The next day when I asked to chenge bills again they would only do $100. It would not hurt for the girls in the reception area to smile more. The plaza across the street is very…

The hotel still keeps its position as a business venue in the city center of Casablanca. It is few steps from the old town. Good service and staff. It needs upgrade of its rooms, club lounge and elevators.

Hyatt Regency is the best hotel in Casablanca, the location is perfect, you feel very welcome and everyone from the front door till you leave are doing their best to make your stay a memorable pleasant experience, guys at the main restaurant are extremely nice especially « Hassan » a tall guy with glasses :) , very polite and try his best to let you feel comfortable and he gets to know the guest name without asking you and use it to personalize the service and raise it to a higher level, the quality of food is premium, the room service is quick when you ask for something or food in the room, only in the last day the cleaning of the room wasn’t at the same level, my room was noisy and you hear a loud music 🎼 in the afternoon, the mini bar has a small room for personal use as it…

I was trying Hyatt regency in Casablanca for the first time in the hotel. I was expected a much hiher level considering the reputation and the prices level. Do hope that they were with too much people in the same time ...but is it a reason...?

The rooms are large and comfortable. Breakfast was very good - try the amazing Moroccan pancakes. The hotel has restaurants or venture out to the local places within walking distance. In fact, the hotel is walking distance to the souk and the Hassan II Mosque. The staff here was excellent however the waiters and waitresses need more training. The other issue is that you do not have access to the refrigerator in the room if you want to leave a bottle of water and you must give a credit card to the front desk. Also there is a musty odor in the halls and the hotel needs a bit of an uplift. That being said, I would definitely stay here again.

Good quality of the hotel in general even if the location is not the best of the city. Good quality of staff especially at the restaurants, entrance. Less quality at the lobby. Rooms are big and well cleaned. Pool house and swimming pool are great.

This beautiful, modern, upscale (really world class) hotel is set in a lovely gated property in the center of Casablanca, a short walk to busy streets and boulevards, public buildings, restaurants and shops,a bustling public plaza,and the city's old medina. The ground floor lobby is elegant, and is home to, among other things, two excellent restaurants. The rooms are spacious, modern, comfortable. The staff is polite and helpful. This would be an excellent place to stay when you visit Casablanca.

An oasis of calm and splendour in the heart of the bustling city! Staff were all incredibly polite, friendly and attentive. The concierge guided me expertly on how best to navigate the bazars and local area. Highly recommend!

column3: The best business hotel in the city I guess
column4: As compared to other heritage cities in Morocco, Casablanca is a bit bland; there isn't much to see except the second largest Mosque in the world which is within (bearable) walking distance from Hyatt. Hyatt is located in the centre of the old; although there are some new 5-star hotels coming up in the newer part of the city near the port area. The old city is more accessible and convenient. I didn't use much of the facilities of the hotel because I stayed there for only 3 days, there isn't much to explore in Casablanca. My only comment on Hyatt is that it is value for money by international standards. Room is clean and services are good; i.e. I got what I expected without any hassle. The porter has been extremely helpful. We booked a car from the tour agent to take use…

This hotel is offering great interior local design and spacious rooms with all amenities, some facing the famous Hassan II Mosque, the 5th largest in the world and the world's second tallest minaret at 210 metres. Great service, excellent food and nice pool area.

to be honest with you i grow with this building since it start at 1984, such a huge experince that maybe it s a personal feeling that is one of the best tranaing hotel in the country, and maybe it sush a huge issue to keep it on on behalf of what s going on the world to non-consistency of the aims targets no need to go to morocco and to not cross or even step by one of the best hotel spirits employee in the world

I’ve been coming to Casablanca for over 40 years and I have stayed in this hotel even before it was Hyatt Regency. It is like coming home for me. Excellent service, rooms overlooking the old Medina good food even a Moroccan cabaret in the Moroccan restaurant. To the right-hand side of the hotel just after the car park and slightly hidden is the British Anglican Church and cemetery that dates back to the 19th century. The Church now has an international congregation and the old cemetery is worth a visit.

Very well located next to the Medina and the souk. Tip hotel with top staff. Especially Marie Claire and Fatima Zahra. I would recommend this hotel for family vacation as it will also take 15 minutes to beach by car

The Hyatt Regency Casablanca is well situated downtown for business. That is, in my opinion, what this hotel is good for, is a business hotel. Otherwise, I wouldn't stay here. It is directly across the street from the old Souk, but if you've been to Marrakech or Fez, you don't need to go to this souk. We had a room on the concierge level. The club serves a nice breakfast and nice afternoon snacks, so you don't need to go down to the restaurant unless you want something bigger or more. Housekeeping provides bottles of water in the room. The room was weird...odd shaped, water closet was immediately upon entering, but the sink and bathroom were near the bed, not the toilet, which is not hygienic, and is weird! The downstairs lounge and bar area allow smoking inside (!!)…

The hotel is old. Avoid tram station facing rooms as outside noise can wake you up full night. During my stay there was a concert outside and the noise is highly audible in rooms facing tram station. However staff are very friendly and try to serve you at their best.

Great Experience. Very helpful staff, the concierge in particular! Highly recommended hotel. Probably the best in Casablanca I have experienced in many years. The food was great - the moroccan restaurant is a must.

It is a clean hotel directly in the city. Walking distance to the center. The hotel was build decades ago but is kept in good shape. There are things I would change, but you can live without this. E.g. you cannot open the window, because somebody built a drywall balk above the window, or the toilet door is opening inside (cannot imagine if somebody is falling off inside, how they can open it), or the breakfast is served on low-level tables (quite uncomfortable). But the personnel is nice and helpful.

great experience at Hyatt hotel Casa, my prefered hotel in casablanca ! Staff is very helpful and friendly, rooms are big. Enjoy the swimming pool and gym As for the view on the Great Mosquee : it's just magic

On the surface, Hyatt Regency Casablanca appears to be another Hyatt Regency standard hotel but problems with porters, wifi, housekeeping and laundry gave me serious cause for concern. Hotel claims it won't happen again. Lets hope so.

I loved my stay at the Hyatt regency Casablanca, has a great location beautiful large rooms high security at the lobby entrance , staff very attentive easy access to nearby attraction one of the main market across the street behind the hotel.

I left a paid-for “4-star hotel” to stay here and it was totally worth it. The Hyatt renewed my faith in the city and the continent. The concierge booked two trips for me which were unavailable at the “4-star hotel” nearby.

Three day stay at the Hyatt Casablanca, our first visit to this city. Very warm welcome from all staff. Special mention for Kassy, the restaurant manager, who kindly looked after us during the “ftour” evening meal of Ramadan. Our 10th floor room was spacious and had a good outlook. The hotel location is very central, within walking distance of the train station and the Medina. Recommended !

The bed was great, the lobby is elegant, with stylish decor.And the bathrooms have both tub and walk-in shower. The rooms have irons, a luggage bench for two suitcases and spiffy decor. What a treat! The location is central and cabs are easy to find.

We had a pleasant stay at the hotel. Unfortunately it was marred by two occasions where we were disappointed by the service attitudes of the staff. One of the conceige was very dismissive when we asked for some information regarding restaurants. He was curt n dismissive. He only recommended one eatery (it was nice but we wanted alternatives ). The other incident was in the hotel's cafe. We ordered french toast and couple of eggs. After 10 minutes they brought us plain toast. It could be the waiter misunderstood our order but after another 10 minutes, no sign of the French toast or eggs.considering the cafe only had a few customers at that time. We left without any breakfast. Pure waste of time. Very disappointed coming from a hyatt.

Nice hotel, good location, close to the marina. The restaurants in the hotel are great. The French restaurant was outstanding. The room, bedding, view, and amenities were great at the level above expectations.

We loved our club room and the staff was great. When we checked in around 2 pm, we asked the concierge for a great place for late lunch. He told us to walk behind the hotel to La Sqala restaurant. But we got lost on the way through the medina and finally walked back to the hotel and grabbed a cab. The first concierge was not very clear with directions. We met Handit, another the concierge later at night and he was more passionate and helpful over the first concierge. We asked him to help change our train ticket to first class to Marrakech and he went above and beyond. He even circled and showed us on a map how to walk to La Sqala restaurant. We loved this place for lunch. Delicious and nice garden patio. Lots of construction around Casablanca near the ocean. We saw the famous…

We booked a club room with twin beds and was given a room with a king. After raising this fact they send in an extra bed which is the worst in comfort of all hotel room beds ever. Cleaning personal did not do a good job cleaning either. The bed spread was very crumbled and not enough towels were given. The lady at check in could not be any worse. No explanation of where the lounge is, when its open, what amenities are available. No conversation or explanation at all. Meantime she took multiple phone calls and giggling with the person on the other line while checking us in. Unprofessional. The price paid was far higher than the value received. I am a marriott member and always stays with marriott. This time there was no marriott was available so decided to try hyatt. What a…

Very nice stay and staff are very hospitality, restaurant is not big but team are very helpful to organize it, room is very nice and clean, swimming pool was not opened yet , 3 lifts are working, very pleasant stay.

The staff was very kind and extremely helpful when we needed help to arrange doctor's visit, to extend our stay unexpectedly and change our transportation reservation. We enjoyed the room & service very much!

Everything was great and the staff was amazing. The rooms are very nice; a couple issues with comestic in bathroom and restroom but overall a wonderful hotel. Next time i travel back i will be staying there. Thank you

column3: Hyatt Regency Casablanca Home away from Home
column4: This property in Casablanca is one of the best, I am visiting same for last 6 years and their service does not fluctuate and always try to make the experience better also good thing is they try to take any issues personally and put every effort to solve it.

Really good hotel and very good food, service was excellent, however second floor had some noises due to water running In the faucet Location was good due to the closeness of some restaurants and the bazaar

excellent stay, courteous staff! thanks to the team for dedicated response to my questions and needs, happy to recommend the hotel and team for another stay and to colleagues internally at my firm. well done!

column3: Amazing Lobby, Gym & Lounge - Superb Location & Service
column4: We have stayed at Hyatt Regency Casablanca on business and totally loved the experience! Starting with the arrival, the impressive & spacious entrance area, with Palm trees and a natural garden feeling - right in the centre of town, amazing! The red carpet entrance almost had a colonial style feeling, a beautiful welcome. The lobby is amazing, very spacious with sufficient lounge/seating areas. Since our stay was for business, we always found a nice spot to work on emails or conference calls (Wifi speed is amazing!). What also stands out is the gym (!!). Open 24/7 with vibrant music that really motivates and encourages ones performance as well as the latest, super design technno gym equipment. My personal favorite was the large outside terrace, where one could do stretching…

Stayed 3 nights on a first visit in Casablanca. Well positioned to explore the old city and souk right behind hotel. Tram station across the road. Our room had a lovely view of the Hassan mosque. Most comfortable bed and pillows and bathroom with bath and shower. As you would expect of the Hyatt all of high standard. The lobby and bar area well designed and inviting space to linger. Friendly service and delicious breakfast.

This hotel is very upscale, and quite expensive, but our room was beautifully done and the service at the desk was excellent. The wifi was quite fast, and they even provide free coffee for the room with one of those makers that use coffee pods.

column3: If you like paying over the top for a mediocre rooms that stink of stale smoke this is the place for you
column4: Never again - there were no redeeming features - yet they charge £250 per night, so you expect it to be nice. Rooms smelt of stale smoke - open the window and you just hear the road noise from outside.

Expensive for the area- did not get the room I booked and rooms looked tired-did not venture outside as a colleague was followed and returned to the hotel- room smelt of smoke- going back the the 4 seasons next week and for 2 weeks in April

column3: Best option if you have business in the city...
column4: Great Hotel and so much better than the Sofitel down the road. Staff very friendly and very comfortable, well appointed rooms. Don’t take the ‘taxi’ option for the airport transfer, go for the hotel car.

column3: Nice hotel, great location for walking
column4: This is a good hotel option for location, the lobby was beautiful, as was the living room hotel bar. Service is great as well. The rooms are slightly above average, nicely appointed, etc. I’d recommend the Dar Beida restaurant just off the lobby, very cool atmosphere, the fabrics and decor make it oddly quiet. Food is excellent as well. There was a live band as well as performers later in the evening.

column3: Lovely hotel... too bad we only stayed one night
column4: Beautiful hotel with all the amenities you would expect, including wifi, minibar, hair dryer and room safe. This is a relatively large hotel but the room was very quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was a lavish affair with numerous types of salads, fruit platters, hot and cold cereals, coffee and tea, eggs and omelettes, and very good bread. The hotel is well situated near the medina and we were able to access the market there quite easily. We went early so some of the stalls weren't open yet, but it was still fun to walk around and look at the different wares being offered for sale.

This is a beautiful hotel in its common areas, bar and restaurants, but we stayed in a Club level room and I was not impressed. The room had a strong musty smell, and the carpet was probably as old as the building – these rooms are in serious need of an upgrade. Despite being a Hyatt; I don’t believe the room was up to Hyatt standards in other countries; the room was very small with two tiny beds. I realize rooms and beds are smaller in other countries, but I would think a chain as large and well-known as Hyatt would make an effort to have their guest rooms be as spacious as possible regardless of the country. The food in the Club Lounge was just OK – not nearly as delicious or plentiful as I’ve experienced at other Hyatt Club Lounges. The front desk staff were friendly and…

column3: What a difference a team makes
column4: I had such an amazing experience with the team at the Hyatt Casablanca. Mr. Houmiri especially was very attentive, made me feel at home and was always welcoming as if I were a family member. I also had great service at breakfast with Asma and Abdelkabir. I want to thank you so much for making my stay special. The outside of the hotel is nothing to look at. I was actually a little worried when I saw it. But once inside the lobby is very welcoming in wood tones with a fire place. The rooms are average. Though the bed is very comfortable. The Moroccan restaurant is very good and the musicians were great.

I found it very odd that our king sized bedroom had a see-through door for the bathroom. There wasn’t enough privacy. Also, the toilet was in a small separate cubicle which was not connected to the bathroom. There was no sink in the area with the toilet so you would have to walk all the way across the room to wash your hands after using the bathroom. This was very inconvenient because if the other person in the bedroom was in the shower and you had to use the toilet, then you would have to wait to wash your hands

One of Best hotels in Casablanca. This hotel stands out for 2 things, its majestic lobby and caring staff. Honestly no other hotel can compete with their breakfast, Liège waffle, madeleine chocolate orange flower, brioche with pink pralines, Iberian ham, selection without gluten ..... incredible and it is renewed every week ... Hyatt Regency club lounge is really a big plus for loyal guests, a great time to relax with colleagues and / or guests I've been coming to Casa for many months and the Hyatt Regency is the only one to offer 2 upscale restaurants, one room Brand new gym, a large outdoor pool and a hamman / sauna included in the price. The rooms are not the most modern but they are comfortable and of good size.

My room was 404 which 4th floor. Look at the pic, it's spectacular view of Al Hassan II mosque.. I really enjoyed this view in evening, morning, and night too! Their breakfast buffet was great with lots of option of Moroccan meals.. loved their breads.. hmmm lovely

I have been staying at the Hyatt for my business travel for many years now. The rooms have been renovated but the shower needs to upgrade. Still has the old fashioned hot and cold water separate knobs instead of shower mixer. The breakfast has undergone a change but feel the old style was better. Overall this hotel is for business travelers only.

column3: Nice hotel in the heart of Casablanca
column4: Stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel is clean, well appointed and the staff are friendly and helpful. Stayed on 8th floor Regency Club and had complementary breakfast and cocktails from 6-8 at night. Well worth it.

Extremely more than worse location, very noisy, heavy trafic and pedestrians within the hotel area , not clean , weird location of bathroom within the room , taxi drivers go inside hotel looking for quests

A grand building located not too far from the Hassan II mosque and the souks. We arrived and struggled up the steps at the entrance of the hotel with our luggage. It must have been an entertaining sight since the staff were looking at us through the glass doors without moving a muscle. Glad to have made their day. Seeing how welcoming the staff were, we asked for a smoking room so we wouldn’t have to keep going to the lobby. A smoking room we got, with a very active smoke detector. The alarm went off and in the midst of my ear drums bursting, I called the reception and they told me they will call someone. No one came. So we waited out the alarm. For the longest time. It made me realise how much my ears were able to take, and how much we forget to enjoy the silence. Reflection…

Splendid Hotel. Excellent is the staff who are in vast numbers available to the guests and upright friendly and correct delivering prompt and personal service. You don't even have to ask. When they see you wondering, they approach you instantly, find out what the issue is and resolve it instantly. Only few remarks - my room door was due for some maintenance. The breakfast area is too small and moreover beautifully decorated and furnished but extremely unpractical and uncomfortable - urgently review required.

column3: nice location- property allows smoking in the lobby
column4: Seems the norm in Morrocco is to allow smoking inside the buildings. If you can get through the smokers the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Club access is very nice and the happy hours make for an enjoyable evening. Reserving a view of the mosque was a good choice. If you have the hotel get a car for the airport make sure they have discussed the payment with the driver in advance. We asked for a car to be reserved and they pulled a taxi off the street. Made for a very unpleasant ride when he berated us for more money the entire time to the airport.

What a fantastic hotel, guest experience and holiday. Amazing hotel - the members of staff were so helpful. Fantastic food and beverage. We would go back in a heartbeat. Casablanca is amazing and the hotel is equally amazing.

This is an exception hotel. Service is quick, professional and friendly. Rooms are spacious and well furnished. The lobby and facilities are well decorated and welcoming. Staying at this hotel while in Casablanca was a pleasure. Highly recommended!

We stayed here for a night each time transiting into and out of Morocco, and were totally satisfied with our choice. Especially since we were traveling with a two-year old. The hotel is very plush, with a fabulous lobby and very hospitable staff. The rooms, while pretty small for the price we paid (and the only reason why we wont give all five stars), were comfortable nonetheless. The location of the hotel couldn't be better: right across the medina gate. The tram stop is also just across the road, which can take you to the train station easily. The square in front is very happening on weekends. The breakfast was absolutely royal: fabulous dining area with an incredible choice of food. I would honestly stay here for the breakfast alone. Wifi is awesome, and the staff arranges…

column3: Low service mindset & Not recommended to go with children
column4: The hotel itself is modern and nice and is situated in a convenient location. Rooms are large and well equipped. Breakfast buffet is fine as well. The issue with this hotel is the poor service mentality. For example room was available much later than promised (1,5 hrs waiting in stead of 30 mins mentioned at check in) and non cleaning of room during day (housekeeping had tried at 09:00 when we were still asleep and room was locked from inside, which they took as a sign that we did not want our room to be cleaned that day). However most disappointing was the fact that we were staying there on New Year’s Eve with two young children. We wanted to attend the dinner that was organised but menu was not at all sutable for kids (lobster, dishes incl. alcohol etc.). When we asked for a…

We stayed for two nights at this property and were blown away by the service. The property is very nice (room was great and exactly what we expected from pictures/description) but what sets this hotel head and shoulders above others in the area is the staff. They went above and beyond to make us feel at home and welcome. Will highly recommend this property to anyone we know visiting Casablanca.

I am always biased when it comes to Hyatt, they are my hotel of choice. You are always going to get great service, great rooms and a pleasure to stay. This hotel is no different. Lovely rooms and an oasis of calm

We were in Casablanca just for one night at the beginning of our group trip to Morocco and location is everything when you have only one night to explore the city.
