This hotel is located away from the beaches where the Four Seasons and other nice hotels are. Besides that the room was smelled mold and dated. It was our tour company that made this bad choice. Be aware to have a good start for your trip.

column3: More like a Park Hyatt than a Hyatt Regency!
column4: No offense to the Regency brand but this particular property is in a category and class of its own. From the distinctive scent that greets you when you enter to the fabulous spa and breakfast presentation, this is a benchmark for excellence in Casablanca.

Casa business Tripservice was perfect. Special mention to Abderahim au regency club et Kamel (manager).!definitely the best place for business trip in Casablaca. regency club (level 8th) really convenient with a VIP Service. worthy! will recommend itThanks. Driss

The property overall is very good, nice rooms, good service and decent buffet spread. Located in the heart of the city meant that you have the pros and cons - the real Casablanca comes to life just outside the hotel. Crowded, flea market on the street, traffic is a mess and filthy. If there isn’t a location reason to be here then there are better locales and hotels that one could go to

Visted casablanca for one week business , Hyatt is located in downtown, exceptional experience , staff highly professional, available , and very supportive . You can choose to get the accès to the 8th floor for an open bar starting 6pm till’8 for an after work to relax. And get some fun .. highly recommended

After traveling 23 hours from California, USA to Morocco, I was delighted to be staying at the Hyatt Casablanca for a night before my journey in Morocco began. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The Club Lounge provided a nice place to relax while grabbing a snack. We had lunch in the lobby restaurant and the food was very good. I had the seafood pasta - highly recommended. The only drawback is if your room faces the ocean / mosque and if on a weekend night, you might hear the young adults yelling in the streets after the clubs close (around 3am). If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on the other side of the building.

Average service. The hotel could be better with room service and taxi service. It has a nice lobby but the rooms is old with old shower plus the room’s door is not safe any can optthe door. Even the breakfast is expensive with average quality

column3: A nice business hotel with a Morrocan touch
column4: The beds are a bot to hard for me , but that is personal . Staff is very friendly and helpfull. It is a pity that the surrounding of the hotel ( the strreet ) are so dirty. Casablanca must have been a very beautiful city in the past but it needs to be refreshed . It is not a tourist destination. Despite the beautiful Hassan II Mosque . A lot of project are going on in the city and once they are finished i light come back as a tourist.

After a week of touring Morocco and staying in very comfortable Riads around the country which we really enjoyed, it was such a pleasure to spend our last night in Morocco at the Hyatt Regency. The room was large, the bathroom and separate shower a real pleasure and a comfortable bed with large pillows an added luxury. The full breakfast enough of an offering to keep one going for the whole day and the coffee a real bonus after the offering at the riads. The wi-fi in the room took some time to connect on all our devices. The staff from porterage to concierge to reception and housekeeping were all friendly, efficient and a credit to Hyatt. other than breakfast, we did not use the food and beverage facilities, but the hotel is so well located that we opted for a little more local…

column3: Excellent room, service, food and meeting rooms
column4: A 5 star hotel with excellent rooms, very clean, good service, friendly staff. Good atmosphere. Abundant breakfast. Short drive to the great mosque and other touristic attractions. Comfortable bed, large room and bath/shower room.

Found this hotel to be excellent and very accommodating especially for business travel and meetings. The nightclub in the building however is rarely full but when it is its particularly accommodating.

Nice stay at Hyatt Regency Casablanca. A very central location in the middle of the action in a very very busy city. Close to Hassan Mosque and corniche. Had one meal here & the restaurant was good. Would recommend

The location is very good. I arrived at the Port Casa station at 10pm but still felt safe to walk to the hotel. The road was very busy. The standard is good, like any other Hyatt around the world. Breakfast was good with many choices and good service. The view from room towards medina and great mosque is very nice.

Great hospitality infrastructure with a prestigious lobby and a central location near the railway station, the port of Casablanca and the big plazza of United nations. The big plus is definitely the breakfast time. They deliver amazing fresh, healthy and tasty food with many options. The service and the buffet are very helpful to enjoy and start the morning. They are many possibilities to explore the city around the hotel. I recommend this hotel for business or leasure especially for pedestrians.

column3: Nice and comfortable, but nothing to write home about
column4: Our room was good, breakfast in the lobby had lots to choose from, drinks in the bar were expensive and the staff didn't seem that knowledgeable on procedures. Only spent a night there and nothing really stood out for me.

column3: Excellent hotel, very good service, in the center
column4: It is an excellent hotel with good rooms, fine bedding, there are good facilities also for a long stay: restaurant with good food, bar, good breakfast, and a very kind and friendly service. Parking is also available. Ambience in the hall and in the meeting room is beautiful.

Just spend a week within Hyatt Casablanca, the best hotel in the city, very professional team, extremely good services and assets.Very comfortable room. Nice stay at the heart of Casablanca, always a pleasure to be there

column3: Stayed for the pool on our last day in Casa...it was closed
column4: Chose this over the Four Seasons for two reasons 1) served alchol - Four Seasons Casablanca does not. 2) the pool. We wanted to relax by a pool for our last day in Casablanca. Got there and it was closed. Disappointing.

Stayed in CASABLANCA for some meetings and chose the Hyatt regency. The hotel doesn’t seem like it is in the best part of town, but I think that is indicative of the whole city. Rooms were great and hotel staff were on this game the whole time.

Very convention oriented! Very congested (like the city) not very friendly, SMELLS LIKE CRAZY IN THE ROOMS!!!! LOTS OF MOLD!!!!!!! Doors are heavy and keep slamming all night with guests coming in and out so forget about a good night sleep! Obviously made for businessmen ! Food was very good, had a good dinner (service was not great)and breakfast was plentiful and varied. But that’s it!

Stayed here for a week during a business trip. The hotel is 35 years old, in the heart of Casa's old district, does not look so old from the inside. The lobby has a dark decor with many seating areas that work well as a meeting point or a place for a quick coffee before going out to the bustling streets and the adjacent old medina. The room was great in size, spotless, and offering great sleep quality and excellent bathroom size and amenities. Tried the three food outlets; Bissat for breakfast was perfect in quality but poor in varieties, Dar Bida for dinner is a must with all its Moroccan cuisine options and the French Cafe M that was top by all means in terms of creativity and taste. Business rooms as well provided a great experience in terms of types of equipment and…

column3: Do not take the highest floor
column4: As this was the first night on our roundtrip we came in pretty late, so we just went too bed...only to find out that if you are on the highest floor there is a permanent thrumm from the a/c of the Hotel. Not the individual one for the room, but the main thing for the whole building. Otherwise the room was up to expected Standards the breakfast was also ok and if you do like dark decor with bright point lights it if ok for a night.

column3: Nice hotel but not worth the price
column4: Stayed here for almost a week for a conference. I’d have given it a 3 but the staff were super. The hotel has some nice attributes- lovely pool; helpful, multilingual staff; well appointed rooms; plentiful bottled water. Beds were very comfortable. I liked the decor- pictures of old Casablanca in the common areas, various shades of white in the conference rooms, Moroccan touches throughout w/o being touristy. The negatives were that no matter where you stayed it was noisy- on one side of the hotel there was a band playing until 11 pm every night on the plaza and on the other you were woken up by the call to prayer early every morning. The windows seemed to block out very little of the noise- Not ideal for jet lagged business travelers. Other issues were small- but important.…

column3: Impressive Service, Professional Staff, 1st Class Appointments
column4: We loved this hotel – the rooms are very well appointed, very clean, the Nespresso machine in the room a very welcome touch. Two main restaurants, we tried both – importantly for us, they are both open late - indeed, in Casablanca, things don't get really going in the dining scene till after 21h00. The Moroccan restaurant also offers Moroccan music and a belly dancer - very welcoming to the weary traveller. The selection of Moroccan wines was very good and not expensive. The French Brasserie is also one of Casablanca's top restaurants. A feature of the hotel is the lobby - here you will see a cross-section of Casablanca's society - while you sip your cocktails and if you are so inclined, have a cigar! Even numbered rooms have a view of the fantastic Hassan II Mosque and the old…

Friendly staff and great location: The serves were seamless. It promotes green and environmentally-friendly living styles by reminding guests to save energy/water. The location is excellent making it easier to explore Casablanca from each angle.

Class has a name in Casa: The Hyatt Regency Hotel. What I like most about the hotel, is the spacious lobby, which gradually turns into the hotel bar. This has been nicely done! The bar has a lot of seating arrangements, some of which are just a little bit uncomfortably crowded and close together. The back part of the bar doubles as the breakfast venue. This is a nice touch: it really makes the this big space lobby-bar-restaurant the beating heart of the hotel. The rooms are ok, for what you pay for them. Nothing more, nothing less. Nothing to complain about, nothing to rave about.

column3: Great spot with a lot of energy
column4: This is a very western hotel in the middle of the fun of Casablanca. While the lobby is very smokey, the rooms are clean and don't smell of smoke. The pool is small but very nice. The fitness facilities are state of the art. The on-site restaurant with music and belly dancing is entertaining but very loud.

If you want a nice place to stop for a quiet cool drink out of the sun and hustle and bustle of Casablanca then I can recommend the lobby bar of the Hyatt Regency, the Living Room. Service can be slow.

I have been to this hotel many times, mostly for business purposes. I have always had the best attention by the staff who have been tremendously helpful. A word of appreciation to the Concierge Mr. Yassine Bourou who has been of tremendous help particularly this morning the agency wrongly booked a taxi service. Great service. The Restaurants and the breakfast are great!

This was for the most, secure business hotel with all needed services. For a foreign guest it was somehow like safe haven in the city center. Hyatt chain kept promises, nothing to complain. For the leisure I would choose by the beach. Gym was in excellent order.

Friendly hotel, in good location, facilities are good, gym and pool were excellent, eating facilities restricted due to the end of EID so not fully experienced, overall stay was enjoyable and easy to access key attractions

My wife and I spent two very pleasant night in this hotel on our way back home, after a week in Marrakech. The hotel is very good and well located in town. The service is good also. But the place should be refurbished .

column3: The pool is the reason to stay here
column4: Definitely a brilliant large pool with lots of sun beds and friendly staff. But overall the hotel is average. We asked for twin non smoking room and they gave us a room that was dirty, hadn't been cleaned, Stains everywhere, lights didn't work and could hear drilling. Changed to a smoking room which was much more upgraded and clean. Didn't smell bad of smoke. The problem is the street noise is immense. A concert took place in he square the 3 days we were there that went on till 130am which they didn't warn us about or do much to control. For a 5 star hotel you expect to be able to sleep in it which was not great due to the noise. Hotel is well situated to get around from, I would recommend asking for rooms at the back of the hotel away from the square, maybe it would be quieter

Was here for a friend's wedding. Great hotel. No problems. High quality. Restaurant food was decent and the entertainment was fun. Hotel facilities are pretty good (gym etc). Spa could be a bit more glamorous but otherwise ok. Location is decent.

column3: Stay good but poor reception team
column4: Hyatt regency Casablanca is in the middle of a busy street. With old souk, cafe, port, entertainment all around, you cannot be alone Very good experience and hotel is also very comfortable. Restaurant staff, housekeeping and other staff were exceptionally trained. Reception staff is very rude and extremely unapologetic. The staff identified and greet d guests as per their nationalities. Very rude and strange !!! Never seems such horrible staff at the reception of any hotel The staff named IBTIHAL should be terminated immediately. Inspite of reprimanding her she rebuked back and started arguing !!! Horrible checkout it experience ! This staff didn’t even listen to her duty manager ABDULLEH’s instructions to behave properly. Very very sad for such a reputed hotel. …

We stayed here three days at end of vacation. The hotel has a good standard (very old style corridors with baguettes) and old style furniture. Level good but definitely not exceptional. The pool is too small to be interesting but the gym is very good. Good breakfast with very nice and efficient personnel. We couldn't taste the Moroccan restaurant because ... It was closed!!! We were offered to have dinner in the lobby but we kindly refused. The bad thing of this hotel is that it is placed in front of the Medina. As a result ... We had three TERRIBLE NIGHTS WITH MUSIC AND DRUMS FROM THE SQUARE (the first day until FIVE IN THE MORNING ... second and third day until TWO IN THE MORNING). When we complained with the receptionist she asked in what side of the hotel was our room ....…

The room seemed clean although I found 3 pubic hairs in the bathtub! It was a good sized room with sufficient space to accommodate my large suitcase on a bench. There was an armchair and footstool and a long desk area. One entire wall was windows providing a view of the mosque in the distance as well as a busy shopping street. As the room was on about the 3rd floor and the window was not double glazed there was considerable traffic noise at night. The bed was comfortable and was made up with nice sheets. The bathroom was large with a large sink area with ample space for toiletries. There was a large separate shower and a big bathtub. Large towels were provided along with the usual soaps. The loo was in a separate room. There was a large safe in the cupboard and it was attached…

One of the worst hotels i have ever been in ! Very old!!! Has a bad smell in the lobby also in the corridor ! Very limited selection in the breakfast The hotel located in the old town! I could not sleep at night from the street noise

Service was very good, staff was friendly. Breakfast buffet is pricey without offering very much at all. The hotel is very centrally located so it's easy to get to different stores and restaurants. It's great for business but if coming for pleasure, there are other, less expensive alternatives. Don't be turned off by the metal detector you have to walk through to enter the hotel....there's a consulate nearby so security was always around.

I spent a week at the Hyatt for business, rooms are great, very comfortable and well facilitated, service is excellent very friendly staff and will get you anything you need, food is good. The pool seemed lovely though i didn’t get a chance to use it, right in front of the hotel theres a tram, and u can stop taxis too. A lot of shops are around as its in the downtown.

The staff is lovely. The room is spacious with big windows. Important for me is that the air conditioning works and is not centrally controlled by the hotel. Adjustable in the room. The pillows are the best. I am tempted to nick one. The pool area is perfectly acceptable for a hotel in the middle of a city. Much happening outside - so it feels lively. WiFi is a bit iffy - but that is not specific to the hotel. I like it and will be back next week.

Very nice and clean and very friendly. Food is expensive and pool closes early but otherwise it was perfect. Staff was very kind but not able to extend the pool hours which was so frustrating after a full day of travel.

I am a regular customer of the Hyatt Regency booking rooms when having our monthly company board meeting in Casablanca. However, the concierge service has been very bad not accommodating our simple needs.

I knew this Hotel as a wonderful Film Location when I worked on a Tom Hawk’s movie but this time I enjoyed staying there. The lobby is warm and elegant, the service excellent and the room was at the top of every single detail

Good location and the main lobby is the beautiful, but smells horribly of strong fragrance from the store. The rest of the lobby often smells of smoke from smokers. The beds are very firm and uncomfortable. The pillows are completely flat with no support. The bathroom has a near transparent door offering no privacy. The food is average at best with slow service.

The service and food were excellent. I also loved the room. It had a beautiful view of city. The pool area was very nice and I spent a whole afternoon there. The check in and check out took a little longer than I expected.

column3: Got a great deal on a club room
column4: We went to Casablanca during club room renovations and scored a deal where we could enjoy dinner and breakfast for only 17000 Hyatt reward points - which is a complete steal. However, the rooms were, very interesting, in that all the bathrooms were one way mirrors and not very family friendly in that regard. (Do NOT recommend for families traveling with children). Our view, however, was fantastic looking at the square and evoked what I would imagine as images of turn of the century Shanghai. The rating I'm giving is thus a mixed bag of many good components with a little bit of shock value.

The hotel staff went out of their way to attend to our every need. Special recognition has to go to Rida at the front desk whose attention to our every whim went above and beyond! I would recommend this hotel.

Hotel location is very good for business needs, hotel staff are very helpful and welcoming.One small comment with the dinner at the club lounge, more options of food needs to be included. I recommend.

Nice looking hotel, just on the City Centre. Very courteous staff, even if they dont speak English, they try their best to establish a connect, excellent breajfast spread, well maintained new look Gym. I enjoyed my stay

This hotel is in the best location in Casablanca; Right next to the market. Rooms are spacious, breakfast is excellent, but the best thing are it’s friendly staff. Everyone made you feel right at home.

he team is very professional and very nice with customers. High appreciated that team remember you at each visit and customize their welcome. Rooms should be refreshed and clean up should be improved.

We stayed for two nights. Although the security was excellent we were very disappointed in some of the food and service. If you have any allergies or dietary issues don’t go as they are awful at dealing with any issues. Although staff can speak some English they do not understand when you are asking things and it became very difficult to get someone to help. Concierge was hardly ever there and when asked they would just send you to someone else rather than help as we had expected. Food was okay but not great. Our dinner the second night came with burnt bread and was subpar. The French restaurant was very good and they were good at accommodating allergies. The beds are really hard and by the end of the second day all of us were having problems. All four of us would not…

Business standard 5 star hotel in the downtown area with elegant interior and good Club Lounge on the 8th floor. Located across the road from a huge market that can be a bit noisy but still one of the nicest international hotels in Casa.

column3: Excellent hotel! Good place in the city.
column4: Very good rooms, food, people, real fitness! Ftour during ramadan was just amazing. Good place in the city. Rooms might be a little noisy at night, particularly during ramadan. Service is very fast and good. From outside, the building doesn't look nice but inside it is really nice.

Enjoyed a very nice stay at this well looked after and ideally situated hotel. Right in the hustle and bustle of Casablanca. Outside is quite busy, but once you enter the gates of this hotel it’s calm and tranquil. The interior is lovely with dark shades and elegant deep brown and red colours. The staff are very attentive and though I did not have dinner at the hotel, the breakfast in the morning was excellent. The newly renovated gym was superb - great equipment and facilities. Unfortunately the pool area was closed. Will definitely be back!

column3: Like rude & incompetent service? The Hyatt Casablanca is for you!!
column4: Never and I mean NEVER have we received such horrendous service! I cannot speak to the service of the hotel. My review is strictly on the bar-restaurant on the main floor that we received May 27/18. We arrived at about 4 pm and asked if we could just have a drink as we noted the tables were set. No problem. We had to move to another table as thoughout the bar they have machines pumping out the smell of potpourri which is revolting and so not in tune to a world that is going towards a no-scent policy in offices, etc. Is there mildew or some other odor they are trying to cover up? It took us about 15 minutes to get our drinks and then waited expecting at least some little appies such as olives or nuts to arrive with the drinks. After another 10 minutes I approached our…

Just a quick business trip! A good central place to stay in a quality hotel. The decor is grand, the food good and the staff friendly and ready to help. The rooms are a good size and have everything you need. There is a reasonable gym and pool ( not open that night). Plenty of local restaurants ( I would recommend Le Riad Restaurant, only 5 mins walk). Next door to the Medina. About 40 mins to the airport.

Beautiful room, bathroom and linens. Well-stocked mini-bar but be careful not to touch anything you don't intend to use in case you get billed anyway. Room-service was good and all hotel staff were helpful and friendly. Our second floor room only had a view of the roof of a ground floor section of the hotel but I hope other rooms had a better view. This is a really top hotel in the center of a noisy and not-so-clean city.

A modern hotel in a central location. They upgraded us to a junior suite on the 5th floor with a great view of the old Medina (see photo). The room was incredibly quiet despite not being that high up -- excellent sound proofing to the outside and between rooms, both on the same floor and the upper floor. Comfortable bed, pillows just the right balance between soft and firm. OK but not great blackout curtains. The bathroom in this suite had a separate toilet area. The bathroom had all the usual amenities. Fluffy bath towels. There were four free bottles of water included with the room. We had a pistilla in the Moroccan restaurant, it was excellent. Concierge did a great job of arranging a car to take us to Rabat the next day.

Very positive and pleasant experience either with my family who came one month ago for holidays or during my weekly stays for work/business. A service that is at the state of the art. A food that is very good at the level of the best standards. A very nice and cosy environment A gym/fitness room very well equiped

column3: Best Regency Club in the World
column4: Hoiumiri, Abdelilah, Reda, and Ihssane ...super team leaders who go the extra mile and meter to provide outstanding help and service. No detail is too small. Warm welcome and very friendly and professional help. Excellent.

A lovely hotel and staff. Nicely appointed lobby and rooms. Linens are of an upgraded quality. Good lighting on rooms which I have not experienced in.several other hotels in Morocco. Pool is inviting however closed at this time.

Been there a few times and it doesn't get any better. Water in bathroom are yellow Electricity outage all the time Very poor breakfast Smell in the lobby, cigarettes Service in the restaurant is poor Parking is full with no hotel residents

The hotel is centrally located. It is very close to the Medina and suk (market). The rooms were spacious and clean. The Moroccan restaurant in the hotel was great. it includes a nice Hafla. All through the night a musician band played Arabic music, with replacing singers (we counted 4) and a belly dancer. The breakfast was good as well. In spite of all that, it offered less what one expects from a 5 star hotel.

loved this place-centrally located, very accommodating staff that moved our room as the one we had faced the rock concert going on that night. Went to Cafe M on property for dinner and the food was incredibly wonderful. Had a drink in the bar and it was probably the best mojito ever.

Very comfortable and feels relaxing. Near to tourists places. The most important is the security of this hotel, it give us real safety. The lobby is so nice and rooms are very clean. Good maintenance.

column3: Dated but not quite a Classic
column4: The hotel is getting old and it shows.. Sound proofing is poor, water pressure is barely ok, carpets are worn, TV's are tiny. Breakfast room and offer could do with a refresh, Room Service was good and efficient, staff is generally nice. Good location.

Visited the Hyatt in Casablanca this evening for a night cap. Ordered a beer and a wine which were a little slow in arriving, but the waitress was pleasant and helped with the wifi. Ordered a second beer, and waited ... and waited. Eventually caught her attention and ordered the second beer again and asked for the bill. When the bill arrived discovered we had been billed for three beers - which at €8.50 is not a huge deal, but still, not something to just gloss over. Queried the bill and the waitress who was adamant that we had been served three beers. Eventually a manager sorted out the issue, but it was a disappointing end to what had been a pleasant evening. We will not be visiting again.

Location was ideal, across restaurants and cafés, and local transit train, next to medina and walking distance to city train station. Rooms were modern and vary spacious with all the amenities. Staff made you feel at home and helpful of your needs.

column3: Good location. Dated and dirty hotel rooms.
column4: Location is good. Hotel common areas are nice, i.e., lobby, bars, restaurants. Rooms are dated and not clean. Booked a suite and it was filthy. Cushions were tattered, curtains were sagging, carpet was dirty with lots of cigarette burns. And to boot - the room reeked of cigarette smoke. The walls in the bedroom were stained with greasy hand prints all over. No comment..... Hotel staff - lip service......

Overall: Mediocre experience. Property is not a Hyatt Regency and should be rebranded as just a Hyatt. Probably wouldn't stay there again. Pros: Impeccable location in the heart of the city. Close to absolutely everything. Lobby is very inviting. Lobby bar/restaurant was excellent (burger is tops). Moroccan restaurant was also very good. Rooms are laid out very nicely and are really comfortable. Cons: The street noise is incredible. The windows are not double pane or noise proof. The entire hotel needs renovation/updating. Hotel staff wasn't very friendly and not at all what I would expect from a Hyatt.

column3: Good 4 night stay with a touch of luxury
column4: I stayed here 4nights with a friend after my 10day morocco tour with a group of 11 people. The hotels and riads I stayed during my tour are all charmingly decorated in Moroccan tradition but lacking the standard service I accustomed with a high end hotel. I was expecting to have a comfort stay in Hyatt Regency didn't actually expecting anything Luxury. I am a long time Hyatt member, honestly I would never pick Regency if there is Grand or Park available. And I wanted a city center location so Four Season was out. I was surprised by how beautiful the lobby is and how professional and courteous the staff are, the bell man the security, the front desk. Every of my request was handled efficiently: money exchange, taxi, local attractions, direction to restaurant etc. The security…

column3: Excellent location, facilities, and especially service
column4: We stayed here for a few days before and after a tour of Morocco. The location is excellent, right next to the Medina, business center and trams. The hotel was well kept, had great food, and the rooms were comfortable, although as we found throughout Morocco, the toilet room was separated from the rest of the bathroom. The restaurants and bar were great and the service was outstanding from the bellmen to front desk and concierge. We wanted to take the tram to La Corniche and the concierge had a bellman walk us out, buy the tickets and put us on the right one. Another time we wanted to go to Habbous and again the concierge had a bellman walk us out to haggle with taxis and private drivers to get us there.

Good hotel but they gotta do like a discount when they close the pool! Any compensation will be appreciated Their food is the weakest point, it’s just a food with average tasting Clean renovated rooms and a very good gym with a big access to an outdoor area

The hotel is well located in the centre of Casablanca. I try to stop here now as the hotel has a very good atmosphere and staff have a excellent manner. Used the Club Lounge service very good in the evening and morning . Ilsane provided excellent service and organisation in the morning and the evening staff were very helpful and professional. Whilst I rate this as an excellent business hotel I would always look to stay here irrespective of whatever my reason for being is Casablanca is.

column3: Don’t See a reason to rate more than average!
column4: The best thing in this hotel is the smiling friendly staff and service providers. Other than that....average. Slow service, room key has to be changed several times during the stay. Clock at room haven’t changed to the new timing. Poor TV screen. Poor room carpets. Reception and concierge are great!

column3: Luxurious hotel in the heart of Casablanca
column4: Great hotel in every regard, from the beautiful and modern decor to the caring and accommodating staff. It has a great location, has high level of security, and plenty of amenities (several restaurants, a lounge, bars, pool, etc). Hyatt continues to impress making it more and more my preferred hotel! Will stay here again when I return to Casablanca.

column3: Best large luxury hotel in Casablanca
column4: Big clean rooms and spacious bathrooms. Staff was friendly and helpful in every way. Be sure to get a room that includes access to VIP bar/Restaurant on the 8th floor. Also request a room not facing the loud main plaza in front.

Location: Downtown in Casablanca. A better location hotel might be by the ocean Hotel: Well maintained lobby and average room. Similar in character to a Hilton US style room, basic but functional. Room and bathroom were very clean and well maintained but nothing special or memorable. Summary: An average room but nice hotel central. A solid 3 1/2* hotel.

Stayed here for four nights during a business meeting. Room was very nice, with a good view of all the goings on in the plaza across the street. Staff was top notch - very helpful. Lounge and bar was a good place for socializing in the evenings or chatting in the daytime, with a very open layout. Pretty good breakfast and lunch buffet with a variety of options. We ate at the Moroccan restaurant in the hotel. The food was great - lamb tagine was excellent. Good wine. Decent live music. There was a belly dancer at one point. Service was excellent. Conference room for our business meeting was spacious, though there was noise from staff in an adjacent room and we had to occasionally tell them to keep down the noise. Have to say it was a business trip, so this is a pretty upscale…

Mediocre food, bad attitudes, cramped bathroom, dirty windows, constant street noise, unreliable transportation, and an overall feeling of being totally unwelcome. Four Seasons is the better option. Avoid.

column3: Love the service at this hotel!
column4: Have made the Hyatt my home from home on my business trip from Dubai. The rooms are great and in good condition. Try to get a room at the front to avoid the mosque waking you up at 05:45 or do what I do and use the well equipped gym when you wake. Staff are excellent, from the staff at reception, especially Salma and Asmaa.... The lounge is great and the service their wonderful. I promise to get the name of the staff their next time.

Hyatt, located in the heart of downtown Casablanca, lives upto the reputation of the Hyatt brand, recognized the world over for comfort, luxury and service. A 5-star, 255-key hotel, this Hyatt is well equipped with conference facilities, swimming pool (closed in winter), a Moroccon-style restaurant , fitness room, wi-fi, business center and concierage Its rather modest exterior belies the luxurious look of its lobby, the pillared entrance and the modern rooms. We found the service to be top-notch. From your room, depending upon the floor, you have a spectacular view of the city, the ocean and the Hassan Mosque, with its towering minaret (the largest in the world). We tried the spicy lamb at the restaurant called Dar Beida, and found it to be exceedingly tasty and flavorful.…

This hotel used to be a good place and had its past glory. The rooms in the first 3 floors are extremely smelly and the air conditioning smell is just disgusting. The staff at the reception should be replaced. There is nothing to improve there. After every single stay at this hotel, i got charged by the hotel on my credit card some sums of money, for things I did not consume. Every time I did raise a claim with my bank and ended up having all these charges reversed back. Also at every time i did check in, the minibar had items missing, which of course the hotel tried to charge me upon check out. I truly wonder if this hotel qualifies to be a Hyatt hotel !

I booked this hotel and paid in advance in November. On the 24th January I arrived in Casablanca and when I was in front the check in desk I was told my room was cancelled because it booked the whole hotel. Lairs . I was told that they sent an email , liars, Never received anything. Obviously o was furious. One of my colleague kindly gave il his room and it was given to me. No apologies , I asked to talk to the manager and it was never available on 5 days. Hayatt regency Casablanca never again. Zero professionality.

column3: Ok hotel, rooms due for upgrade.
column4: Ground level restaurant and breakfast is excellent. However in the room the sheet was stained and asked for a change. The view is not what is sold on the sites as ours overlooked a lot. The gym is new and well equipped.

column3: Very good hotel & service but need some development for the restaurant specially on the way of uncomfortable seats
column4: Very good hotel & service but need to develop the uncorfamble seats, also how come the mob bar is closed and need huge amount 1000 DH just to put my water bottles, that was right way, The cleaning of the room is perfect

Located in Casablanca in the old city part near the old Souq, the ocean is a walking distance to the corniche side, Hassan the 2nd mosque is nearby, metro station is right across the street, many outing places nearby, well secured. There are a variety of food places, whether you are at the lobby lounge area and ground floor, there is a nice gym, pool, a convention center, a very welcoming and cheerful staff always there to help. WiFi is everywhere, they have a Cartier store. Food is good at their restaurants, breakfast is very good and gives you selections, rooms are quite sizable and clean.

column3: Repeat Visit to this Excellent Well Located Hotel
column4: Top notch facilities at this very professionally and well run Hyatt. We were treated to an upgrade to a Junior Exec Suite with a Hassan II Mosque view as requested and although a bit disappointed to learn that the Regency Club was closed for renovations we were reassured by the lovely and gracious Team Leader Imane that all would be taken care of in the lobby bar. Overall cannot fault this hotel....staff are polite and accommodating, helpful and professional. Very well run property as I remembered it from my past visit. Comfortable bedding and very quiet rooms. Chourkran!

column3: Great place in the city of Casablanca
column4: It's great place to stay in the city of Casablanca. We stayed there on the night of 31st December 2017. Though there was no official new year celebration count down in Morocco but we could still enjoy the view of people singing and strolling in town right from the window of our bedroom. Yet, there are good music bar, and cosy recpetion at the lobby where you could go and enjoy the night.

column3: Hyatt Regency Casa: your home away from home
column4: Great personnel. I lost my two expensive phones. I must say I was touched when Chaimaa, Ben Zbir found them and kept them for me. Abddellah Rida El Idriss and Mouatassin will make sure you have the greatest experience during your stay. A colleague came looking for me at the hotel and later on told me: "seems you are well known in this hotel" I must say several good people will watch out for you during your stay including: Mir Mohamed, Zoubeir El Basri, Nasrallah Abdelujid, Fetaah Ahmed and Kababay. In this hotel your stay will be one to always remember

Full amenities. Good central location. Large well appointed rooms. Public spaces are most attractive. The lobby has a bar. The breakfasts were excellent with an omelette chef and a sufficient array of local specialties. Had room service--harira soup--very tasty and promptly delivered.

Really enjoyed our stay here! Courteous and helpful staff. Beautiful lacquered wood panels in the lobby lounge and hotel room. Offers alcohol in their beautiful lounge. Our stay wasn’t long enough to try their restaurants but I think we would have enjoyed that too. It’s in a great location. Our room was on the 9th floor and had a great view of the United Nations Plaza. Would recommend this hotel.

column3: Compared to other Hyatt hotels, the room layouts need improvement
column4: This hotel is typical of the Hyatt hotel: excellent location, good staff. However, the rooms themselves may be typical in design for Morocco, but atypical for Hyatt: a small, cramped toilet room separated from the bath. This toilet room barely has room to open the door inwards, and one must practically hug the wall to open it from inside. Why is this separated from the main bath? For hygiene, one must walk to the bath/sink room anyway. An added inconvenience is the electrical system -- apparently one needs to read a manuel to figure out the master light switch. So, in the middle of the night you need to go, you flick on the light switch near your bed, and ALL the lights in the room turn on, disturbing your partner. Why not have a lighted light switch right next to the toilet or…

I am frequently travelling to Casablanca and always stay at the Hyatt. The rooms are beautiful, well maintained and very clean. The luxurious and elegant lobby/bar give an added value to your visit. The service is not always quick, but very nice. Food is excellent in all restaurants. If you have the chance to stay in a suite, then it will be a once in a life time experience. My valuation: best of Casablanca

We only came to have breakfast and were not disappointed. Really nice selection of fresh food, fruits, juices, breads etc. Very friendly, responsive staff. We had breakfast at Sofitel/ brasserie la tour the day before - which doesn't match up at all. See my rating there.

The Hyatt Regency was beautiful. We had a wonderful stay there and the staff were super friendly and treated you with 5 star service. Hotel was very clean and was in an excellent convenient location right in the center of the city and by the water. Had an excellent stay and would highly recommend and stay again !! Paul + Derya :)

Hayatt is hayatt. Unbeatable service.. hassle free checkin... restaurants.. housekeeping... would love to come back. Corridors are bit dated... Lifts make rumbling sound at times.. staff is very helpful.

column3: A fabulous Hotel with Amazing Staff
column4: We stayed at the Hyatt and were extremely happy with the central location within walking distance to the Old Medina shopping markets. Our rooms were very clean, with updated bathrooms; the beds were very comfortable. Casablanca is a very busy city of 3.5 million people and this location sees a lot of action/ performers at the square across the street. Having said that the most important part of the stay was that we felt very safe there once we entered the Hotel gates. We would definitely recommend this hotel. A special thank you to managers Ludivine Ughetto and Abdellah Rida El Idrissi. Both of which went above and beyond their duties to accommodate us and take care of our party. Ludivine was very accommodating and changed our days around so that we could return to this hotel at…

The nicest hotel you will stay at in Casablanca. The staff and amenities are excellent! There are 4 different places/restaurants that you can dine at. For those who are Hyatt members and have a chance to visit the Regency Club you will be well received by a great staff.

column3: Good business hotel, close to the Medina, very noisy location
column4: The hotel is good, good large rooms and good service. The main problem is the extremely crowded and noisy square in front of the hotel. If you like to be downtown, this is your place. Many shops and restaurants close by. The hotel has 2 restaurants, a Moroccan and a french.one, with good food and good choice of wines.

Comparing to anything outside - this hotel is great. Good service, peacefull place. Fresh juices at breakfast were delicious! Some minuses are not the biggest choic of food on breakfast (just standard but very good), few things in my room were repaired in a amatour way (like sink mount) and they forget about cleanimg under bed.

This hotel is in a very good location You can be entertained just by looking out side your window or sit in one of the cafes across the street It is clean and good and the best thing it has an iron in the room although it is strapped to the board but at least there is one The tram is our side the hotel The staff is very helpful and friendly to make your stay more comfortable

column3: Too Expensive with less upscale realm
column4: Overall The hotel is certainly one of the nicest hotel in Casablanca. Other Western chains are around (including two Starwood properties), but the Hyatt is the hands-down winner in terms of exclusivity and class. Situated in the Place des Nations Unis, it is within walking distance to just about everything in the city, including the main city center, the Hassan mosque, the Old Medina (right behind the hotel) and, if you don't mind a little stroll, the Maarif area. Is the hotel worth $500/nt like they often charge? In my opinion, no. The Sheraton or Le Meridian right down the road will give you more-or-less the same comfort for half the price. But, if you are really loyal to Hyatt or staying on behalf of a client, the Hyatt is a very nice facility. Common Areas Superb. The…

Beautiful hotel, classy but not as elegant as I originally thought. The toilet is much too small, the drains of the shower are clogged, there are way too few electric charging points in the room. There is no tea or normal coffee, nor a waterboiling device in the room. Otherwise, the bed is solide, good and clean. The view is fantastic! I would come back here for a short stay.

One of the best Hotels in Casablanca. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Staff is very friendly and food is delicious especially at the Moroccan restaurant. Location is central overlooking a large square that can unfortunately become quite noisy during weekends and football fans celebrations.

The stay was a truely great experiance. The hotel was at a very good location in the city center of Casablanca and it was close to most things you wanted to see. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The only down-side was that the bed was slighlt too hard for my taste, but that is the same in many hotels. Overall a great stay and I will for sure stay there again when visiting Casablanca!

For 4 visits in 3 months I am glad I chose the Hyatt. Its a great hotel in a good central location and the staff are outstanding. Rooms are spotless and a good size - it can be a bit noisy but you are in a very central location. The food is a little pricey, but that's really my only criticism. The staff are excellent. Highly recommended.

column3: Great spot if you can get there!
column4: Had a great (sadly) one night! We were there for one night when Morocco clinched a World Cup qualification for nearly 20 years.... the town went CRAZY!!! But so glad to see the jubilation!! VERY FUN place!

This was my 4th visit to that hotel and it keeps on getting better. Whatever shortcomings a facility could have is made up by the warmth of the staff. The facilities are excellent and the service is wonderful. If you like city life. This is the place

The positives * large room, very clean * good location in the city center * WiFi worked well in the room * laundry service worked well The negatives * strong mildew smell in the corridors of multiple floors * breakfast area was too small— merged with lobby lounge where smoking was allowed, this made for a very unpleasant breakfast * staff were polite but not too helpful—seemed overwhelmed by the crowds —this is odd since this is a big hotel in a major city

I booked the hotel through Ms Ghita Tantane, Hyatt Regency, via email for a group. Ms. Tantane was very responsive to my request, booking the rooms as requested and responded with confirmation numbers for our party. Our reception was warm and impressive. The hotel’s atmosphere is exquisite and charming. The hotel staff was quick to respond to any requests or needs. I would like to especially thank Ms. Sanaa at the reception desk, who immediately and kindly resolved any issues I addressed, minor though they were. She may have been “just doing her job”, but she did it well and with a smile! The same can be said of Ms. Tantane, who I had the pleasure to meet tonight. Awesome team! I highly recommend the Hyatt Regency Casablanca for business or pleasure travels. You will not…

fantastic stay. food, room, staff and indeed people here are all wonderful. highly recommend hyatt. everything was exceptional. only issue is noise in the street but this is easily forgotten in here. the hotel gym is not the greatest but pool is good. breakfast is reall excellent and i would recommend looking at small black menu on the table it has some extra delights you can order that are not on display. Also the restaurant at the front you must try the steak.

Great Hotel with excellent hospitality. The staffs were very proffesional especially the staffs at the conceirge, guest relations are very friendly. Whenever I'm in Casablanca, my first preference to stay is Hyatt Regency Casablanca. Looking forward to my next visit.

column3: Talk about an oasis in the desert!
column4: I was having a tough first day in Casablanca. I hate to admit it because I prefer to think that I am open-minded... and I am well- traveled.....but I really didn't like Casablanca. I didn't like the unrelenting heat, i didn't like the smells, and suddenly for the first time in my life, my stomach was starting to feel "off'. And then....lo and behold, there in the offing was... the Hyatt Regency!! Eureka, my heart was singing!! I have never been so excited in my life to see a Hyatt!! So, my friend and I went in for a glass of water in their lounge and it turned into three hours. The staff was AMAZING.. Super soliticitous... And our waiter got in on the birthday fun and brought my friend a lovely dessert with a candle on top... and he tried to sing happy brithday-- then other…

column3: A pleasure to stay at Hyatt Casa
column4: I am staying very regularly at Hyatt - every week ! - It is always a pleasure to be there. It makes my stay far from my family more pleasant. The staff is very professional and nice. Conditions are very good, including the room, the lobby etc

column3: Very good location but very crowded outside
column4: Hotel itself has no problem at all except 2 things, 1st thing is the crowded area outside and 2nd thing is the poor carpets at the corridors. Food is very nice with wide variety and rooms are very clean. Room tips is take any high floor facing the ocean.

The hotel is old but all the rooms have been refurbished to a good level. Only annoying matter is that the toilet is separate from the bathroom inside the room. The gym setup seems to be temporary as the hotel seems to be having additional renovation which is still in progress (but does not affect guests). Music from the street is quite high and can be heard from the rooms. Additional sound proofing is needed.

Staff was great, however, I did not like the bad smell of mold in the rooms. Was very surprised and shocked to see people smoking in the lobby. Conference room lights needed lights of work, lighting kept flickering. During the conference, there was lots of noise coming from staff, talking, laughing.

the hotel has an excellent staff and very comfortable rooms & services.. it is close to the old medina as well and accessible via tramway (place nations unies station).. the most important is the flexibility of the staff to any requests and the very quick response.. my experience was great

You make my business trip enjoyable as a short vacation, staff are professional and very friendly, they spare no effort to help, food is excellent, I recommend as a first choice for Casablanca if you are visiting for biz or for vacation

It is my best choice of hotels in Casablanca . Location and services are excellent and they have the best management and interaction with customers. Very nice with regards to : food, music, employee, services, and security and safety.

Great hotel in central location. A little noisy outside in downtown Casablanca but hotel was a lovely refuge from the outside. Staff were extremely good. Lovely Moroccan restaurant. Comfortable. Beer was a little expensive but you take a beer wherever you can get it.

I stayed at both the Sofitel and Hyatt Regency. Hands down, Hyatt Regency is a much more elegant and newly renovated hotel. We actually randomly met the GM at Marrakech who convinced us to try out the Hyatt over staying at the Sofitel again. Excellent experience, there was even some last minute confusion over the billing and he quickly corrected it, no problem at all. Will definitely stay here again.

Team at Hyatt Regecny Casablanca were very responsive and went out of the way to ensure our comfort. The upgrade to a suite signifies their recognition of understanding their reguler customers like me. Also extra efforts to cater to our vegetarian food requirements need appreciation. Overall it was an awesome stay

The service at this hotel was outstanding while I was here, however it certainly is on the older side. Looks like updates are being made, but overall a great stay in Casablanca! Would highly recommend.

I've been a long time Hyatt guy and have stayed at well over one hundred properties. Casablanca is hands down the friendliest. The staff are simply the nicest I've come across. From check-in desk to the manager and all in between, my wife and I were made to feel special. The concierge was very helpful with dinner as well as a tour of Hassan II Mosque (a must see). Our room was Swiss-clean, well appointed and spacious. Unfortunately, we only stayed a day. Next time. .. much longer.

The property is average compared with same brand other hotels. I am on a business trip and monthly I will stay at least 3/4 times in 5 star hotels.So I do have a good reference , if I may say so. Cleaning,front desk and various service staff are all very friendly , however I do believe that the management is very stingy and tries to make a buck out of every occasion. It goes to such an extend that this is in particular visible in the behavior of the security staff, if you take drinks with you from outside the hotel in a bag ,they will tell you that this is not allowed and take your drink away, however since there is no legal basis for diss proprieting ,they return it to you after you complain to the front desk. I do not blame the personnel, but this IS clearly instructed by the…

column3: Had such promise but service let it down
column4: One big plus was that the receptionists here are undeniably beautiful. But.... On arrived no one was available to help me with my heavy bag.... the mini bar was shown to me and then not reloaded as promised until I phoned down. Then the door jammed in the morning. Finally (well I have not left yet) my coffee wasnt repleneshed. Such a shame.

The concierge is what made this stay special. They made sure that our rooms were up to par. They helped my friends get some new clothes as their bags got lost. The best example of their service can be summed up by this. We had left an item at the hotel, and they offered to drop it off all the way in Marrakech. Unbelievable for a $ 10 item, especially since it was unsolicited. The rooms were nice with great views of the Hassan mosque. The regency club is spacious, with a nice evening cocktail hour with champagne. Security is always present. Their front desk staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. Definitely demonstrated the experience that should be present at all Hyatts.

column3: The best 5 Star Option in Casablanca
column4: I have been visiting the Hyatt Casablanca for nearly 10 years for business purposes. And probably spent around 30 to 40 nights overall there. This is still up to now the best 5 star option in Casablanca. The location is good (Not far from the Train Station) and to the key Casablanca centric locations. The area is noisy, but so is Casablanca, Hotel is doing its outmost to bring it down with soundproofing, but you do get awaken at night by Taximen fighting at the exit of Hotel Night Club or due to random night annoyances. All restaurants are outstanding. Breakfast is great (but expensive). Service is good and staff is always very supportive. Front Desk, PR Manager, Concierge. There is an ATM within the Hotel (which for some reason sometimes does not accept local Credit Cards).

column3: Hyatt charm a stone's throw from Old Medina
column4: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Casablanca Hyatt Regency hotel for 3 nights in August. Excellent hotel; perfect location at a stone's throw from the Old Medina. Our daughter enjoyed the swimming pool in the Moroccan heat.

column3: Right in the heart of the city
column4: This is a great hotel located within walking distance of some major attractions. Rooms were clean, comfortable and with many nice amenities. Loved the shower. The breakfast buffet was very nice and the dining area very comfortable. The Hyatt chain in general is not my favorite but this one exceeded expectations.

column3: Hyatt Regency Casa: your home away from home
column4: Very nice luxury hotel with nice views on Hasssan II Mosque and Place des Nations Unies where so many free shows take place. Hotel is clean, Staff is polite and take pride in taking care of you: Room service team and Moroccan restaurant are very responsive and will serve you the best couscous in town in addition to nice live music, front desk staff in particular Imane Chadli and Asmaa Ziouziaoui will take good care of you. Don't miss breakfast please: it is simply good and tasty food.

We stayed only one night in hyatt before we go on with our grand tour of Morocco and definetely it was an amazing stay. The room was spacious and clean with plenty of quality amenities. The staff were friendly and helpful. We also ate a delicious dinner in one of the hotel restaurants. The dinner was a traditional Moroccan lamb tangine very well cooked and served with prunes and almonds. The restaurant looked like an bedouin tent and we enjoyed our dinner with traditional live music and a beautiful belly dancer. The breakfast was also royal. European and local goods were offered to cover all guests in a beautiful salle. Memorable stay in casablanca

column3: Beautiful hotel is a central location with some downsides
column4: This is a beautiful, modern hotel which is centrally located in Casablanca close to the medina and many restaurants. The hotel has a nice lobby and bar area, and everyone working in the hotel was friendly. The room was clean and pleasant with a nice view, but the beds were very hard.

We spent one night at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca To me the hotel is a real 5 star, very clean and spacious, comfortable beds and outstanding service. The room has safe, air conditioning, mini-bar, everything you might need. Complementary WiFi was easy to setup and good enough for 3 people to be connected at the same time. One of the 3 devices was on Netflix and didn't have any connectivity problems. The pool is of good size, and very clean. You can eat and drink by the pool. To give you a sense of the pricing one beer was about 80 Dirham. Normal price is probably around 20 Dhiram. A few restaurant options are available in the hotel. We preferred eating at the hotel, given the location of the hotel nothing matching our quality standard was close enough. The food…

I had to stay quite a long time at the hotel but thanks to the warm and thoughtful welcome of the whole stay, time could fly very fast.... The location is excellent, close to the Medina, to the Port, to the Corniche and main businesses and if you ask to be in a high floor, you could really enjoy a great view on the beautiful Mosq, city and sea.

column3: Great Stay in Room with View!
column4: Centrally located, excellent last night before the airport. Get the Room with view. Splendid views of the Mosque and the vibrant city from the 10th floor! Room window is HUGE. Bathroom is excellent. Bar downstairs has a good selection of scotch and all kinds of liquors. Staff is very pro.

We had a nice view of the Hassan II mosque from our king room. The rooms are small (very narrow in fact). Bathroom is isolated without a sink and located right next to the entrance of the room (weird!). Shower, tub and sink are separate from the bathroom! Mattress was the worst I've seen in any hotels anywhere in the world (including a crappy TraveLodge in downtown Chicago!). There was heavy construction at the main entrance and it was LOUD! Staff were good and friendly. Location is good with easy access to the market, shops and the tram.

Maybe its an escape from the bright sun or the busy plaza outside that made the beautiful hyatt decor seem so dark but to me that was not a positive. I loved the room, even though we didnt get an upgrade but the public spaces seemed too dark. I am so glad i read about the Moroccan restaurant in the hotel, because they werent wrong about the food. It was expensive, yet worth every penny. I loved the live singers and musicians, the decor was really beautiful (like a tent) and the food was delicious. Morocco is a place of beautiful outdoors and this hotel has next to no outdoor space, so even though it was a nice place, I would probably avoid it next time.

The Hyatt Regency Cassablanca is a superb hotel ideally located for the business traveller. The hotel staff are attentive and attended to my needs in a professional manner. The hotel has good facilities for business meetings and are accommodating to meeting the needs of the business user. I would wholly recommend this hotel.

column3: Luxurious hotel, but service was poor
column4: This hotel was very luxurious. For crying out loud, there is a Cartier store in the lobby. Considering my friend and I had been staying at smaller hotels during the duration of our trip in Morocco, getting to use Hyatt Rewards points on this beautiful hotel was a real treat and something that I had been waiting to finally use for a long time for the right place and time! The location was perfect in the city, I loved how there was a "red carpet" leading into the entrance of the hotel, and I greatly appreciated the heightened security presence at all perimeters. Our room was spacious and comfortable too. Very happy with it! However, there are a few things that make me give this hotel a lower score than I'd like. The breakfast food was quite basic. I think I just expected something…

Ok to stay there ..... able to see the real Moroccan life from your room and immediately you go out of hotel. Hotel is quite OK, normal but nothing exceptional. Stay away from taxi's right in front of hotel... you will be definitely ripped off.

My partner and best friend stayed for 1 night in Casablanca passing through on our way to Fez. Our room had a great view of the Hassen II Mosque and we ordered room service which was great! Wonderful Moroccan food! The staff were very helpful and friendly both at the front desk with our travel inquires and at the pool. The pool area is small but refreshing after a hot day and there is a pool-side restaurant that is very good. I definitely recommend the breakfast buffet in the morning! Great food and totally worth the price before you head out for the day! Beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean with nice amenities. Overall a nice experience for tired travelers.

I have stayed recently at this hotel for two months, it was excellent for the clean and nice guest room, friendly and professional staff specially Ms. Imane, Ms. Ludivine and Mr. Kassy who made my stay as pleasant and comfortable as i was imagend and more.

We stayed at Hyatt Regency Casablanca for 4 nights while we visited the City on our holiday. We chose the hotel for the central location, the large swimming pool, and the 5 stars. Unfortunately we were disappointed with our stay. It's a large, old hotel with traffic on all sides. The rooms are poorly insulated so you get the heat and noise of the city. Our first night was very uncomfortable as there was a concert in the square opposite the hotel that kept us awake until about 1:30am. The antiquated aircon in the room made a lot of noise but produced very little cold air. We complained in the morning and an engineer fixed the rattle of the aircon, but the room was still very hot for the remaining nights. The noise continued to be an issue due to the outdated windows. We stayed…

Great hotel, great service, great staff, surrounding neighborhood not much for walking/exploring. Hotel provided a great auto tour. Nice pool, Iftar meal during Ramadan a special treat. Fitness center a tad small.

Stayed here overnight after a long journey. It was a great place to relax and unwind. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They certainly accommodated our needs and helped us find the train schedule, a menu in English (since our Arabic and French aren't great) and just made us feel incredibly comfortable! We had a room facing the ocean and were able to watch the sun set over the mosque. Really enjoyed our stay.

small bathroom, basic set-up, busy hotel, nice location, no ambience of a riad, but you know that going in. Some band playing a block away in square, so room not real soundproof. if price is right, ok to stay here - would stay here again.

This is a lovely hotel with nice facilities worthy of the Hyatt name. A nice restaurant, showers, large rooms. I asked for a handicapped room so as not to have to climb into a tub and had both a shower and a tub. However, the beds were hard as were all beds in the hotels we stayed. The people at the desk were very helpful to answer questions and call another hotel near airport for our last night.

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Casablanca for four nights, arriving a day later then planned. The itinerary adjustment was accommodated without drama. I hate talk and explanations....everything was just handled. Gorgeous room. Great Service. Alcohol at the bar with excellent food. Prices were European but as expected.

My mom and I have done lots of traveling and stayed in many hotels in many cities of the world. I have to say this is by far the BEST hotel we have ever stayed in. I honestly do not know where to begin. Let's start with the rooms. The rooms have excellent views. One side of the hotel faces the Medina (old part of the city) and the Hassan II Mosque. The other side offers a view of the modern part of the city. We got a chance to experience both views because in the middle of our trip we went to Marrakech and spent two days there, coming back to Casablanca and checking back in the hotel again and this time ending up with a view of the modern city. Both are awesome! The breakfast was superb. Their fruit juices are really good. They have a professional chef that will cook a delicious…

I was not sure what to expect when I check into the Hyatt in Casablanca and was pleasantly surprised. Every aspect of the Hotel was excellent. From the location, amenities, the room and especially the service, everything was world class. If possible, ask for a high floor with a great view of the city.

Gazzy you made my stay , from amazing lunch and wine suggestions , to the Moroccan Coffee .. wow cannot wait to come back .. The people here are what make this property special... Faoud .. your drive in the new 7 series was fantastic .. "to Marrakech airport" Wonderful! Cheers Tom

Stayed here 2 years ago and it was lovely. Well kept and clean. Hotel at an excellent standard and lovely modern stylish décor. Efficient lifts. Had started trip staying at the Sheraton and quickly switched to Hyatt which is so much nicer and stronger on security.

column3: Excellent hotel w great staff and a grand, yet cosy, lobby
column4: I stayed here three days in may 2017. Central location and close to the Medina as well as down town offices being a short cab ride away. A really great lobby w excellent ambiance and food to match. And not just the ordinary Hotel lobby food! Much better. Staff are attentive and friendly. Rooms are clean and bathrooms are decent size w walk in shower. Very few English speaking tv channels and no english or american newspapers in the hotel - that is not impressive. The hotel has style and you feel well taken care of. Never had time for the pool but the pool area looked ok. Gym was very small, hot and not very clean - no excuse for this Hyatt! The world has moved on - a hotel of this standard and price should have a first class gym! In spite of some issues described above I…

column3: Nice Respite in a Busy City
column4: Hotel was comfortable and staff welcoming. Breakfast was plentiful and filling. Excellent housekeeping. Location is right downtown. Yes, lots of activity on the plaza below but I did not find it to be as loud and distracting as other guests. Would stay here again.

The hotel staff, service and the decor of the hotel were all 5 stars. We arrived late and the supervisor on duty, Ridael, was very helpful and attempted to get us served in their restaurants within minutes of closing. Unfortunately the chef had already closed the kitchen. We were then escorted to the restaurant bar which had a very nice and full menu (not just snacks) and got food and drinks which we were all delicious. I had a delicious burger and my wife had half a chicken with mashed potatoes. The next day we were granted lounge access and the manager of the lounge was so pleasurable and had us laughing at his jokes. He also made a dinner reservation for us and cancelled the one we had previously made. The scenery out the windows was wonderful as well as the spread…

column3: Wonderful Experience -- Special Thanks to Yassine, a Great Concierge
column4: Had a 24-hour layover in Casablanca on April 30, and with the exception of a delayed pickup at the airport arranged through Hyatt, experience all around was wonderful. Yassine, the concierge, was extremely courteous and could not have been more helpful to us. Every time he saw us, he was ready to assist in any way he could. Best concierge service we have ever experienced!! I recommend arranging your airport-hotel transfer service through the hotel. The hired drivers are courteous and the cars are very nice and comfortable. We selected the Hyatt for its location and convenience. Our room on the Club floor was clean and spacious, and fitted with beautiful polished wood along the walls. Very nice view overlooking the Old Medina and the Great Hassan II Mosque. I took lots…

I have a long trackrecord with the Hyatt in Casablanca. The only mistake they made was to end the Bogart bar, but this was years ago ! Staying at the Hyatt is like coming home; members of the staff truly make you feel 'welcome back'.

Rooms on side of square have insufficient sound proofing. Very noisy till outside music finishes (after 11pm most nights). Bar staff are indifferent with little customer service. Check-in and out slow. Paying 5 star rates for 2star service.

Excellent hotel ask Asmaa or Imane at the reception kind and professionnal hotel very well located do not miss the breakfast rooms are in excellent good shape and all staff is client focused and offer good level of service

This is not a review of the hotel itself but of the lobby bar where we stopped for lunch. Ambiance of the lobby bar is very nice. We sat at the bar which was comfortable. Our food was a little slow to arrive but when it did arrive it was nicely presented and delicious.

column3: Great Experience with Hyatt Regency Casablanca
column4: Overall it was a great experience with Hyatt regency Casablanca. The customer service executives and the staffs at the club lounge are good and customer friendly. I really want to thank the General Manager for his hospitality and managing the hotel. Thank and Best Regards, Talal Alawadhi

This hotel is richly furnished and decorated and has two good quality restaurants and a nice pool area. However it seems to be more of a business hotel than for holidays with lots of corporate functions and events. We stayed at the weekend and there was very little atmosphere and the restaurants were almost empty. The pool was not really set up for sun bathing and the bar and lounge areas are dark. The selection of food available in the executive lounge was disappointing although this is a brighter room on the 8th floor to sit and enjoy the surrounding views. Our room was very comfortable and well equipped with a great view of the grand mosque. Despite being on the 10th floor the noise from the road below was unbearable with car horns blaring late into the night. The staff were…

column3: Return visit and a welcome one
column4: the hotel is very well situated for business and is well managed. good location for getting out and about in Casablanca. very friendly and efficient staff. great rooms and dining options. no problems at all during my various stays. quiet rooms which is an advantage

The lobby is great but the rest of the facilities are not as good as expected by the look of the lobby. The swimming pool suppose to be opened but it was an event so it was surrendered by people dressing up and tables, and the pool looks absolutely nothing like the pictures. The gym is awful. The rooms are good, quite big and comfy. Breakfast it's ok, even though quality of the food is not as good as supposed to be

It was really pleasant experience, and unforgettable. I was happy in Hyatt Regency Casablanca , also their breakfast was amazing. I have got a double room with king size bed, nice view as well. I will be more than happy to repeat the experience again.

The entire hotel team is customer focused and offers an high level of service and quality. The staff works with maximum dedication and clearly is always available to support customer. They never say no. Rooms are very good.

column3: Do not stay Hyatt Regency; skip Casablanca on your tour
column4: Upon arriving at the Hyatt Regency staff were confused about the details of our online reservation. When we tried to clarify, they were defensive and did not take our feedback. The concierge service was equally unhelpful. On the first night we asked directions to locations around the hotel. We received a vague, "brush off answer." the next day, the individual handed us a map while on the phone with another client, waving us away without an explanation. To note, there are certain "classes" of bookings for the hotel - per the prices listed on their website. We booked the base rate and were told that were not eligible for many of the hotel amenities because we had "not paid enough money." Overall the hotel experience was sub-par - the room and lobby were dirty, the restaurants…

This is a business hotel in a business city. If you have stayed at one Hyatt, they are all run pretty much the same. I should mention that I only stayed here one night. I never ate at the hotel. The rooms are nice and the place is run very efficiently It is across from the only medina in Casablanca, although this medina isn't anything to shout about.

The hotel itself was very nice and clean. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Yet, overall I found it not mean or unfriendly ... but certainly not welcoming! The prices were high which we certainly knew when we booked but felt a familiar hotel change would be safe idea at the beginning and end of our trip, yet the rest of our travels we were met with such hospitality and smiles that it was sad to encounter. The hotel restaurant was high end, as was their food ... but again at a price. We felt safe there and that is what mattered most when we booked.

column3: Hyatt Regency - fluctuations in service from good to worst
column4: Been to this hotel more than 15 times and saw the services fluctuating between good to worst. Staff try to or act to feel us special but it is not consistent. Hotel it self is quite old and facilities often go wrong like AC not working etc.

Spend a night with my family, the porter welcomed me and quickly took my luggage. Check in was quite quick the person was friendly and helpful. The hotel in general is clean and very well maintained, the rooms are clean and immaculate they have a spectacular view of the square. Check out was fast and without delay. I would definitely return to this hotel.

A group of 35 of us stayed here in November. The hotel is a haven, an oasis in a mad city like Casablanca.With incredible decor, stunning rooms, it truly was a great pleasure to stay here. The staff were SUPER nice and accommodating. Bringing several groups a year to Morocco - HYATT it is!

column3: View of city from your room
column4: Very decent property. Good location; right in market area. Quite safe if you travel with family. Amazing choice of restaurant and also has a night club. Rooms are very spacious and well ventilated. Breakfast spread may not be a wow but you can ask your choice at an additional cost.

Outstanding services - the staff are true service embasadors - always ready to help and professional - every single one of them , from the airport pick- up to the checkout .There must be a secret behind this consistent quality service ! Well done Hyatt

This is an impeccable hotel which exudes excellence in hospitality at every turn. I've stayed at many, many Hyatts - but this is truly a gem of a hotel. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, family of 6. The hotel location was extremely convenient to the old Medina. You can literally walk over and shop to your heart's delight. Right across the hotel is a McDonalds, tea & coffee house and many traditional food options available. The building is extremely well maintained and there is an entire fitness complex being built. The marble floors shine and are spotless, as are the elevators, rooms, bathrooms and lounges. The breakfast buffet had some of the best yogurt I've ever had and unforgettable Moroccan tangerines. Although the entire staff is hospitable, the gentleman…

column3: Best staff of all hotels we visited while on tour
column4: The staff at the Hyatt Regency are what make the hotel a standout. The lobby is very gracious and welcoming. The views from the upper floor rooms are exceptional. But the staff starting with Rita at the reservation desk to Handi (sp) in the lobby just go above and beyond in every sense of the way. This was the 7th and last hotel in our 17 day tour and we were exhausted and sick by this time-but the positive attitude of the staff really elevated our appreciation of where we were and not to waste the last 3 days of our trip in our room but to go out and enjoy the city of Casablanca. The breakfast buffet, the room service and the concierge as well as lobby and security staff treated us like rock stars. What a great way to end our unbelievable tour of Morocco.

I stayed in this hotel for two nights.This hotel is very old and needs renovation. The toilets are very small and old. Bathroom's door is glassy and you have no privacy in there. During my stay elevator went out of order for several times. So we had to try the stairs that the door of the emergency exit didn't open properly. Staff were trying to be helpful but they didn't know enough english. In my opinion it is not a five stars hotel

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was unremarkable with the exception of the very nice bathroom. Smoking is allowed in all public areas. Located right across the street from the medina.

Lovely hotel, friendly staff and large, well equipped, clean rooms. Good location on the square with access to the tram outside as well as many taxis! The gym could be bigger/have more equipment but fine for a quick workout.

column3: Very convenient hotel, great lobby, great food
column4: Conveniently located, excellent service, best lobby in town, very good food everywhere in the hotel. Rooms are not outstanding but still very good. Always look forward to return, primarily because of the service, the lobby and the food.
