I have been staying at this hotel for past 8 years during my business trips to Morocco which is more or less two or three times a year. Centrally located, clean,safe and warm hospitality makes it a perfect business hotel

We had one night over there. It was a great choice. Our room was on the ninth floor. It was very clean. Has nice view overlooking the souk, great mosque and the sea. Happy Hour and breakfast were very nice. Reda and Eman were very welcoming and professional. We asked them from where we can get the same cookies. They gave us a name of pastries bakery and how to get there. Definitely will go back to Hayett if we went back to Casablanca.

It was my first and last time to try this hotel. Even-though it's in a central location but the hotel needs to be remodelled asap. When you enter the room you feel like you're back in the 90s! I will definitely not stay there again. But if you don't care about staying in an old hotel then you can give it a shot. Everything else there is ok.

Hyatt high standard. Rooms well furnished and well maintained. Service at the Restaurants and lobby bars not at the Hyatt level, slow and quality not excellent. Regency club floor very good, excellent service at the lounge bar. Ideal location for business men but not for family. Good security at the entrance and parking surveillance. Fatimazahra El GHERBY (guest relations) helped very much and made everything easier. Fluent English speaking with western attitude. No indoor swimming pool!!! In any case I don't think in Casablanca there is any better than this hotel.

It's an excellent hotel in a centralized location, close to shops, tram, restaurants, port, and Old Medina where pretty much everything is. Hotel has that old French feel and yet fairly modern. The hotel staff is extremely nice. I checked in super early in the morning after my overnight flight landed and yet they were able to give me a room right away. The room is nicely furnished with all the amenities of a 5-star hotel and with outlets aplenty for all your charging needs. The bed was super comfortable which was exactly what I needed after a long day of walking around town. The hotel staff was very helpful and attended to my needs when I requested extra pair of slippers. I also had the opportunity to try the local Moroccan style dinner in the hotel restaurant and it was…

This hotel is one of my favorites. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are great, location is good. Breakfast is great. In room dinning is great and also the available restaurants for dinner. My next stay in Casablanca will be in this hotel

Hyatt Hotel in Casablanca is a great place for a short visit. We were there for one night in route home. Hotel is in a great location for a short visit to the Mosque and other highlights of Casablanca.

column3: Nasr city Cairo Egypt city stars start capital 8
column4: I enjooyed my stay for 6 days in hyatt for , it was for businness residence , the hotel as clean , calm and location is near to many attractions in city center , the team was welcoming and helpful, the food was great , i had requested a cash and they provide me with 2000 dhs , secured hotel ,i had a very nice room view on the centre , ive sent 6 comfortable days and enjoyed my work

This is one of the most wonderful facilities I visited. If you are in Casablanca, don't look no further. Great location which seems little crowded however very convenient to stores, restaurants and bars.

The hotel is centrally located and is only a 10 minute walk from the casa port train station. You can catch a train from this station direct to the airport. Room are well maintained and staff is friendly. Gym and poolside are below average and not up to the Hyatt standard you would expect. Pros: centrally located has restaurants great service. we were allowed to check out late and for no extra charge as we had to the airport to pick our luggage that the airline had misplaced. Cons: staff don't speak english very well and its hard to explain what you want. property needs a makeover

Hyatt Regency Casablanca Hotel has a very good location, and it is a very nice Hotel with very helpful staff. The Hotel location makes you accessible to the old city (downtown) and to be 10 minutes away from Ain Diab.

column3: Old poor hotel and service level is very poor.
column4: Value for money is not something that you get at this hotel. Poor service across the hotel. Loads of staff across hotel but nobody interested in helping their guests. Pricing of beverages outrageous in the hotel bar.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks. Convenient location. I had an 8th floor room. Excellent room (though a little dark). The 8th floor lounge was great. Lovely snacks and a well stocked bar. Excellent staff throughout. For everyone of my 13 nights I had a good night's sleep. No complaints at all. Will definitely stay again. Highly recommended.

I stayed for business for a month and can't think of a better place to stay in Casablanca. The staff became family and treated me like family. Breakfast is impossible to skip and pool was my sanctuary. This review was long overdue. Thank you Hyatt Casablanca was an amazing stay!!!!

column3: Typical Hyatt though maintenance could be better
column4: Came to stay here for couple of nights on way out from Morocco. Very central location, very good service as you would expect from Hyatt but the rooms need a good maintenance makeover. Couple of switches were loose for instance in our room. However, nothing major or to complain about.

Hyatt is probably the best choice in Casa. Despite it's a five star, the rooms may get a little "refreshment". if you're staying on the lower floors, don't expect a nice view. the bar in the lobby is very fine, breakfast are awesome, too. staff is very helpful, despite a little longer check out when you have some special requirements.

Might go back to Casablanca just for this hotel. It's in a prime location, all the taxi drivers know it by name, and it's super safe. There are barriers and security checks on the way in. The staff is amazing. I arrived at 8am from the US on an overnight that lost me 5 hours of sleep on time difference. Since they have availability they let me check in early which was tremendously helpful. The room was extremely spacious and very plush with a great view of the main plaza in front. Even the lobby looked like a millionaires living room.

The hotel is clean, right in the center of the city, In front of the metro station and easy access to anywhere in the city. It is a bit old but you can feel the hotel is maintained and updated well. It is a business hotel so don't come for vacation as there are always conferences making the hotel crowded. The spa is awful and under-equipped yet they offer in room massages The breakfast is fine. The staff are incredibly rude, guaranteeing business and they don't want to serve professionally.

I only stayed one night. Thanks to the wonderful help of Rita at the front desk my stay couldn't be better. The service throughout was excellent. Nice sized room. Excellent breakfast. Free wifi. The only thing that bothered me was that the bathroom is not only separated from the toilet but it is not right together. Minor quibble.

Was there for a week long business trip. I picked this place again. The service and location are fantastic. I enjoyed my second stay even more than the first. The lady st the reception took great care of me knowing it's my second stay. The view from my window was a killer and had this cute seagull waking me up every morning tapping on my window 😀. So I was never late to any meetings.

I didn't expect such a horrible experience at the Hyatt. Was very disappointed. The front office desk was not so kind at the moment of check in. They gave us a terrible room in the 2nd floor (plenty was available though). The door of bathroom don't close, material not well maintained overall. Things I appreciated were the atmosphere at the club, and room service. Still the experience we had with the room was not even worth a 3 stars hotel standards.

Hyatt Regency Casablanca is an excellent choice. I have attended a medical conference there and I spent 2 very confortable nights. Rooms are well equipped. Clean with luxurious amenities. Food is excellent. The staff very helpful and friendly specially Ghita at the reception. Le Lobby is very spacious and comfortable place to relax and enjoy a double expresso

My experience in hyatt Regency in moroco was very good .. everything was really done in professional way .. reception, room , services .. staff is very welcoming smiling and helpful .. and the room is perfect

Great hotel in the center of the city. Felt very safe and close to many restaurants and sights. Was very clean and all staff was wonderful. The room was very large and spacious. You are also walking distance from the Casa Port train station and a quick taxi ride from Casa Voyageurs. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

We really enjoyed staying at the Hyatt in Casablanca. We are regular guests at Hyatts, got married at one, and the service definitely met our expectations. We really enjoyed the upgrade to the club room, and we had a wonderful view from our room at the Hassan II mosque. The food at the club was good and the Moroccan red wine was excellent! Overall, we loved staying at the hotel and will definitely return when we are back in Casablanca!

Location is the greatest in this hotel, the upper floors are the best, if you ask for a room with a view to the Hassan II Mosque or Grande Mosquée Hassan II, you'll have and unforgettable memory of the city view!

the parking lot gate was hard to findable needs more signage or lights. the bed was comfy. the morroccon restaraunt was great with best tagines we had in morocco and live show with belly dancer. parking easy once found and free with in and out privileges

I recommend this Hotel in Casablanca. Very good position. Personnel very professional. Clean and big rooms. Rooms for smokers available. If you want a drink, I suggest to check for the bill especially when it is late.

Stayed for two nights but it is right in the middle of town. So you can walk around to most sites. Great view of the mosque. Front desk staff is pleasant and helpful. Lobby is a little tired, but we enjoyed a light bite in The Living Room. Fitness center is small but doable. No spa, but we found one close by. Rooms are a good size and the a/c works. Rooms are clean and the bedding is comfortable and a lot of towels! Would stay longer but here only for a short visit in Casablanca.

The most incredible and beautiful view of Casablanca? My window at The Hyatt Regency Casablanca!!! There are few places in Morocco, that can be so charming and service oriented, it was magical to be there.

Wonderful hotel, very good breakfast and the people who work there are very friendly. Excellent location in city center. Big pool with good orientation, the lobby is very cosy and had a nice bar. This hotel is the best in town

First time on a business trip to Casablanca can leave you wondering what hotel to choose. Friends recommended this Hyatt and it was good. Good service, plenty of security, and easy to get in and out. Breakfast was good.

column3: NICE BUT ODD ROOM, GREAT PEOPLE
column4: Okay, so i was here with my family and we checked in with wonderful people at the desk. We got up to the room and it looked so nice! One design flaw that I think is just a european/african (not american) thing was the shower door was clear, but that is common and not a problem. The door to the bathroom was also clear! This caused discomfort in the room, as no one could be on that half of the room while someone was showering for risk of breaching their privacy. The views were excellent, as we could see the Grande Mosque. The food and restaurant experience was lovely and I would love to stay here again if I could! DEFINITELY STAY HERE!!!

This was our last hotel after 2 weeks of family travel in Morocco. We appreciated all the amenities that a upscale hotel offers. Great location. Expensive burgers in the restaurant but they were delicious. Most memorable was the professional staff, in particular, Houmiri in the Club Level. He was gracious and always greeted us with a smile.

We had booked a night at the Hyatt prior to beginning a 3 week OAT tour and after the stress of 30 hours of traveling and list luggage it was the perfect decision. I was greeted warmly and professionally after my midnight arrival and the hotel kindly charged my credit card and paid my taxi driver in cash. A pretty nifty arrangement for non-Uber taxis who only accept cash. Our room, 906, was paneled in rich ribbon mahogany and beautifully furnished. Beds were extremely comfortable and appreciated after a long journey. An arrival snack of fruit and biscuits greeted us, as is the custom in most Arabic lodging. Power outlets were plentiful and there was a nice working desk. We had upgraded to a view room and it was worth it. The view of the old Medina and Hassan II mosque…

A pleasant experience all around! Friendly staff, comfortable rooms - for us a very enyojable transition from charming roads in other parts of Morocco back to international hospitality, with a pleasant local touch. Can't improve on the proximity to the medina. The exercise facilities are not quite up to the same standard of excellence, but certainly do the trick.

Very good location and staff are very kind and helpful and supportive any time and you will feel that you are in good hands. and very welcome and you will never forget to come back to the hotel in each time you want to visit Casablanca

A gorgeous hotel in the heart of Casablanca. Beautiful rooms, walk-in shower a huge bonus. No pool to speak of when pools are the most beautiful in Morocco. Service is slow all over Morocco but especially in this hotel.

column3: One of the best customer service in town
column4: The hotel is a perfect place for business stay. Ludivine, the hotel manager is just doing everything to accommodate customer needs and requests. Her high professionalism and awesome can-do attitude makes me forget instantly any issues I have with the hotel, whether it's the booking or the room request as she proved she can sort them out almost instantly. I highly recommend this venue for anyone coming to do business in Casablanca.

A very nice property convenient to the waterfront. Modern on the outside with traditional décor on the inside. Excellent service. Good restaurants, although some open late or not every day. Overall very pleased.

excellent , good location , good food , good hospitality , nice reception , health club was under repair , swimming pool was very good out door , staff are will train & smile all times and well educate

I stayed here for one night, i hated Casablanca but the hotel was nice. The check in staff was the downside as they were very short and a bit rude. The staff at breakfast were lovely though. The rooms were very nice, big bed and spacious room.

column3: Consistent... and has potential to be great but....
column4: I stayed here 1 year apart (Oct 2015 and 2016) and not much changed. The staff was still very good - very helpful and professional, particularly at the front desk. Check in process was efficient, but beware of the rooms. As in all hotels some are better than others / in need of maintenance. The first room was not clean - used dental floss on the floor. The second room also at the front of the hotel overlooked the hotel's construction. Big machines drilling so noisy room at all times. I then moved to a room facing the back / mosque. The view here is much better - overlook a main road and the souq.The windows in the room did not seal properly, but after I had maintenance fix that the room was quieter. Note that without construction the rooms at the front are quieter, particularly…

We stayed twice, as part of a group. The first time, all was excellent: the room was spacious and sparkling clean, the bed and pillows were super comfy, the elevators were fast, the hallways quiet, the breakfast buffet was outstanding (the best we had in our 2-week visit of the country). There were 2 free water bottles in the room. Then, we got room 429 when we returned 14 days later. It was the filthiest room of our tour. Something wet was fermenting and oozing out of the carpet onto the marble floor of the bathroom. The bad smell was limited to the area near the door. If we did not have a 3 a.m. wake-up call, we would have changed rooms.

Check inn staff & club floor staff was good & very efficient. location is k but peak times too much traffic around the hotel which makes meetings out side hotel makes difficult however the ambiance inside hotel is good but smokers are free to smoke in ground floor lobby n cafe which is unhealthy

Centrally located, very nice! Clean, courteous staff members. The hotel is going under renovation, but upheld great standards. The restaurant has delicious angus beef. Free valet parking for guests. We used the regency lounge during our stay, and I want to thank the lounge staff for an excellent experience! Their customer service was wonderful and attentive. Would return to this hotel if given the opportunity.

I had a perfect stay. No issues at all. Very nice stafff in front desk, restaurants, house keeping. Especially Fatima, he manager in charge, is very helpful and kind. Try Taijin in Dal Beira restaurant.

This hotel was excellent in all aspects of the visit. All the staff I meet at the hotel were excellent, from organising taxis & ordering food and drink, this place was ideal. Exactly what hospitality should be. The location of the hotel is ideal at the centre of Casablanca & next door to the outdoor markets. Its right in the middle of the hussle and bussle. The hotel has some nice restaurants, bars and a nightclub which I frequented. In one of the restaurants later in the evening you could watch "Belly Dancing" which was something different for entertainment. If you are looking to stay at this hotel, I would book it now. Its the best one in the area according to the local business people I meet and my own personal experience. Thanks to all the staff that I meet during my…

Perfect location, perfect accommodations, YUM food, impeccable, ALL new, hammam outstanding, the pool super cool, the service attentive. Extraordinary stay. The was comfortable, roomy, tasteful. The breakfast to die for.

Top place to spend a night in the heart of Casa. People are polite, professional, services are good. Only weakness is the spa that is not at the level of a 4 stars hotel. Food is good but not value for money

Also this stay, ALL fine again !! Friendly staff, excellent breakfast + restauatants and rooms are nice and quite. BUT best to book the Hotel's own transport to the airport as local taxi's in front of the Hotel do battle for money and increase prices accordingly !

Very Nice Property, Nice Room and View. Staff was excellent. Problem: I was charged more for the room than I was quoted a,d more than I ws told when I checked it. At checkout the would not honor quoted price.

column3: Good location, good hotel but could be better
column4: I like the service and the overall vibe of the hotel, spacious rooms, nice bathrooms and good service. However i liked less the noise, it has very poor isolation i could hear my neighbours speak on the phone, take their shower and walk... The breakfast was kind of a deception for me I expected more choices and specifically moroccan options for traditional breakfast. Overall it exceeds all of the other hotels located in the same area which is very central.

Friendly & helpful front receptionist. Appreciated the upgrade to the Suite, the huge fruit bowl & the red wine! Got greeted by the Lady Manager (sorry I misplaced her name card). The Suite was spacious & nicely decorated. Loved the softness of the towels. However, would love to raise that the step in the toilet area was a little bit dangerous, & the shower did not drain well. Overall, an excellent stay. Would not hesitate to recommend.

I stayed one night in this hotel on my way to Marrakech. The hotel is well located close to the Medina and it's also close to the railway station (Casa port). There's also a tram station right by the hotel. There are also exchange offices and restaurants close to the hotel. The hotel itself is well furnished with almost every equipment one might need in a room and very comfortable (just what one might expect from a Hyatt). Although it was quite expensive.

When I reached there , some one advised me to take flat , but if your arrived from long trip and looking for good place and services and night club you will find all those things in this hotel ,, near to traditional markets

Had a 2 day/3 night stay for a conference in the hotel. Rooms comfortable, spacious, well ventilated and with excellent wifi. Also surprising quiet given the location. Bar and breakfast service was fine, front desk rather sleepy and slow, concierge much better.

So many problems : parking in construction since years, dangerous location and no action from security when a bad experience is on in front of the house, no pool allowed to individuals because a seminar is on for lunch, juice bottles and coffee Nespresso caps stolen in our Suite, just ... 0 follow up to feed-back from staff.

column3: the right place to be in Casablana
column4: very practical location for business, true it's a big hotel like these industrial chain of hotels but here you feel some charm of the city, the service in front desk and restaurant for both breakfast and lunch has been always outstanding, you feel a dedicated and experienced staff. I have stayed many times and it's always the same standard of service.

We stayed elsewhere but twice went to the Hyatt Regency to eat as there weren't very many other good options in the area. We gad dinner in the Moroccan restaurant of the Hyatt Regency - a truly dreadful "vegetarian tagine" which consited of frozen vegetables warmed up with butter in a tagine dish. Cost was $19 for this farce. Next we had a meal in the international restaurant in the Hyatt Regency. The food was fine. Salmon was OK, Hamburger cost $31 - yes, $31, but at least none of what we ate made us sick.

It was great experience in this hotel which is near to the traditional market and to the old city, the hotel was good even its old hotel but still maintained well .. I like it and recommended to others

column3: An island of tranquility in a sea of traffic and business
column4: We had acquired enough Hyatt points from their co-branded card to stay for a night at the Hyatt Regency as we passed through Casablanca. What a wonderful experience! Gorgeous, old-world tranquility with a large, quiet lobby and bar area, dark wood and subdued lights, and dozens of intimate nooks where you could carry on a business or personal conversation. The bar had reasonably priced drinks, and some free appetizers which showed up at our table as if by magic. We shared a bottle of Moroccan Chardonnay, which was surprisingly good, and took in the ambiance. One note: for those who are bothered by smoking, there is no apparent relief. Many people smoke, and the ventilation system doesn't do a good job of pulling the smoke out of the bar and lobby. The hallway leading to our room…

column3: Good location, some vegetarian items, smoking prevalent in the public lounge
column4: Good hotel in downtown. It is located off a one way street so getting to it can be challenging. It is walking distance to most of the tourist sites. The tram is just across the street. The room & bathroom were very clean & nice. There were 2 things that made me give a lower rating; 1. The lounge area next to the lobby was smoke filled. For those who dislike tobacco smoke, this is very irritating 2. The vegetarian & vegan items were limited for what I would expect from a Hyatt Regency.

column3: Great spot. Ideal for access to many parts of the city
column4: Second visit and it was excellent as expected. Staff are very welcoming and the rooms are just right. Breakfast is great value. I did not eat elsewhere in the hotel other than room service which again was very good. Recommended location for a Casablanca visit

I had an amazing 6 nights stay at the place just across the street from the old Casablanca city, the tram station to get anywhere in the city and 5 minutes walk from the train station with an easy access to Marrakech, Rabat and other cities had to travel to. The staff at the reception and breakfast area are exceptionally helpful. The gym is the thing that can be improved

column3: See-through glass doors on a bathroom area? Indeed a puzzler.
column4: I was not a member of Trip Advisor when we stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Casablanca for one night while part of a group tour last January 2016 but now that I am I wanted to remark on a design feature at the Hyatt that has puzzled me since that stay. The room we were in was very nice—clean, comfortable and up-to-date. The bathroom was in a separate, small room, which is not very convenient as you do not have access to a sink should you need it. However, the real puzzler was the see-through glass door for the tub/shower/sink area, remarked upon by earlier reviewers as well. The door to that area faces the bed, at least it did in our room, so 1) there is no privacy by virtue of both the glass door and its location, and 2) if you use the bathroom and then turn on the light to…

Nice hotel,clean & spacious room(esp#101),friendly staff. Breakfast continental & medium range foods. Hotel restaurant has delicious traditional marocain foods. Spa,gym & pool are available. Next to hotel you find a nice souk where easily you can by Argan oil(marocain exclusive plant) but I advice you to by from a pharmacy not market.In addition to souvenirs & lamb leather ....

The hotel is a typical four star hotel. Was renovated recently. Beds are comfortable. I did not like the separation between toilet and shower area. Service was adequate staff were very kind. They accommodated all my needs. I would definitely stay there again.

While this hotel was nice, rooms were clean and well appointed, nothing really wrong with the hotel but it would have been better if we had stayed closer to the beachfront. We spent very little time here so I am unable to give a good review, except for breakfast and the wonderful gentleman who looked after me, he went above and beyond his duties. I do not remember his name but he was so attentive to make sure I got my first taste of Moroccan cuisine, the food was lovely and the setting was lovely. Thank you for looking after me. Only bad thing I could say is that the drinks and extras were extremely expensive.

The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Food was good. The problem with the location is that the area is very crowded and to get to the hotel by car is a nightmare during rush hours. The hotel needs some renovations and some of the furniture need to be changed.

I tried various hotels in Casablanca in last years but prefer coming back to this hotel if places are available. You feel to be a valuable guest from entering the door before check-in to leaving the door after check-out. The staff is well trained and there are not many changes in the staff which is good to keep the quality of services. The only comment from me is the location of the breakfast in a place which is not very convenient mainly in busy time (limited space). But otherwise, very good.

column3: Still good hotel, but they should work more on keeoing it fresh
column4: While I still like the hotel, I was apparently in a lower booking catagory this time (still at a >200 EUR per night rate) and at this price class I was a bit disappointed about some details, e.g. no slippers, hangers were theft-safe (and vey cheap/ugly), cheapest toilet paper, toilet paper holder not properly fixed. As said, otherwise still a fine hotel. Given the age of the building, Hyatt should pay extra effort that the quality remains high inside (outside, it looks outdated anyways, but this is not important to me really).

Stayed here for a week at a business conference, right in the square and next to the market makes it an exciting and great placed hotel. My room large and clean, the pool is pretty cool. Unfortunately the gym was closed for a refurbishment and just a few running machines were made available. The food was fantastic and most of the staff were brilliant.

The hotel is in a very good location for having access to different must see places of Casablanca and also public transport. The lobby ambiance and rooms is perfect and you have a good smell in all places of the hotel. staff are polite and hepful. rooms are big with good facilities and the breakfast was perfect.

Only spent one night at the hotel as we were transiting from Tenerife to Kuwait. Very nice hotel. Extremely professional service. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom was spacious. Would definitely stay there if I returned to Casablanca.

everything was marvelous. very clean rooms polite and helpful staff ,great location just few minutes from old dedina-market. very meticulous food, satisfactory varied breakfast. Public spaces super and clean

I visit morocco ones a year. I have stayed in classical hotels and last year decided to change to a new modern style. I searched online and found the Hayyat to be the newest in that area. I moved from the old style 5 star to the hayyat. I can say that this hotel makes you feel that it's 2016. New Style. Nice clean rooms. Great service. The guests are high class and some are on business trips. They have a nice night life in the weekends. The price is high comparing the other 5 star hotels in the same style. I am not sure if this hotel is ok for kids. Over all I will stay in this hotel in my next stay. Have a great vacation and best regards. Dr SD 2016.

Casablanca has always been a doubtful question on matter of hotel stars. For this hotel it is just the same rule. It should be a 5star hotel, but Is is almost the case. Most probably it would be in Marakesh as the competition is hard over there. Breakfast 4,5 Room 4,5 Hygiene 4 Service 4

We decided to stay at the Hyatt Regency in Casablanca based on the reviews and were very happy that we chose this hotel. The location is fantastic with accessibility to the Transport and also local market and other shopping options. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful at all times. Truly service with a smile. The rooms were excellent. The best thing about the hotel was the food. would personally recommend the Lamb Tagine.

A great hotel, friendly staff, great ambiance in the lobby and the friendliest front desk staff ever. Breakfast was delicious with a selection of fresh Moroccan bakes, freshly squeezed juices and smoothies to get you energised for the day A local souk (Bazaar) is just across the road

Superb service and nice accomodations. Centrally located and great view of the city and harbor. Check in was easy and we were rewarded with an upgraded that was above our expectations. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Casablanca area

Had wonderful stay at the Hyatt! I love the fact that this hotel is centrally located right in the heart of Casablanca . The view of the mosque from our rooms was top notch!!.. I could the see the whole town from my location. Exceptional service from ever one we came across. Very friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel one hundred percent to any one who asks:) Loved the little perfume store in from. The girls there are wonderful!!.

The staff makes the place. From the manager to the doorman, they all make you feel welcome and at home. They all make sure you are taking care of and they do remember what you like ! Kassy was the greatest. Best service !!! Both restaurant are very good.

This little urban oasis was Perfect for the desert heat! The grilled fish and steamed veggies help me stay on top of my clean diet while on the road. Not the best pool but certainly did the job! Had to check the manager at 1st as the staff was actin ignorant but ended up having me a good ol'time!

the hotel has an excellent location. the best part of it was the service of the staff in every single way. they arrange every single request that we had. the food and drinks were good not fabulous but good. the rooms are comfortable and well clean. the infrastructure is a bit old but very well conserve. maybe a touch up will help. would recommend it!

column3: Among the best 5 star hotels of Casablanca
column4: I am a person who travel often to Morocco. I have stayed mainly et 5 star hotels in most major cities of Morocco. Hyatt, with only one exceptions (breakfast not too varied compared with other 5 star hotels from Casablanca), was a hotel where I felt great. Miss Ludivine UGHETTO, Front Office Manager was helpful and kind. I had a room overlooking Place Des Nations Unies, on the 10th floor. Nice view! The rooms are in a good condition furniture / equipment, clean and spacious.

Cool place to stay in Casablanca. The hotel is an oasis in the middle of the town...Breakfast is delicious and the room views are great overlooking the Hassan Mosque. No doubt is the best hotel in town.

Very nice staff and excellent location. Ask for room with view of the mosque and souks. The concierge was very helpful with prices for cabs, etc. dinner in the Moroccan restaurant was very good. Be sure to try Moroccan wine too!

Great location. Wonderful inside architecture. Very confortable rooms and view on the city. SPA and massage are up to the task. Breakfast buffet is just fantastic, ranging from Salmon to figs and dates. Recommended for business, torusim or romantic visit to the city.

An old hotel which needs renovation, not so attractive, breakfast and dinner were awful. friendly staff thought.. The area is so croweded, would take a 15 mins walk to the train station. Gym is ok. overall, as a Hyatt, it should be better.

column3: Could almost be a five star
column4: The staff make this place! They are absolutely wonderful and genuinely care about your stay and comfort! From the manager to the door man everyone did a fantastic job to make sure my family was taken care of! If you want great service, this is the place to be. The Resturant and breakfast rooms are so beautifully done and the selection of food is great! With a few upgrades this could be a five star hotel in Casablanca. There is no noise at all despite the fact that you are close to the medina and Main Street. I will definitely be staying again. Thank you Hyatt for making our first trip to Morocco amazing and Imane from guest relations for being the sweetest kindest person to my family, you went beyond the call of duty to translate, recommend places for us to go, making sure we…

We had a fantastic experience at the Hyatt from the moment we arrived. The staff was so friendly and courteous from the doormen, front desk, restaurants and pool bar. We stayed for 4 nights and were recognized and greeted warmly as we came and went. It's a lovely hotel and right in the middle of everything you could want to see in Casa. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

I Stayed in the Hayatt for 1night for my vacation in casablanca the location was great and the resturants were very good and various the hostess was profissional and friendly she was approaching with here kind assistance every time, i invited my best friend to the swimming pool and the reception lady duty manager stoped her from get in i asked her if she can only change and help me to pack my bag because we were checking out same day she refused in a bad way she didnt talk about the policy which i will fully understand if she spoke about but she was very rude and she was talking with her hands you can check the cameras i was not waiting from the HYATT REGENCY one of my family favorite hotel to treat me like this, i really want to thank the concierge for his help and the bell…

Stayed here for 4 nights with my family ( 3 young kids). Good hotel with nice large pool. Rooms were spacious and very clean. We had a room facing the mosque and one facing the square. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to everything! We really enjoyed going out and walking around. The souqs are right across the street and the square is so lively all hours of the day! The staff at front desk were ok. I thought the concierge people as well as the bellman staff were very friendly and excellent service. Really enjoyed staying here and hope to be back one day.

Very comfortable rooms as expected from the Hyatt. Great location too! And good breakfast :) My only gripe is that they don't let your vehicle go near the entrance for security reasons and the bell boys aren't fast on their feet so you'll have to lug your stuff across but I guess it's normal and you shouldn't be too put off by it.

column3: Paradise in the middle of Casablanca
column4: Perfect venue for any kind of stay in Casablanca. Be it a family or business trip, Hyatt Casablanca as much to offer in terms of comfort, bars, restaurant and any other services. Staff is great and makes you feel at home quickly. Service is irreproachable. Best value for money in this area.

column3: If you want to be in the middle of the city this is the place to stay!
column4: The hotel rooms at this hotel are lovely with a separate shower and toilet. The beds are also very good and pillows soft not the Moroccan hard as cement pillows. The lobby is lovely but, some of the seats are "sat out"! The hotel is quiet. There is excellent security in place. They have great bell men. The only problem that keeps me from making it a five star is the fact that the breakfast dining area has the worst tables and seats that I have ever sat in. The food was wonderful but, the seating is such that your mouth is level with the table that the food is on.

Hyatt was a very nice oasis within a very nice city. Smack in the middle of downtown and adjacent to the old city. Hotel was very clean, well organized, and gracious. Definitely recommend it. asdfghjkl;poiutyrwskadklasjdklasjdklajskldaskldklasjkld

Restaurants are excellent, specially Maroccan restaurant amazing food and atmosphere, like in a huge and luxurious touareg tent. Pastilla and maroccan pastries are delicious. Fish restaurant very good too, incredible brunch and breakfast, large choice, tasty, good products... Excellent service in room, reception and restaurant. Lobby is beautiful. Unfortunately, rooms, even if large and comfortable really need renovation and decoration, it's so common compare to the lobby or main restaurant, looks old and empty... And so is the fitness center...

column3: Very nice hotel in heart of city
column4: The hotel is great. Clean, big rooms, good breakfast spread and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a lovely stay for first one night and then two nights again. It was all great. No complaints. The hotel is located near a tram stop and near a little market. Taxis are also easily available.

column3: Amazing Experience with Team Hyatt Regency Casablanca!
column4: My wife traveled to Casablanca for business reasons and stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 10 nights. I was able to join her for the last 6 nights. At my arrival, the check-in process was fast and professional. After entering the room, we noticed the carpet was wet and called reception to report the issue; we talked to Saida [Team Leader Front Office] who took action immediately: a technician came to check for the cause of problem and found a leak coming down from the ceiling at the room entrance. Then, we saw the Hyatt Regency team in action: Saida escalated the issue to the appropriate level, called us back to inform we were going to be moved to a different room and that we had been granted access to their Club Lounge!! In less than 15 minutes they sent a staff member to help…

Really at the center of town on a too crowdy and noisy square, hotel without much charm, rooms ok in term of size but service a bit at random either super clean, either forgetting half. Food ok, breakfast a bit laborious when you want something as exotic as a toast....

We went to the bar for a business meeting. The first two of us arrived early and had to wait for quite a while for one of the staff to come and take our order. When the waitress finally arrived she showed a lot of attitude when my husband spoke in Moroccan to her. She only wanted to speak French (we are in Morocco after all!) Very odd but we ignored it and carried on. Then, when one other of our group arrived and was sitting for at least 15 mins, I went to one of the staff and asked if it they could please take our order, I got a shrug for an answer. Then another of our colleagues arrived and I caught the waitress's eye and asked her to come and she shook her head and shrugged again. I didn't want to cause a scene in front of our group but it was appalling service. I had to go…

Very qualitative service and condition of the hotel. Friendly welcome and assitance when needed. A recommendation for all who look for quality and rest. I will certainly pass again during one of my next business trips.

Ideal for the business traveller Everyone was helpful and courteous and assisted with any questions or queries We were working and ate here on 3 nights . It would be nice to have some specials on as the menu does get a bit worn when you eat here each night. Room clean smart and had 10th floor room so quiet Would recommend for the business traveler

column3: A Tranquil Centrally Located Respite in Casablanca
column4: We needed to go to Casablanca for our flights to and from Paris and initially chose the Hyatt with some reluctance after reading numerous reviews. We were pleased to find that this hotel was a perfectly fine, traditional Western hotel right in the center of Casablanca. The staff was very professional. I had called beforehand and arranged for an airport pickup and asked the hotel to arrange for a driver to Rabat the next day. The friendly, professional and efficient staff had followed up and all went according to plan. Our room was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable. On our initial stay, we had a view of Casablanca's renown Hassan II Mosque and in the foreground the beehive of a medina. I mention our "initial stay" because we were sufficiently pleased with the hotel to…

This is a good high class hotel in a good location to combine business and tourism in Casablanca Friendly English speaking staff, good service and food add to the attractiveness of the hotel Easy to get transport from

From the moment you arrive excellent service starts. Check is efficient and some how personalized.The rooms are fine although I do find the separate WC a little quirky. food is excellent and again you are surrounded by good service.

Stayed here for 4 days. Nice lobby. The room was nice. The toilet and bathroom were separated which was nice but they looked tired and dated. Asked countless times for an English newspaper at the reception and only eventually received one on our last day. At at the French restuarant attached to the hotel 3 times, the daily special of beef stroganoff with rice was excellent. Overalls the hotel is alittle pricey for what you get..

column3: An Oasis of Calm in downtown Casablanca
column4: Very nice restaurant right in the center of Downtown. Very clean, well decorated, warm and inviting with some good restaurant choices. Definitely the place to stay in Casablanca and my hotel of choice next time I go.

The only issue was with food and beverage. At breakfast I've ordered an omelette with ham and cheese and they forgot it and when I remembered them of my order I got an omelette with bacon and onions! In the evening I've ordered a cockerel with fois gras and I've got only the cockerel and when I've asked for an explanation I've got none!

column3: Average hotel in terms of luxury
column4: The rooms here are very dated and could do with upgrade, but this hotel is still probably better than other options in Casablanca. It's fairly good value for money. It has some good restaurants and the service was generally good. The club lounge has some very friendly and helpful staff. I wouldn't say this was a luxury hotel, due to the rooms, however it is a decent place to stay.

From the moment you arrive excellent service starts. Check is efficient and some how personalised. The hotel although it has seen many years of service has a grandness about it. The rooms are fine although I do find the separate WC a little quirky. Breakfast is excellent and again you are surrounded by good service. The food in the restaurant was of a very good quality.

one night spent, enough to see the quality of the service. nice accommodation. break fast is nice, with good product. bathroom is big enough. desk service is fast. i may suggest to have atm in the hotel. i didn't chance to test the swiming pool.

Average 80 s business hotel. The rooms are ok. Even though the check in staff was very kind. I had to go down to the hall to talk to the manager when i discover that the bed was broken. She solved it right away. But, only after customer services and the concierge, by the way quite rudly, were unable to assist me with that.

I stayed here before and gave a 4 star review. Upon this visit a year later I feel the need to downgrade to 3 stars. Don't get me wrong, for downtown Casa this has all the facilities and security you need. But it is horrendously overpriced and leaves you feeling very ripped off, with drinks more expensive than London or New York. A round of 5 drinks for almost €100 including €6 for water or €8.50 for Red Bull. Seriously?! The "temporary" gym has been temporary for years now. Working out on the very limited range of equipment, swatting away flies from the open doors, then navigating back to your room via unsecured doors leading to barren concrete corridors under construction / past conference guests, then hotel bar and lobby, is not grear for either party after a workout or…

I just left yesterday from this hotel. I was in other 5* hotel in Casablanca but this is the best I've seen. Clean room, spacious, with a large and fully furnished bathroom. I've tested both restaurants and they were great. Only two small points: when arrived I approached the staff in English (I don't speak French) but the guy continued to speak in French with me. May be in an international hotel like Hyatt there should be more attention to people not speaking local language. I need to say he was the only one I met during my 4 days there. Second the door was damaged. I showed the pic at my check-out and I hope it will be fixed. I repeat, these are the only two point to reach perfection (for me)..

column3: luxury hideaway in a busy city
column4: After a long flight, it was such a nice treat to stay in such a lovely place. My room wasn't ready, but was upgraded to a suite, which had a great view of the mosque and the sea. They helped with questions and transportation, everyone so attentive to making the stay comfortable and excellent.

The location of the hotel is central , the staff is very nice and helpful It's the right hotel to choose for a comfortable stay ,The room was large, very clean and comfortable , it's a lovely place to stay

column3: One of the best Hotels in Casablanca
column4: The hotel is very well situated and the lobby area is welcoming you quit nice. The restaurant M on ground floor has a good menu and quality of food is always top. Staff of the restaurant is very professional and friendly. The hotel offers spacious rooms and the suite is large. Club on the 8th floor offers delicious breakfast and drinks in the evening. The people there are top very nice. Thanks Reda and Abderahim as well as Fatima for your efforts! I truly recommend Hyatt Regency Casablanca for business travellers.

column3: Up to now the best hotel in Casa
column4: Unfortunately Casablanca does not have much choice for 5 star hotels . Hayat Regency is probably the best choice if you are looking for a 5 star hotel in the city center with all the services that you would expect from a 5 star hotel . The rooms and bathrooms are very well equipped and WiFi is great and free of charge . Breakfast is amazing and there was 2 restaurants offering Moroccan and French specialities .

The place is good since this is in the heart of Casablanca. Though the place is so traffic but its lively at night. A lot of people in the plaza can can be seen from the hotel. I suggest to book this hotel in the future.

The Hyatt is really well located - a safe place as well. The rooms are very comfortable and the amenities at the level you would expect for a hotel of this standing. The staff is really helpful, courteous and attentive as well - it was a very nice stay and a definite repeat!

I expected better from Hyatt brand. The hotel looked dark and dim. The rooms need renovation and fixing. The breakfast was OK but would recommend a bigger selection for a buffet. Service is good and quick. The spa was undergoing some work so couldn't use it.

Staffs are so friendly. Love my five days stay. It is very centre, so you can just have a stroll walk to Old Medina and the nice market close by. We have a day trip to Rabat which is lovely. The hotel arrange for the trip for us. I love the moroccan breakfast. Overall was lovely!!!

Located in downtown Casablanca, the Hyatt regency is a jewel. World class service, spacious business class rooms, beautiful view (if you're facing east) of the city and the Atlantic port. It's my second visit and I can't help coming back!

column3: Great Hotel - Great Location - Great Service
column4: I really enjoyed staying at the hotel due to the high level of service, location and other amenities. Staff are friendly and care about your needs. The souq and shopping district is also just next door. Breakfast at the hotel is extensive with a wide range. The spa is also a must visit.

An exceptional hotel with remarkable staff. We felt at home the minute we arrived. The entire property is clean, secure and very well maintained. We especially enjoyed the Regency Club - hosted by Houmiri or Rida - for relaxing morning breakfast and evening cocktails (including some very good Moroccan wines).

I have stayed at Hyatts on four continents and the Hyatt Regency Casablanca is easily one of the best. We had a truly wonderful time. Every member of the staff we encountered was gracious and professional and showed a genuine interest in making our stay one to remember. The hotel is stylish, contemporary and immaculately maintained. It's a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of the medina just across the street. Security staff was vigilant but unobtrusive. The hotel's conference facilities are an excellent and conducive to productive and engaged meetings. Every aspect of this facility is top notch!

The Hyatt was absolutely fabulous! They called me by name from the minute I walked in until I checked out. The staff was very accommodating, friendly and helpful. The food at the living room was excellent and the staffs suggestions were very helpful. I stayed at another hotel as well but there was no comparison, this hotel is definitely 10 stars!

column3: Top notch customer service, beautiful rooms.
column4: Great property highlighted by thorough, professional service across the board. Interacted with management, concierge, desk staff, bell staff, wait staff, security personnel and all of my interactions were executed flawlessly. I was very impressed with the level of service at this hotel. Wonderful evening of food and entertainment in the moroccan restaurant in the hotel. What a classy and elegant space! Room was beautifully appointed. I very much appreciated the macaroons provided in the room. A perfect afternoon snack after check-in along with a nice cup of espresso from the in-room coffee maker. Great location right on the light rail line for easy access to/from Casa Voyageurs train station and just across the street from the markets. Some confusion between the hotel and…

We spent one night here in June 2015. This is a pretty standard Hyatt Regency (much like what you'd find in the US) - reliably clean and comfortable. We had a suite, which was spacious and allowed my husband to work in the other room while I rested from the long journey. We ate at the outdoor restaurant on the lobby level, which was better than average for hotel food.

This is a nice hotel. The staff are exceptional, nothing is too much trouble. I have not stayed in that many Hyatt's before. Hotel slightly dated, but it was clean and functional. Plenty of good eating and drinking options. Smoking is everywhere and very invasive, but it's Morocco. Local markets close by, and plenty of fast food and cafe options a stones throw from the hotel.

the hyatt Regency has got a wonderful location in the middle of Place des nations unies, downtown and next to the sea port area where many good restaurants are available. I found the room in a very good condition, big and clean, nice bathroom with a separate small room for the wc only. wifi working properly and fast enough. the gym is a temporary one, very small, but it has been "temporary even the last time I was there, 2 years ago..... the breakfast assortment is complete, sweet and salty and the restaurant staff is quick to serve the drinks. I do not particularly like to be forced to seat on a sofa chair while having breakfast. the staff is kind and professional. I was considering a limo service from and to the airport but unfortunately as it happens in most of the hyatts…

Located in the heart of the city, the hotel is ok. rooms are large and clean. The ambiance is nice... Moroccan food obviously good.. the staff are friendly and helpful.. the metro/city monorail is just right outside... the soux/market is also nearby..

Standard business hotel with a conference going on to complete the effect. Large lobby, piano bar, lots of activity, and people; busy, busy, busy. Rooms standard and comfortable. Provided a box breakfast because we left so early that was pretty standard, had coffee and tea along with it.

We stayed at the hotel twice within a week, for a total of 3 nights. The staff is great all around, the hotel is clean and has a nice decor. The wifi in the hotel is good too. Both times we were upgraded to a suite, which were very nice. The executive suite especially is wonderful and big. Both suites were comfy, with amazing beds, new flat screen TVs, safe, and Nespresso machine. The automated minibar is annoying though (especially with a kid and if I just want to store some of my own drinks). Also, the furniture/fixtures in the rooms are mostly old and need refurbishment. The airco/heating works fine for cold air but didn't provide heat as we experienced some of the colder days in Casablanca at the end of winter. We ate once at the buffet breakfast and it's amazing. Lots of…

column3: great staff, great location, great hotel
column4: For the second time in a row, I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff was helpful and friendly, and the hotel is located near most major attractions. I will definitely go back again when I get a chance to do so..

column3: Probably the best Hotel in Casablanca
column4: Always a pleasure to be a guest in this Hyatt Regency. People are very friendly and polite. Quality and details are respected. Well desreved 5 star ranking. The hotel is central and very well located in fact public transport is also just in front of the door. Rooms are spacious and very clean, good comfort. The restaurant M has good foodand staff is very professinal.

column3: If only all hotels were this good
column4: Upon arrival you feel this is going to be good. An exclusive approach we were met by attentive staff, and we hadn't entered the building.Inside a luxurious lobby with lots of flowers and space. Check in was perfect. We had a late super in the bar nothing was too much trouble. Every department at this hotel was as it should be. Reception,house keeping,the concierge service was above and beyond. Food and beverage again superb. An excellent breakfast starts your day, we also had perfect lunches and an evening in their moroccan restaurant delicious! Our room was spotless,spacious,quiet,good bathroom and amazing view. We will return.

column3: In the heart of the city
column4: Wonderful clean place with very good service and lovely hotel in the downtown CASABLANCA . Food is of very good quality especially the desserts . Staff are very helpful and always smiling . The view was on the center of the city and the room was very clean . The problem was only that the wc was away from the bathroom , very rare to see in any hotel I visited.

after I stayed in Hyatt Regency for the 1st time in November 2015 and wrote a nice review, in the 2nd visit I was very disappointed. my reservation was done through my company and upon check in. the front disk asked my for a deposit 100 Euro/night. i said that i don`t have enough Euros to pay this deposit so she told me that i can just pay 150 Euro for the 5 nights. i payed and upon check out she payed me back the remaining money in Moroccan Dirham which make my lost a lot in currency exchange. all this happened despite i had a company guarantee that makes me did n`t need to pay any deposit. and the Hotel front disk should know that i don`t need to pay and take advantage of my unawareness. it is my last time to stay there and all my friends have been told about this bad…

I had an amazing business lunch in Hyatt Regency. The service and the food was excellent. The service was quick enough. Waiters were polite and ready to help us in any arising question we had. I would highly recommend it to anyone else.

column3: Great hotel but pity about the 'don't walk outside' warning!
column4: After a series of flights I arrived in this famed city. Keen to walk outside and explore at about 9pm. The hotel front desk said' no go'. Retired to my room sadly. Again the next day i asked and was told 'dont go'. Sad. My room was great, well appointed, good soaps etc. Internet was quite fast.Breakfast was adequate if unremarkable. A casual dinner (remember I could not explore) was tasty, well priced and served in the casual lounge. Service was generally very good. So, I enjoyed the hotel in every respect and the unsafe areas was not of their making so overall no groups and would recommend the hotel.

Comfortable stay at the hotel. The restraunts are amazing specifically the Moroccan restaurant at the hotel. Will definitely come back here. Highly recommended for long stay as well. If you are a club member then the evening hour devours are excellent.

column3: Nice rooms and friendly staff, but the whole place could do with a renovation...
column4: Location not that great. Building in relatively poor state = not great impression upon arrival at the hotel. Reception at arrival OK but not very friendly. Rooms very good, even though rooms on the road side are quite noisy. Did not try the restaurant and bar, so cannot judge. VIP Lounge very good, mainly due to the super nice and effective team there. All in all good but not very good.

First time to visit Casablanca, the hotel was nice, its location is not the best area in Casablanca. The food was average, the bed was very nice and comfortable. Meeting rooms and facilities were good but the ac in the meeting rooms Is either too hot or too cold!!

column3: Nice Hotel, Noisy Night of Sleep
column4: Nice hotel surrounded by a sketchy neighborhood in the middle of Casablanca. Nice room, but booming music kept me awake all night. Need better sound proofing in rooms. Staff who speak better English would have made it a more comfortable place for an American who speaks no French or Arabic.

Great hotel, the lounge is first class with great service , good bar but small gym , friendly staff, located in the centre of the city and close to the water and restaurants- no complaints, will come back again.

This Hyatt hotel offers everything an experienced traveller would require. The setting is in the very heart of the city close to the new Casaport railway station offering the possibility to use the train to explore other cities. Rooms are spacious and the restaurant were breakfast is served is fabulous. Maybe a little expensive but worth while. Excellent for business as well as for pleasure.

I was there for business and spent 4 nights there. This is a very well located hotel. Should you are doing business in the twin towers, you can reach the spot in 15 minutes by foot. The hotel is in front of a tramway station, very convenient to reach the technopark. It's also close to the railway station Casa Port. Casablanca's souks are very close and you will find a good choice of nice restaurant in the area. My room was large very clean and furnished in an elegant style. Everyday 2 bottles of water were delivered. Bathroom was spacious with a shower and a separated tub. You will find in the room everything that you would wait for like a safety looker and some good quality bath accessories. I've taken the breakfast only twice during my stay but it's a real breakfast with…

column3: A luxurious treat and great location for short stay
column4: - Rooms are well maintained and well furnished. Was delighted to enjoy a plate of oranges and macarons when we entered (better than any oranges we purchased ourselves in various souks). - Big bath, big separate shower. Toilet was in a separate little room, far from the rest of the room, so a lot more privacy from each other than we had in any riad earlier in the week! Nice amenities. - Lobby is tastefully done and we enjoyed a glass of wine one night. Reasonably priced. - Good wifi. - Walking distance to the smaller train station. Probably even walking distance to Hassan II Mosque (maybe 20+ minutes), but it was raining, so we cabbed it. - The area is a bit seedy in terms of restaurants, etc - but we found a decent local place within a few minutes walking of the hotel.

Top adress in Casablanca. The hotel is in the best aera in the middle of the city. It is the second time I was in the Hyatt Regency Casablanca. The comfort is on top level. The staff very friendly and the management as alwas very efficient.

Well located hotel with a nice view of the medina in the old city. Attentive staff inside the hotel. Rooms need a fresh look to reflect the 21st century. Hotel is nearby many attractions with an easy access transportation.

This hotel has a fantastic lobby and is really well located in front of the medina. The room was nice and clean. The heating system wasn't working in our room but they came to repair it immediately when we complain. At night, we had neighbors that made a lot of noise and didn't let us sleep, so we called the concierge that offers us to change us to another room, but we refused, so he called the noise neighbors and the problem was solved.

We checked in on my birthday and they gave us an upgrade to Club room and nice birthday cake. The staffs are very helpful and attentive to our needs. The manager Zahra is very professional and focused on making our checking-in a smooth one. As for location, there are souks around the hotel, however the Moroccan restaurant in the hotel is strongly recommended. We will always be back to this hotel as we are their lifetime members.

After two weeks on the road, many of those staying in a riad or Nomad tent, we stayed our last night in Morocco at the Hyatt in Casablanca. Call me a spoiled Westerner (I am), but it was so nice to get a night in a luxury hotel with all the amenities. As far as Hyatt's go, this one was as good as any, and the view of the old medina with the Hassan II mosque and Atlantic ocean in the distance was spectacular. And it is is just the right location for sightseeing on foot if that is your thing. Won't go wrong staying here.

Very comfortable well located hotel. Just near the old medina and across the Riad from main thoroughfares. Rooms have a real character to them. Service is excellent. A dinner at Cafè M is really worth the experience.

The hotel is well located on the United Nations Plaza in the center of Casablanca. It is a large, white, bland, rectangular building whose cracking exterior plaster, particularly at the end, reveals its age. To make matters worse, an absurdly discordant entrance canopy in faux Graeco-Roman style has been added to the front. This tacky structure looks as if it was salvaged on the cheap from some sword-and-sandals epic in the film studios of Quarzazate. Once you get inside things improve markedly. The public areas are modern, sleek, and handsome. Check-in is efficient, with staff who speak fluent English and who are unfailingly courteous and helpful. My room was excellent -- expansive and comfortable, with good TV, desk area, wifi, and large windows. The bathroom was…

Hyatt Regency Casablanca is every bit what you expect from a luxury hotel, starting from the security aspect to the service and cleaniness. Rooms have a real character to them, and do not feel as impersonal as other luxury alternatives in Casablanca. Service is excellent. A dinner at Cafè M is really worth the experience

A great hotel to relax in a City that is a little edgy. I arrived and had booked a club level room, but they upgraded me to a suite, what a nice surprise. The club lounge was very nice, and the staff were wonderful. I wish I could have stayed a little longer but my schedule did not permit it. The only down side was the fitness area that was piecemeal and was in a few different rooms with limited equipment. Aside from the lack of workout facilities, I had a great stay. Thanks

I would like to share this beautiful experience i had to the hyatt regency of casablanca. As soon as you come in, you're send into a place of delight and pleasure. All the staff is waiting to help you !! and it's only the beginning...

column3: Good hotel in very good location
column4: It is located near the old city of Casablanca, many shopping and restaurant nearby too. The traffic is heavy but you can walk to the sea and old city easily. The room is nice and the staff is nice and helpful.

Great hotel. Great location. Great service. Food was delicious. Sunday brunch is a must. The business lounge was a great addition. Rooms were nice and clean. Felt comfortable as a woman to walk across the street for coffee or to shop. We'll be back!

A clean and modern hotel within walking distance of major attractions. The food is good but expensive. Drinks are expensive as well. Better to walk to restaurants close by. Rick's cafe is a 15 minute walk away and much cheaper, better food selection and atmosphere. Conference facilities and support was good.

column3: Short but relaxing over night stay
column4: I have stayed at this hotel before and is one of my favorites in Casablanca. The service is fantastic, room service swift and prompt, and very friendly and helpful staff in the reception. I asked for late check out because of meetings during the day, and first I was granted check out first at 16:00, but in the end at 18:00 - without any extra charge:-) It was not the most busy period for the hotel, but this kind of service I appreciate a lot and makes business travel easier and more relaxing.

Good Points: - Excellent Staff. - Excellent hospitality. - Excellent Cleanliness. - Excellent Food. - Excellent Free Wifi. - Excellent value for money. Bad Points: Nothing. This is a real role-model hotel.

Everything at the Hyatt is 5 stars including the service. The breakfast is good and the location is perfect. The lobby bar is perfect for business meetings. The interior design is luxurious and sobre.

Very comfortable well located hotel. Just near the old medina and across the Riad from main thoroughfares. as the spa was closed during our visit, the concierge organised another luxury hammam for us. While the breakfasts were beautiful, sometimes finding a table was a little bit if a challenge. Rooms with a view of the mosque are great at sunset, however do be prepared to hear the call for prayer early on the morning

Used Hyatt Regency to stay for a five days business trip in Casablanca. Loved the location, due to proximity to tram and train station and the city square kind of place just in front of the hotel. Front office / reception staffs were real warm and friendly. Food options were limited, including the breakfast. The gym and spa were under refurbishing, the makeshift facilities were not in line of the stars. Hotel airport service, and food as well, is bit costly vs the good places in the city.

everything at the hyatt is made to allow to focus on your purpose in the city, may it be business or pleasure. the staff is highly trained and genuinely concerned about your well-being. the famous moroccan hospitality! Everybody will bend over backwards to help: the cook will accomodate your requirement, the concierge will thrive in finding all solutions to make your stay better. highly recommended hotel

Me and a work colleague stayed here in May and had a great experience. It was well located right next to the city's souk and within walking distance of the Mosque. Although slightly dated, the hotel maintained a real sense of charm and atmosphere - with a constantly busy lobby full of interesting people. Food was OK but there's a good few places to eat within walking distance.

Fantastic hotel with helpful, friendly, professional staff. Very well located in central Casablanca. The room was great as well. I even had a great view of the Hassan II mosque from my very nice room.

I had the time to spend two days in Casablanca so I choose Hyatt regency but unfortunately I did not enjoy it too much because too small swimming pool in addition to very few varieties in breakfast which did not cover all persons needs moreover a terrible location beside the old market and too much money asking by rude way but I enjoyed the friendly staff, room decorations and nice greetings and thanks

Wanted somewhere to have lunch and was not disappointed. Ambiance was excellent, service First Class, helpful and not obtrusive. Ordered the Lamb Tagine. Delicious. Went down well with a superior glass if wine. Wi-Fi is extra fast and a clear bonus. Try the Morrocan mint tea. Very refreshing.

This hotel is located very centrally and closed to the medina. It is very to access bearing in mind the very heavy traffic in Casablanca. The rooms are large and so are the bathrooms. Some rooms would need to be redecorated and are noisy if you are on wrong side. The best thing there is the staff: they are very friendly and very efficient. The restaurant is also good but pricey. Breakfast is very good with a standard selection of pastries, bread and grilled stuff.

This is a good hotel for business. Friendly and professional staff. Great breakfasts and beds. Clean rooms. Conference was well managed and efficiently run. Room service is very good, great food delivered on a roller tray that turns into a table Negatives: had a 1st floor room with no view, except for the roof of the conference venue. Room cleaning needs to be better

Staff is the secret in this hotel. Smiles... professionals...Business attitude.... Customer Service orinted....Always part of the solution,if you face a problem which is no where in the hotel... From the bellman to the director .... they serve with elegance.... I stayed around a month .... TOTAL ENJOY Mrs Fatiha ,Mrs.Samira, Zahra,Eman,Houda,Khalid, all house keeping staff, everyone and of course Mr.Mouron (hope spelling is right) Thank you

I stayed there on a long business trips after trying 2 other hotels I CAN ATTITUDE is the title of everyone working there from the sales manager , finance manager , reciption , house keeping all gives you such feeling of personal care I went to a lot of hotels around the world but in Hyatt Regency Casablanca , it is another level

I prefer Hyatt regency to anyone who is willing to stay in Casablanca. I adore the service, the place, staff, and the location of the hotel. Everything was well arranged and organized, the staff was very helpful and trying to solve your problems if any regardless the problem is related to the hotel or not, they offer to help even outside the hotel. At last I can say I fall in love with this place.

column3: Bizz hotel in the middle of the city
column4: Big rooms with comfortable bed and enough space to work in. good ammenities in the bathroom. A bit old and needed a deeper cleaning in the common areas. Good restaurant and bar A bit expensive for what it offers however there is not so much competiotion in this segment in CSB.

You are always welcomed as if you were a VIP. Very often they upgrade you without you had to ask The rooms are great so are the bathrooms I like the bar with the sofas to conduct interviews or business talks They never forget you from one trip to the other. Definitely the perfect place for a business trip to Casablanca

we stayed here on our last night in morocco, before catching our flight the next day back to new York. what I expected good service, food, service, and very impressive security. pool area was nice. yes a bit pricey relative to what you pay while traveling around the country but was a nice way to transition to return. overall a pleasant stay.

column3: Great stay, but a little bit expensive
column4: Stayed twice here and every time was great. It is well located, clean and comfortable. Wifi works well, and the service is excellent. The room price is expensive, but in Casablanca it is better to pay some extra and to get a comfortable stay, especially when you are away from home :) The breakfast is OK, but I think it is overpriced (around 30 Euro), not included in the room rate.

The hyatt regency was one of the best hotels that I used. The level of decor is outstanding. The restaurants it offers are of very high level especially one particular one in the bottom level that offer shows as well 😉

I stayed at the Hyatt Regency recently on my first trip to Casablanca. The hotel is very comfortable, and the service was excellent. There is a very good Moroccan restaurant in the hotel. There is lots to do nearby - a big shopping area and lots of cafes. One side of the hotel offers a beautiful view of the Hussain II mosque - I really recommend asking for one of these rooms. It was stunning.

over all a great hotel. I stayed 58 days there and had no big issues. A lot of activity near the hotel--shopping, restaurants, etc the layout of the rooms are strange. The toilet is stand alone and well away from the living and shower, with no place to wash your hands near.

column3: An oasis in a desert of chaos
column4: Spent a 2 night stay here on a business trip last month and the hotel was everything you would expect from a Hyatt. Opulent surroundings & fittings, excellent friendly service and lovely bedrooms and bathrooms with plenty of space and comfort. The photos I have included are from my room on the top floor of the hotel, a nice distance from the chaos below but there was still some limited room noise. Breakfast was not included in my rate so paid extra for this, surroundings nice in an Arabian style with as you would expect plenty of choice and a chef on hand for omelettes etc. We ate in the hotel one night and the food was excellent. My only criticism was the check in process which seemed to take an eternity to complete for no obvious reason!

I stayed here on a business trip for 3 weeks. The location of the hotel is quite central with a lot of dining options nearby. The service of the hotel is quite average with pretty long times for check-out/check-in. At the time of my visit, there was some renovation going in and the gym was very basic (make shift arrangement). Breakfast range also very limited. The hotel did have a business lounge, which was quite helpful and great place to hang out in the evening. If I travel again to Casablanca, I will do more research before I stay here again.

Located near the old city the Hayatt is a very clean, modern hotel, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the food in the French restaurant and the Moroccan wine are of high standard and quality, the rooms are clean and spacious, shower rooms are huge with walking in shower and a bath tab. Free wifi, check in and check out extremely fast. Although the hotel is in the middle of a very busy square there is no noise what so ever. Highly recommended for business or pleasure in Casablanca.

Little late in review. Stayed here 15th Aug to 20th Aug. Very satisfied. Location is great. Very central and tram station is just across the road. Banks and cafes so near. We loved to sit in those cafes for hours sipping Moroccan Tea and watching the crowd pass by. McDonald and KFC just opposite the hotel as well other eateries. Room was good spacious and window opened to the front road side. Comfortable bed and good toiletries in bathroom. One odd thing is the WC is separate from bathroom. Just close to room entrance. Bathroom has cubicle as well the tub. Breakfast is awesome. Fresh orange juice and cut fruits. Omelette of choice. Moroccan bread with usual loafs and cakes. Best to end with Moroccan tea which I found the best in Morocco. We had dinner in the Moroccan restaurant…

Centrally located and rates amongst the better hotels in Casablanca, however, I found it inhospitable, the food was decent and hotel was clean but the staff could do with more customer care skills. The club at the hotel is a complete rip off. Charged me 25 dollars for one drink and I was harassed by dodgy ladies of the night.

column3: Still the best hotel in Casa !!!
column4: Perfect Hotel . And Yes as a hyatt , you could consider it as a little bit old, but the extreme kindness of the entire personnel makes everything more than good !!! A great restaurant and a fantastic location. People always ready to help you and very well managed. I'm a frequent visitor of Casablanca, and I assure that the Hyatt is probavely still the best hotel in Casa, considering all the aspects.

column3: Very nice but rooms and gym need refurbishment
column4: Old looking but located right next to the old quarters. Nice staff particularly the concierge. Breakfast was a bit confusing as they always wanted us to go somewhere else. Rooms had great view and insulated from outside noise. Sound proofing between rooms was not so great. The carpets in the rooms needed replacement. Food was ok but there are such amazing options in the city that you should venture out.

Old but nice room and conftable bed, good location in the centre of the city, stayed only one night. Did not explore all the facility, reception staff very courteous and helpful. I was told the security staff are rude!! Did not come across such behaviours

Hotel in general is very good as any Hyatt Regency would be expected to be. Rooms are wide enough, clean, and well furnished. Surrounding area is terrifying! I did not feel safe at all. Anyway, this is not the hotel problem. Staff are ok. However, like all many others in these type of cities, everybody seems extra kind aiming extra tips.

The hotel is probably the best in Casablanca. Great staff, great service. Breakfast was very good and staff was caring during the whole stay. Rooms were comfortable and very clean. View from the room was nice...overall, it was a very satisfying family trip!

To whom it may concern, We recently visited the Hyatt Hotel Casablanca, and we wanted to share our praise for the staff at the hotel. My husband and I arrived on the evening of August 17,2015 for a 2 night stay to celebrate our anniversary.
