Royal Air Maroc informed me at the airport that my luggage did not arrive, and I was worried that this would spoil what was supposed to be a special night. We were greeted at the front desk by your wonderful personal relations manager Fatima. She not only checked us in smoothly, but after hearing it was our anniversary, she graciously offered us a room on a higher floor with a view. She helped us make special plans by arranging a table for us at Le Relais de Paris, an amazing restaurant on La Corniche. Fatima also helped me do my hair…

Located in the pure center you cannot find a better place. The room are sizeable but a little outdated. The bar is a good place for business meetings. The restaurant is expensive when you have so much choice in the city.

column3: Lovely Stay at this Perfectly Located Hotel
column4: Recently completed a 3 night stay at this Hyatt property in the center of the city, location was unbeatable, and the staff and service were extremely gracious. The room, as requested, had a view of the Hassan II Mosque and the sea, was was spectacular and I was offered an early check in. Oddly, there was no storage or drawers anywhere in the otherwise lovely room...which made no sense, since there was plenty of space, just poorly designed. Tiny closet, with tiny shelves, no dealers anywhere...very strange. Very nice amenities, nicely replenished, plenty of extra bottled water. I made use of the Club level privileges which were definitely worth the extra price at this hotel, they offered a very nice breakfast, beautiful canapés and snacks at cocktail time with a nice…

I'm a Hyatt member and definitely don't recommend Hyatt Casablanca. The staff are ok but the hotel is really old and definitely need to be renovate. The rooms are not clean either. However they have a good restaurant at least.

column3: A beautiful Hotel if you just want to relax.
column4: The Hyatt Regency Casablanca is a beautiful Hotel with beautiful rooms. The rooms however, depending on which level you are on my not have a nice view (as ours didn't - overlooking the top of the lobby as we were on level 2). The food is reasonable, the staff are in general pleasant, but NOT extremely warm with the greeting. However they tend to be somewhat more friendly / warm if you are either French or of Middle Eastern background. I myself am Egyptian (now living in Sydney) however my girlfriend is Maltese (but looks english due to the colour of her skin etc). This is not to say that there are a handful of very nice and pleasant staff that do take the time to make you feel welcome and greet you with a smile - Mohammad being one of these unique and friendly people who…

This is a nice, comfortable and conveniently located hotel that my fiancé and I enjoyed staying at for two nights in early August 2015. The hotel is right across the street from the medina of Casablanca and a short taxi to the famous Hassan II mosque as well as to Rick's Cafe. While the food may be a little pricey, it is good as are their drinks. If you are passing through Casablanca at the start or end of your Moroccan adventure, this hotel would be a good place to stay for a night or two.

Stayed for two nights whilst on business, I spend roughly 200 nights a year in hotels and have become pretty tolerant in regard to expectations. Having experienced Moroccan hospitality many times I was saddened to be at the receiving end of discrimination, being a white British man who travels length and breadth of the globe one expects occasional discomfort in my being there, I was surprised by many of the staff in the hotel whom may not directly verbally express it but by the way of their actions it is obtuse - small things observed such as bottled water to native guests on arrival at the pool - I wasn't met with the same courtesy. Having to stand at the bar to get served as ignored at the table, to again return to get a further drink. Small things get noticed. The room…

column3: One of the best hotels ever
column4: My friend and I stayed in this hotel as soon as we walked in the staff made us feel home they were super nice we went to a lady I forgot her name she checked us in she was really nice to us we had an issue with our booking she didn't say anything to us made sure that we are comfortable she went to the front desk manager for assistance and he came out he was such an amazing person he made sure that we get upgraded which he did and he was talking to us telling us about places and what should we do then we went to our room which they upgraded us and the room was by the far the best room ice staied in very clean and very nice later on we went down to ask few questions about the city meet a lady her name was Zahra and the other one I don't know her name but I used to call her lulu…

The staff at this hotel were extremely helpful and with all smiles, the front desk took the initiative to help us make reservations for dinner around Casa. I especially would like to thank Fatma from the front desk for all the help she has done and it would be definitely a place I would stay again as it met the standards that I was looking for. Thanks for the amazing one night stay and se you soon!

I had some free nights and points so I used them at this hotel. It was unexpectedly good. I had a nice room facing the old medina. The wi-fi, A/C, bathroom, towels, bed and pillows, phone, and free water were great. A Nespresso machine was provided. The restaurant, bar, mini-bar are outrageously over-priced. A cafe is $5 (50 dirhams). When will these hotels realize that overcharging x 5 simply annoys guests-no matter how much money they have. Oh well. The concierges were quite helpful. I found restaurants and a taxi driver for a tour of the city. This is a story in itself. First, the price for the tour was 200 dirhams an hour; at the last minute it became 250/hr because "the driver speaks good English." The driver's English sucked and I was taken to a "spice shop" at which a man…

Hyatt Regency Casablanca is located on a very central location in the city. Especially for the short business trips quite convenient. Hotels are comfortable and clean. The restaurants are fantastic. The Moroccon foods at the hotels were perfect. Staff is helpful and well trained. It was a nice stay experience during a business trip.

Had the greatest time at this hotel.if you are looking for luxury and great staff this is the one for you. Had a little unlucky incident but the way it was treated by the managers and the director was greaaaat,professionally handled as expected from a five star and more.you do feel appreciated as a guest and that they want you to feel home and come back,so how can i think of another hotel. Everyone from the littlest employee to the biggest was asking during the stay how i was.i couldn't be but happy and the departure was a bit hard for me as i felt that i was leaving a family. My little boy was treated like a little prince ,even the littelest detail like cooling down his tea and bringing it to the table was heart warming. Can't wait to go back.

As a chain it met expectations nicely. The room was a good size and comfy. The staff were very helpful especially with arrangements connected to the conference. It is in a great location for exploring parts of the city.

Hotel exceeded my expectations.Very helpful mgmt staff after a long journey getting myself acquainted with what the hotel had to offer.The room was up to Hyatt standards with all the required bells and whistles. There beds are the most comfortable beds that I have slept on. Great outdoor pool area to relax and have a dip after a long walk around Casablanca. Enjoyed a lovely meal in the restaurant. Lobby area can get smoky with cigarette smoke depending on how many people are in the lounge, as this was during Ramadan and this was the buffet meal in the evening it was quite packed so understandable why the smoke level was high. Really nice touch is management staff checks in with you on a daily basis to see how things are without being obtrusive. Overall enjoyed my time here and…

The Hyatt in Casablanca has a top notch staff - front desk, Regency Club, pool, all around. I was there on business during Ramadan and can tell you that this hotel works hard to make you feel comfortable. The Executive Suites are large and the Regency Club here is definitely worth the upgrade during Ramadan as most food establishments are closed during the day.

I was on 2 weeks trip to Casablanca for work and was really confused between Hyatt and other 5 star hotels...Hyatt being oldest and most established won! Upon checking in, the Manager (Houda) personally greeted and welcomed and the reception staff were also very welcoming, i requested for the mosque and port view but was given the city view, it was alright too, i could do some 'people watching' The room was spacious and clean, had everything necessary, washrooms were separated into toilet and bathrooms, toilet was reallyyyy small in size though Room service staff were courteous and polite and kept assorted moroccan sweets each day :D Since i was staying over 10 days, i received call from management twice jst to checkup on everything and if i was comfortable Gym although was…

column3: Unforgettable stay at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca
column4: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for one night before going to Marrakech. Saida (Team Leader Front Office) helped us with the check-in process and immediately upgraded our room to one in the 10th floor with an amazing view of the Mosque and the sea! She also made some excellent suggestions for our trip to Marrakech that we followed and enjoyed very much! In the evening we were looking for typical Moroccan food and she suggested the hotel's Moroccan restaurant. Not only the food was delicious but also the way every dish was presented contributed to a very enjoyable dinner! The location of the hotel is great (walking distance to many attractions), all the employees are very friendly and professional, the rooms are very comfortables and clean, and the internet service is…

column3: One of the best in North Africa
column4: Life is about persectives. Putting them in place properly. Withthat being said, this is one of the best in this part of the world. Don't arrive expecting a US standard becasue no such thing exists here. BUT..darn close. The hotel is across the street from arguably is one of the best souk experinces in the world. The staff are as friendly as can be in every way. The lobby is beautiful as well as the rooms. We were in a suite 802 on the Club floor. True, the rooms are showing signs of wear but nothing extraordinary. The pool is beautiful and the bar staff very attentive. We boked a car to/from the hotel and airport which in our opi ion at about $60 each way is money well spent. I would gladly come back here if need be.

The Casablanca Hyatt Regency provided superb accommodation and comfort. I originally stayed there for a conference but following travel around Morocco returned for a personal stay. The rooms, service and food were outstanding. On my own I prefer to avoid hotels as large as the CHR but thoroughly enjoyed staying at this expansive hotel.

column3: Fabulous - I wished I had stayed longer
column4: I had one perfect night in this hotel. I have not a single problem to report. Faultless in every way. I did not eat breakfast so best not comment on that. Immaculate, quiet and luxe. My room on tenth floor had wonderful city views.

I attended a conference there. The hotel offers all necessary facilities. Rooms are good but the quality has its price. Drinks are a bit pricy. Overall, the hotel is certainly one of the best places in Casablanca.

Home away from home is the only way I could describe my stay. It was a great stay at Hyatt and what makes it great is the staff who will do every effort just to make you feel at home. I have no more worries in choosing a place next time I visit Casa.

column3: great hotel - check in to improve
column4: Had a great experience there. Rooms are at hyatt standards and staff is very friendly. Only minus was the long and complicated check in (they make mistake in points + cash and it took time they recognized their mistake). The bar is nice too with a friendly staff. Would not recommend room service, it comes cold... Best choice for casa anyway.

The staff are the most important feature of a hotel for me. The team in the Grand Hyatt are excellent, welcoming caring and responsive. It is not easy to wrok in hospitality especially during theholy month of Ramadan but they went about their daily tasks witha smile on their faces and really made our trip more memarable .

column3: Good Location and Service, Needs an update
column4: Location: The location is real good. Just meteres away from the tram station and walking distance from the train station. ALso a very nice 20 min walk to the famous "Ricks Cafe". Other sites are a short cab ride away. Cabs are available any time just outside Rooms: Clean and Spacious rooms with tub and other stuff. Good air conditioning and housekeeping. Ask for a city view room, its a ncie view in the evening to look over the bustling square just across with people Service: was the quick and prompt, When I asked for timings for the train they delivered a printed copy to my room. :) Food:The spread for breakfast was average and tends to get boring when you eat the same thing every day. No day to day change in the menu Other services: Wifi connection was good with speed.…

column3: A wonderfuil place to stay - my absolute favourite in North Africa
column4: The Hyatt Regency truly gives me the feeling of coming home everytime I get there. Very friendly personnel, good service, nice rooms, a great French restaurant next to the lobby (Cafe M) and good breakfast buffet. Very nice design. One thing I did not like this time - the muezzin from the nearby mosque waking me up before 5am and I could not sleep in anymore afterwards. But this is not the hotels fault of course.

Overall a pleasant stay: good internet connectivity, responsive room service, friendly staff and two complimentary bottles of water each day. Generally what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel, except the following things to improve: 1. I booked a room with a double bed / king size bed more than a month in advance, but on arrival was given a room with 2 single beds. When I asked about this, they said they don't have rooms with double beds available. Next day, the same reason was given, until I made further complaint and was moved to a double bed room. 2. Airport transport from the hotel to the airport was by a driver who did not drive safely at all. He was speeding excessively, driving very close to cars in front and making dangerous moves around other cars. I have…

amazing pool area for a drink and to unwind from the hectic hot day, great dinner at cafe m although it is a bit pricey, good service overall and our room had an amazing view of the Mosque Alcoholic drinks are pricey though!

I guess I expected more, but I also expect a workout facility and pool. All this was under renovation. All in all, it was a comfortable room and the service was fine, but do not think you are getting a luxury hotel.

I stayed here for a conference. The rooms are nice and the accommodations for the conference very good as well. My room had an absolutely stunning view of the Hassan II Mosque. Overall quite nice, but certainly not the style of hotel I'd choose on my own.

column3: Best place to stay in Casablanca
column4: Other than central location, the Hyatt is a place you can feel at home and taken good care of. The staff are attentive and caring and make the difference in making this hotel the best place to stay in Casablanca.

Where to begin. Great location,delicious food,beautiful maroccan restauran, excellent cocktails in the bar... Rooms are spacious,with huge comfortable beds. The hotel staff takes great care of you and makes everything that you want possible. All in all,it is all you need and more. It should be your only choice is Casablanca!!

Good stuff..helpful..info was correct. Use TA for my stay /trip to Morocco. As always, it was very useful. Info was correct. Selected my hotels based on the info provided. The recommendation of Hyatt, eateries like La Scala, Cafe Jose ..was very useful. i recommend use of TA everytime

Cannot say anything bad about the hotel at all as the staff and good were all good. But it is a big western style hotel which could have been located in New York, San Francisco or Chicago for that matter. Our room was HUGE, but very expensive especially considering the exchange rate. Food was solid, but again there was no WOW factor. The property is a little dated here and there, but the bed was comfortable, food good and again the staff was always helpful.

Nice Hotel, Clean with friendly stuff. But some smell in my bathroom coming from the shower area. At level 11 there was a always background noise, probably caused by general air conditioning or similar.

I had a lay over in Cassablanca and am so thankful that I selected the Hyatt I continue to be amazed at the high quality customer service I received in Morocco and especially at the exceptional service at this Hyatt Regency -- their American counterparts would benefit from studying this level of service In particular I want to point out their unique customer service -- I call it show NOT tell. In many American hotels you are given an answer to your questions BUT at this Hyatt not only did staff tell me they also showed me. This consistently happened with all staff members I encountered. This is sophisticated training at its best Let me give you some examples. I was quickly greeted at check in by a very articulate and poised representative,Zahra. By far one of…

We arrived in Morocco via Casablanca and my SO picked Hyatt as our first accommodation during our 11-day holiday. Hyatt Regency is a good place to stay after a 24-hour long travel time from the Philippines. The check-in process was smooth and hassle free. The staff who handled our check in was very warm and friendly, and very professional, too. Our room has an amazing view of the city, with Mosque Hassan II towering over the horizon. Hyatt is very accessible, a petite taxi fare shouldn't cost you more that 25MAD. Everything was perfect I couldn't ask for a better introduction to Moroccan hospitality!

I have stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip. The exterior of the hotel is old. The personnel was very kind, the check-in process was fast. The lobby is quite dark, furnished with heavy wood and dark colors. The room was spacious and well furnished. One thing strange to me is that the toilet seat is a an separate room than the bathroom and the bathroom door is see-through. The breakfast is served in Moroccan restaurant. The setting is nice, with high ceiling. There is a decent variety of food, including some local dished (like the Moroccan pancakes). In the corporate rate Wi-Fi and breakfast were included, therefore i cannot comment on the cost. The location of the hotel is great. I would definitely stay here again, if ?I am back to Casablanca

My wife and I spent one night in a huge suite at this business hotel. The rooms had wonderful views of the city, the mosque and the sea. They were very quiet and comfortable, with a nice bathroom - separate tub and shower, a separate guest restroom, and excellent WiFi. The service was very good and professional. The bar was very attractive, with excellent service. There is a nice garden area with a small pool. The breakfast was excellent.

I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca about two weeks ago and everything was perfect ! The staff were very caring and attentive and the food was delicious. It is ideally located next to the Old Medina and a short distance from the Hassan II Mosque which is beautiful. Great service overall!

I was booked at Hyatt Regency Casablanca for almost 2 weeks on a business trip. Had no idea what I was going to find but have to say I was no less than impressed. From the moment you step into the lobby to the second you walk out, this Hotel exudes a sense of warm yet professional aplomb which is so difficult to balance. This pervades throughout your stay whether you're in the exquisitely warm, contemporary yet unmistakably traditional breakfast area, any of the nothing short of marvellous restaurants or simply relaxing in your room. You somehow feel this place was specifically designed by someone who knows you inside out, includes all you want (as well that which you did not even know you wanted) and totally eradicated whatever you even slightly don't want to interfere with…

Staff are very welcoming and supportive, reception team was super, special thanks to Zahra, Imane, Fatama, they were very cooperated. also Falah, and Mostafa from banquet team they're amazing. meeting rooms are very huge. location is good.

column3: Good hotel in th center of Casablanca
column4: The hotel is in a quite good location, just in the middle between the shopping district and the old medina. It is possible to reach the sea in around 20 minutes walk and the big mosque as well. The rooms are modern and with good furniture, even if the light system is not so functional and one can select only two sets of combination. Also the bathroom is good, but in my case the toilet was not working properly and losing water. The restaurant and pool are really nice, as the bar. All the people have been very kind and attentive. The only issue was the lack of hairdryer in the room. Last day I called and after 45 minutes of waiting time I got two cups of coffee instead.... then finally the issue was solved. So in general a very good hotel especially for a business trip to…

column3: survey of stay in the Hyatt Casa
column4: this is very plesent hotel that many of my friends had talk about and what staying it sure proves the quality and the smiling faces of the staff of Hyatt Casa, TQ Hyatt for the hospitality that u had given during stay here and TQ for the personnal note sign by the GM on welcomiing back .

Who designs see through bathroom doors? I simply could not fathom why one would design such a thing. Perhaps it was designed by someone's brother in law? If one person in the room wants to get up early and shower, the other is obliged to do so as well, as the door is see though and lights up the entire room. My husband gets up earlier than I and I just couldn't get that extra 45 minutes of snoozing time. I've not seen such a ridiculous arrangement before. Otherwise the rooms are fine. They are clean and comfortable. The public areas could use a face lift, but they are clean. The breakfast was adequate, but nothing special. The location is good. Unfortunately the bathroom and the inconvenience it posed put a pall on the stay.

column3: Great location with beautiful public spaces
column4: The hotel is in a fantastic location - adjacent to the old medina / shopping area and across the street from public transportation. T is also walking distance to ocean and Hassan Mosque. The common areas were relaxing and beautiful including fresh flowers. I had the breakfast buffet each of the five morning of my visit. The choices were ample and included many types of delicious fruit. I had 3 dinners which were all good - lounge, the Moroccan restaurant and the French restaurant. Only disappointment - water temperature in the shower changed from hot to cold to hot etc several times. The pool was wonderful.

column3: Exactly what you would expect at a Hyatt
column4: Our stay at the Hyatt was the starting point of our Morocco holiday. Casablanca is the best connected international airport in Morocco so most travellers start here; however, apart from the name which evokes romantic notions, the city does not have much to write about. The hotel though is great. It is extremely well-located, has great views of the main square in the city and is close to a lot of the sights. The rooms are clean, well-appointed and have more than adequate space. Service levels are generally high and the breakfast was definitely the best we had in Morocco.

The people who work here, make it great. So very nice a friendly. Great restaurants and lounge's in the lobby. The lobby is beautiful. The Regency club is one of the best I have ever experienced. Staff is polite and really cares about the hotel and guests experience. My room was brilliant, overlooking the plaza in front of the hotel.

column3: I am in love with this hotel!
column4: The staff are AMAZING! and after that, the lobby and restaurants are beautiful, the rooms are gorgeous and clean, and the views are amazing. I usually stay at much cheaper places in Casa, but my partner wanted to splurge. I am VERY happy that we did! Be sure to ask for a room facing the place des nations unies.

We were just staying in Hyatt Regency for two nights at the beginning of our Moroccan holiday. I had little expectation of the hotel but it turned out to be just fine. The souk was close by and the huge square was a great introduction to everyday life in Casablanca. Room was perfectly adequate but the highlight of the stay was the amazing breakfast. The chef and his helper were ready to make some wonderful specialities and every food item we tried was of top quality. Staff were helpful; we didn't swim... SO cold! The fitness Centre and the Hamman were closed for renovations but we spent time exploring the medina (right close by) and taking a tram which is just opposite the hotel. A lovely way to travel.

45 minutes from the airport but worth it! Beautiful hotel, and very comfortable. Large luxury bedroom with excellent facilities and lovely luxury bathroom. Bed and pillows soft and very restful. Free wifi. Great choice!

The staff at this location where totally amazing. The service was pleasant and prompt. Also the front counter staff greeted me by name each time I entered the lobby.The accommodation was spotless and all issues were attended to promptly. There was no waiting when a request was made. For example I needed a power convertor. I called downstairs to the operator and a knock came to my door in less than 6 minutes.

We stayed at HR Casablanca for only one night. The check in / out was very fast. The room is as expected nice for the money. The breakfast is ample and high quality. Nothing to complain about. The Medina is right across the street, making this location very desirable as you can easily wonder through the medina without too much fuss with taxi cabs. We did not try the hotel restaurant but will assume that the HR standards are maintained. This is a hotel i feel familiar and the only hotel i stayed in Morocco that has a fully functionable great shower, and a hair dryer which i don't need to press down a button, also with long enough chord to dry my hair comfortably. How wonderful to have these little conveniences.

column3: A short but very memorable stay - oozes quality!
column4: Regularly doing business in neighbouring Algeria, I came to Morocco for the first time not really knowing what to expect. I stayed in Casablanca at the Hyatt for one night, but despite my fleeting stay, left thinking this was a top, top establishment. A good location by all accounts, but what really stood out for me, and made this hotel deserving of 5 stars, was the service. From the moment I stepped out of the taxi people were at my beck and call and numerous people welcomed me to the hotel in an amicable manner. This is a great feeling to experience. Then, upon checking in and other enquiries, there are no issues that can't be overcome, as the receptionists fluent in 3 languages. They try and cater everything to your personal preferences and nothing is more important than your…

column3: Second time to be there for business and it was great exprience
column4: The place is well secured, meets my demanding business atmosphere with the right choices of restaurants and good atmosphere lobby. rooms are nice and clean with helpful smiling staff. this is my second stay and the last one was more than a year ago... I love the place and its supportive staff.

An extremely good location matched by efficient and friendly service. When I arrived minus baggage lost en route by Air France, the hotel was most helpful in contacting the airport and in providing essentials etc. Lovely rooms, well appointed.

Very attentative service! Used business centre and coffee shop/bar! Staff coudn't do enough to help me!! The lunch was as expected 5*! One of the very few places you get boeuf tartare and the chef knew definitively what he was doing!! No wonder it was a 3 hour lunch!!! Will be back soon, before we leave!!

column3: Ask for room with spectacular view of the Mosque~!
column4: This hotel is very accomodating, has FAST Wi-Fi and work area in each room. If you can't get a room over looking the sea side and the Mosque ask for room over looking downtown and local train service. Great breakfast, good walking location to major attractions, and well appointed rooms. Comfortable beds and large luxury bath rooms with full amenities.

Inside hotel not a single issue to complain about. Being dropped off at the main entrance was not possible due to "security reasons" - I just don't think the car I came in was fancy enough... Food in restaurant was especially great!

Highclass hotel were you will be met by securityguards welcoming you. The reception was very classy with fantastic employees. Stayed in a suit, recommendet! Fantastic quality rooms and you get the best service you can imagine when ordering roomservice. A+++++

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights for vacation. Room was comfortable, hotel was centrally located. The hotel had multiple restaurant options and all were good. We really enjoyed the French and Moroccan restaurants. My only complaint is the inconsistent service. The concierge was non-existent. We tried talking to the front desk but did not get any helpful recommendations. Additionally, the service at the 6pm Bar was sub par. When we were there it was never crowded and the server/bartenders were just standing around talking. You had to work hard to get someone's attention for service. Overall, I would probably return to this hotel in Casablanca.

column3: Perfect hotel for Business and Family
column4: It was a business trip for me and i found the hotel suitable with my all needs. Very comfortable and luxurious rooms with almost all facilities required in todays world with free internet and decent food options. The hotel is located near to shopping center and have lot of food options and is well connected with almost all local transport options.

column3: Excellent hotel and good quality of service
column4: Excellent hotel and good quality of service nice location , clean rooms ,very professional staff (smilling , helpful, kind caring extremely exemplary. i deeply recommend this hotel as one of the most nice hotel i have visited

The Hyatt Regency in Casablanca is a great hotel, Wonderful location. Close to attraction. Also close to shopping. If you can, book the regency club. They have a delightful breakfast in the morning and cocktails in the afternoon. The service is excellent. My friends stay in a stander room. It was very nice as well. .

The room door was broken The tv in the room was not working The bathrooms are literelly see through. If you are staying in the room with business partner or parents it is impossible to take shower !! They don't have dinner buffet.It's a la carte. We were with a group so they put us in the night club are to have breakfast. Not plesant to have breakfast in a dark room with underground music. The only nice thing with this hotel is the lobby area and the clean bed sheets.

I think it is the best hotel in Morocco with very convenient location, great services & entities, welcoming staff and secure enviroment. For business purposes, very practical with the nice lobby and other dining available

I stayed two nights for a conference. Location is excellent as close to the market, the mosque, and transportation. Room was large with a nice view. Loud at night on weekends as it is close to a major square. Bed is excellent, bath is excellent with excellent amenities. Ate breakfast and lunch there, and food was far below what I expected. Concierge was not very helpful despite asking many times.... The ladies at the front desk where more informative

The Hyatt was our final night of a two-week tour of Morocco. I would have liked to stay longer: the room was attractive, the bathroom great, and the bed, the best of the trip. The lobby, bar, and restaurant are stunning. It is a bit wierd, however, to eat breakfast (lovely spread) in a dark, turreted room that feels like a Moroccan stage set. Staff was very pleasant and efficient.

Very good location...in the heart of the city, between the old madina and the new central. Good choices of resturants, very nice lobby, and very comfortable bedrooms. I totally recommend it if you want to see Casablanca.

We stayed at the Hyatt for the first night of our Moroccan tour. Before check-in, we may have THOUGHT we would have preferred a local riad to a "global hospitality company," but turns out.... we would've been wrong. The impersonal, international setting we feared never materialized. Instead we enjoyed Moroccan ambiance and found comfortable beds; a lavish breakfast buffet; and a super location. What more can a traveler hope for?

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca for New Years Eve. Guests must walk through metal detectors to enter the hotel, which is a bit alarming. The staff was excellent, our room was comfortable and clean and room service was fantastic. The hotel is across the street from the Medina (which by the way is not exciting - nothing compared to the Marrakech or Fes medinas.) I would recommend the Hyatt Regency Casablanca if you want comfort, safety and service.

Lovely lobby in this downtown hotel. The general area around the hotel is not good but much of Casablanca is probably the same except for select residential areas. It is close to markets and local activity. The check in was easy and our room was ready when we arrived. Our room included breakfast and snacks in the upstairs lounge area. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The Moroccan restaurant on the first floor was excellent.

column3: one of the best places ot stay in Casablanca
column4: We stayed in the hotel the first and last night's of a two week tour of Morocco. At first we were interested in more local hotels instead of an international brand. However, we were pleased to find out that the Hyatt is one of the best hotels in Casablanca and it well deserves this recognition. The hotel is centrally located, very well appointed and kept in top shape. The rooms were nice sizes and had great attention to detail. We stayed on the club level which included a breakfast and evening snacks and a full range of beverages which was enough for a supper after a long day of touring. We enjoyed breakfast in the first floor restaurant which had a wider variety and was very good. The décor was also Moroccan in nature and very well done.

This was my second time visiting Casablanca and staying at this hotel! I must say that it was truly another wonderful experience. The hospitality is 'SIMPLY AMAZING." I dined at the Moroccan restaurant which was a wonderful experience and the breakfast at the hotel leaves one in awe. Great staff and everyone tries to go above and beyond to for your every needs!!

great location, very safe and confortable, I was there for a congress in the same hotel so very convenient and all services for business people. suggested to all business travellers in Casablanca. Close to Old Medinah, just walking distance.

I have been here for work in january for the first time. 30 min far from the airport, he hotel is very well located: right in the middle of the city in from of the Medina and the modern part of the city with its main street. The hotel is not just an hotel, it has two reastaurants inside, a bar, a pool, a gym, free wifi. For the room nothing to say: they are big and with all confort you need, both shower and bath as you like. Breakfast is good as well as you can have warm and cold, maybe a bit pricy (around 26 euro). Recommended!!!

column3: Don't judge a book but it's cover
column4: On arrival in Casblanca, I looked at the Hyatt... Slightly faded white walls made it look run down, I was more than happy to be staying somewhere else. We ended our Moroccan experience with a second visit to Casblanca and decided for a change of hotels. The Hyatt was lovely, a beautiful elegant lobby, great breakfast, free wifi, and most of all brilliant service that made me feel welcomed and at home as well as looked after. The only complaint that I can make is that the hotel shower doors are see through, staying with my granny made for quite the awkward situation. The location is perfect, a few metres from the medina, even closer to the tram and all round very central. The vibe was great and the staff as well as taxi drivers were very accommodating and helpful to my granny…

We have spent a few days in this hotel. As we were on business and holiday purposes in Casablanca, we had a wonderfull time. The hotel is in the heart of Casablanca and the staff is as perfect as also the interior is persuading me a 100% to make my next stay in Casablanca in the Haytt Regency.

column3: Lives up to the Hyatt Reputation
column4: The service was top notch from the moment I got off the tram and crossed into the Hyatt sphere. The staff at the door took my luggage and showed me to reception. Checking in was no problem and I was shown my room. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom/shower room was a good size. The only oddity was the toilette which was separate from the bathroom and whose door didn't close properly. As a regular customer, I got free wifi, complimentary wine and breakfast in the club room.

If you want to visit the city in style, this is the hotel to book. Right in the centre of Casablanca, you may walk from the Hyatt towards the modern part of the city or in the opposite direction & style, the Medina. The insides of the hotel are impressive, and the restaurants are recommendable though pricey. Rooms are of fair sizes, and the view from the top floors are excellent (ask for the ones with a view towards the Medina).

fantastic, great , probably one of the best Hyatt hotels I have stayed in and I have been in a lot of them spanning all continents including that in Auckland, New Zealand. Staff excellent and indeed very professional. Location quite ideal, down smack in the middle of busy city. Needless to say, enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Casablanca Will go back there for pleasure and business

column3: More a souk than a hotel
column4: Yes, it is a five star hotel but you'd think you were in grand central station in the rush hour. If you are looking for "action" in Casa, this is the place for you. I prefer quieter more organized places where you can tell what is what and have some personalized service.

This is a very good business hotel in Casablanca. It is situated fairly well in the city and everyone knows where it is located. The room was great, comfortable and spacious. The restaurants serve very good and flavorful food. I must say however that it is the professionalism and the quality of the staff. I was a bit surprised to get some of the best service I have ever had in my travels at this hotel. I will certainly stay there over and over again.

column3: Good business hotel with a touch of charm
column4: Well located the Hyatt is an inviting hotel in Casablanca. Rooms are up to the international standard and the atmosphere of the lobby boast some sort of an old charm. It is strange that smoking is permitted at such an international place. The Regency club must be recommended at the 8th floor for its business facilities and very kind and attentive service. Surely, a place where you feel good on a business trip.

column3: OK hotel - with a few hiccups
column4: The most impressive part of the Hyatt Regency Casablanca is the lobby. But that’s about it. The rooms are OK, but are let down by a few odd touches. Most notably, the toilet is in a separate room, with a ‘sewage-type’ opening on the floor. This meant that I came across a few insects, which was very disturbing. And parts of the hotel are starting to fall apart, quite literally (eg electricy sockets, etc…). Staff are generally good, although a few would benefit from more training re customer service. One final point about Casablanca – if you’re thinking of visiting the city as a tourist, don’t. There really isn’t anything to do or see here.

column3: Excellent Service, Great Location, Perfect for Business
column4: This hotel should be your first choice if visiting Casablanca on business. Located centrally to the old town and waterfront. Having stayed in Hyatt hotels all over the world, the service at the Casablanca Hyatt really stood as being incredibly good, in a different league to all other Hyatts and on par with what you'd expect from the Taj group (especially the 8th floor business lounge manager). The room was excellent, good bed, good facilities, quiet and a great view over the sea and Medina. The food in the Moroccon restaurent on the ground floor is fabulous and one of the best restaurents in town. It was a shame that the spa is under construction, but this was made up for in other ways. I would definetley stay again.

I stayed with a group for 3 nights in November 2014. This is an awesome hotel. Everything about this hotel, the location, the rooms, the staff, the food, is good. However, one thing frustrated me quite a bit and I don't understand it at all. The toilet was separate from the bathroom and without a place to wash hands. Why? What is the logic behind this? Additionally, the plumbing in the shower, which was otherwise very spacious, needed to be repaired. Every time I took a shower, I was ankle deep in dirty water. These are the only two faults I found, that push me to give 4 stars.

Check in and welcome: Valet parking was offered; Parking for free; Most probably one of the most professional check ins, we have ever experienced; the senior receptionist (a lady) was really very friendly, explained everything in detail, gave us an room upgrade and took care of everything. Room: The hallways towards the room and the room doors look a bit old and shabby; Clean room, especially compaired to the Moroccan standard; perfect view towards the Great Mosque; Nice mattresses, pillows and sheets; Free wifi. Bar: Great, cozy ambience; Try the Casablance beer! Pool area: Not very inviting; Should be improved; No service (drinks) etc. was offered. Check out: Fast and professional, the car was not brought to the entrance - we had to walk to the parking space.

Spent the weekend at the Casablanca Hyatt. The hotel is centrally located with many restaurants that are rated highly in Trip Advisor nearby. The rooms are nice as is the rest of the hotel. The lobby is the showstopper and is filled throughout the evening. It has a lot going for it but it is not a five star hotel. There is something missing that makes you want a little more. However, the price is incredibly reasonable and I would rate it highly.

column3: Feeling welcome at a great loaction.
column4: Very friendly service. Calm and nice rooms, where you can feel well. Good location to visit the city.The breakfirst is a must with big variety. The french restaurant is not as good as expected. Certain parts of a meal are prepared in advanced, which you can taste: for example a piece of bread should be cristby. But all in all a very nice hotel with value for money.

Services, food, bar, restaurant are at 5 star level, but the rooms leave much to be desired. I found the carpet to be dirty (did not want to walk around barefoot) and the aircon puts out a moldy type of air. Time for the Hyatt to reinvest in a face lift of the rooms. The room are not worth the price paid.

had a great experience because the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. the food was also very good although i only had the breakfast and one dinner at cafe m. room was comfortable and spacious but it the rooms and hotel in general needs refurbishment.

As expected from other Hyatts, also the Hyatt Casablanca offers very friendly and helpful staff: Rooms and facilities area at excellent conditions. Quality in Restaurants is high, again - friendly and competent staff. Centrally located, it gives you the chance to reach some interesting locations which are close by - easily by foot.

My stay in this hotel was amazing. The service, the staff and the restaurant are excellent. I would advise anybody visiting Casablanca to go there or at least have a drink @ 6pm bar, a very trendy afterwork bar where you can have the best cocktails of the city

The hotel is a nice hotel, somewhat dark in the lobby but comfortable. The rooms are spacious and comfy. The staff was helpful. My only complaint is a feeling of not being safe. There are guards and roadblocks leading to the entrance.

Wow, is an understatement when describing this hotel and their staff!! At check out the guest relations manager (Fatima-Zahra El Gherby) made me feel like I was a queen! I felt like I was checking in again and not out!! What a wonderful experience and I will be back!!! A million thank you's for an amazing time!! OH, the breakfast is SIMPLY AMAZING!!!!

The only thing the service at the swimmingpool is very bad.there are a lot partys by the swimmingpool you can not use the swimmingpool than there are no sunbeds,and you can not order drinks or food it cost me more than an hour to order a drink i ask it 4 times the say i come.And the help you not whit the bagage.

Arrived after the longest day of flying in my lifetime. I was upgraded to the top floor, executive suite. The room was fantastic, by far the best hotel room I have been in. The staff was very kind and went out of their way to assist with any questions I had. If I was back in Casablanca I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Having spent the best part of 15 weeks in Casablanca over the past 9 months, we have just moved from the Sheraton to the Hyatt. Wow - you can not compare the two hotels. The staff are friendly, the rooms are modern and very relaxing (for a hotel room), the set up of the hotel is excellent and as a diamond member the lounge and service is exceptional. Moving to the Hyatt The managers of the Diamond club on the 8th floor Rada and Abderahim are both fantastic and make the stay most enjoyable. As hotels go within Morocco this is excellent. It has made a huge difference to trips to Morocco.

Everything as expected at a 5 star hotel Pool was really nice, able to swim laps, (about 20 meters) room great, internet worked,. Was at a conference, and food was delicious. Id stay here again happily.

column3: Still the best business hotel in Casablanca
column4: This is not my first review of this hotel - I stay here often, but not always, when I travel to Casablanca. My choice is often defined by what conferences I am attending... in this instance it was for my own team so I could influence the choice and we chose the Hyatt. In terms of accommodating a larger booking, it was managed by our admin team but the feedback I received was positive. What I wanted to really write about was the professional and personal service I continue to receive. On arrival, I was greeted warmly by the assistant manager and was escorted to my spacious junior suite. I am sure I am not the most frequent guest at this hotel, yet I always feel like I am getting special treatment - and this is the trick all hotels need to master, really putting the marketing…

Hotel needs little renovation but all the services was excellent.. Hotel is in city center , easy for connection and hotel has all instruments to access for businessman. In any case , I will prefer to stay for my next trip too

Beds comfortable. Next to medina (although there wasn't much there). Nice hotel with many more plugs than some of the other hotels I stayed at in Morocco. Good air conditioning and the lobby is beautiful. Pool isn’t heated. Very sleek and more typical of European/American hotels.

column3: Immaculate, wonderful service and very safe
column4: My husband and I spent a few nights at the Hyatt while he recuperated from an illness before boarding our flight home. What a good decision - the hotel is located right in the heart of the city but yet you pass thru gates to enter and the security is very tight. It is a world unto itself. As soon as you drive in, it is a whole different world - an oasis. A wonderful oasis !! The pool was a welcome relief - the water so sparkling. We enjoyed dining poolside. We received impeccable service and the food was very, very good. I even splurged and enjoyed a medium rare hamburger. There is an ATM right in the lobby and plenty to do at the hotel so one never has to leave. We tried going to the Medina right across the street one afternoon, but quickly returned to the hotel. …

I have been staying at this hotel on and off for the past ten years and it never disappoints. Booking by email is a little tricky, you never get the same person twice but it always works out in the end. Pick up from the airport was timely, the vehicle clean and comfortable. The staff are all impossibly kind and friendly, eager to be helpful. The lobby lounge is my favorite spot for a drink, a meal or just to hang out. The other restaurants are just as good and attentive. Both standard rooms and suites are large and comfortable, room service and housekeeping are immediate. The location of the hotel is perfect just across from the entry to the medina.

column3: Stay at Hyatt Regency in Casablanca
column4: I stayed there recently for a week on a business trip. It is not the first time as I have stayed there many times before. However, upon arrival this time, I was greeted like a Celebrity and was given an upgrade to an excutive suite as I was told this was my tenth stay at the hotel. This was very good and I really did not expect such a nice and professional treatment. I think the only aspect this hotel is lacking is a nice Gym and spa which both are under renovation and I hope they do a good job.

column3: A very high quality business hotel
column4: The Hyatt Regency is located in the centre of Casablanca, within walking distance of some of the main Government offices. It is furnished in the typical Hyatt, slightly old-fashioned, style, with lots of dark wood, but that is a style with which I am quite happy. I arrived to find my travel agent had failed to make the reservation, but they were able to find me a room, with an excellent view over a busy square. The room was a good size, well-equipped and comfortable. WiFi was free, and the connection was made quickly, though the line speed could be slow at times. The breakfast buffet had a good range of food, with a few imaginative choices. I also ate in the lobby bar, but the food here was less interesting, and the service was very slow. That, however, is my only black…

Located Place des Nations Unies, right next to the old Medinah, the hotel can be reached by cab in 40 to 70 minutes, based on the state of chaotic traffic. The hotel is luxurious with nice lobby, a good-looking and comfortable bar. The outdoor pool is large and open throughout the day, but does not open early enough to take a swim before going to work. Rooms are large comfortable, but it is difficult to get a non-smoking room even when asking at booking time. As a result, togther with noiy and sometimes old air conditioning uits, rooms can have a bad smell. Beds are comfortable, bathroom is very nice, and the desk and chairs are designed for business work. Service is very nice and very kind like often in Casablanca, but could be more professional. For example, evening turn-down…

I recently stayed in Casablanca, Morocco on business at the Hyatt Regency. The hotel was the best thing about the entire trip!. Morocco is NO Place for a woman alone. Ridiculously expensive in general . Hotel was great though .

I really enjoyed my stay this hotel. It was my first time in Casablanca, and I was there for a conference. This hotel felt very safe, clean, and very friendly, and had an exotic flair that I wasn't expecting from a Hyatt. When staff didn't know the answer to something they always found out and solved the problem; overall, great hospitality. They even wrote a lovely note that they left in my room when the door locks stopped working, which was a nice touch! The pool is beautiful and I very much enjoyed swimming in the mornings before the meeting. The rooms were spacious and nice, great bathroom, with consistent internet. There were movies on the room TV, in English, which was nice for a night, albeit they were censored quite a bit (to be expected, I guess). I loved the Moroccan…

The public spaces in this hotel were beautiful. They reflected the character of the country. The rooms were very comfortable, but they had the bland look that hotels seem to favor these days. We appreciate the convenience of the split bath--wish all hotels had that! Our room looked out on the medina and the minaret, which we liked. We liked the availability of bottled water, which you need for this trip, without being nickled and dimed for it. One problem for us was that we were on a different time zone and there was not anyplace in the hotel where we could eat before the late start of dinner. They advertised tapas, and a bar with food, but there was none. The hotel is in a good location, across the streets from the souks, and in the heart of everything. What made this…

column3: Aging hotel in the old center of Casa with good service
column4: Hotel is well located, on the older center of Casablanca, used to be luxury, today little a bit aging, it's visible especially in the rooms & lavatory, depending on your room, might be pretty noisy (big square just in front, full of people and trams....) Service is OK, attentive. Brekfast is OK, there is evething which needs to be, even if you would expect more for the price.... I would say that it has lost luxury, so not worth its price.......

The rooms are quite large, and our room had a good view of the mosque and the ocean. The bed was hard but comfortable. I did not like the fact that the bathroom is a little room as you come in the door, and there is a separate tub and shower in another room with no toilet. It is close to shopping and restaurants. It seems quite modern and well appointed.

I stayed at the hotel for three days and was very disappointed with staff services. No one greeted me with a hello, no helped me with my bags nor helped me as I left the hotel. This is not Hyatt hotel standards. I will not return.

column3: The service you'd expect for the price
column4: For a western traveler in a North African city, the Hyatt Regency Casablanca provides the kind of experience you would hope for. It is centrally located on United Nations Place, near the Old Medina and lots of shops. A shuttle to and from the airport is available through the hotel, and it worked well on the leg I took it, although it was nearly twice as much as a cab. Rooms are spacious and clean (although mine did not get made up one of the eight days I was there). The one hotel restaurant I ate in, Cafe M, had very good food that was almost, but not quite, European. The price wasn't bad except for the fact that the appetizer that showed up unrequested did get charged. Attending a conference in the hotel, I had several breakfasts and lunches that the hotel catered, and all…

column3: Great location and service except at check-out
column4: Pros/Likes: - Fast early check-in with room ready in 20 minutes after arriving early in the afternoon - Great big room with a nice bed and fantastic view of the old medina and the Hassan II Mosque, upgraded as per my Platinum status - Got complimentary welcome plates of three peaches and three macaroons...super nice touch - Two bottles of water daily (although unclear as to whether this is for all guests) - Excellent location next to the southern side of the old medina, in front of the tram station, which goes all the way to the Corniche/beach - Minibar has some space to put your own beverages - Room has one universal electrical outlet adapter - Big bathroom with both shower and bathtub, though read about toilet below - In-room safe deposit box, coffee, robes, and sandals - Free…

column3: Peacefull home in the hearth of city
column4: I visited Casablanca for business purposes. The meeting rooms, restaurants, breakfast were excellent. The staff was very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for your business and leisure layovers. The only issue that took my attention was the lifts did not blink when it arrives the floors.

I highly recommend the Hyatt in Casablanca. I'm here for a conference and the service is outstanding at all levels. Everyone I have encountered is eager to help make our stay wonderful. Most of the staff speaks fluent English as well. My room is more spacious than I expected - on the scale of a room at a Hyatt or equivalent in the US. It is stylish, comfortable and very modern. The concierge today was completely amazing. He helped me find a spa nearby for a pedicure and even called and interpreted all my questions until we found the right service and made a reservation for me. My colleague needed some help getting a poster printed and the concierge was able to edit two pdf files using Photoshop software to finalize the poster and then organized someone to have it printed nearby…

We stayed in Hyatt Regency for two days during Ramadan 2014. it was very nice experience, Staff were very professional and friendly, big nice, comfortable rooms with good house keeping. the hotel is well located to city center .

I was pleasantly surprised with my stay here. The reception was friendly and efficient and the staff was very helpful and extremely courteous. Nice, large lobby, well decorated giving a comfortable North African feel. The room was clean and large with a nice, firm bed. Bathrooms large and clean. The breakfast was plentiful and the staff most accommodating, a real pleasure. I stay in a lot of hotels and I would say this staff did make an impression upon me. Naïf I was good, no dropped signal. This is a very nice hotel situated in central Casablanca. Highly recommended.

I stayed for for a quick business trip and was very impressed. This was my first trip to Morocco and was sorry I couldn't stay longer. Rooms were large and clean. Mattress was really comfortable, which is not something you always find in hotels. I would definitely return.

column3: Old style classic in need of updating
column4: Stayed in this hotel for business for 6 nights. The rooms and lobby area are ok, but what is unacceptable is the noise from outside one can hear inside. It was impossible to sleep or work in the room at some times of the day. In general the hotel is refurbished but in many aspects only superficially. We used 2 of the meeting rooms, both without windows. The pool/terasse area was closed most of the day altough the weather was nice enough to sit outside.

One word, fabulous, brilliant rooms, fabulous service, lavish restaurants and bars and one must do on your stay is the Hammam and spa. the services and treatments are in sync with the local specialties! for the adventurous ones there is a room service arrangement as well The hotel is well located central from downtown districts and most importantly the gorgeous golf courses highly recommended

This is a standard business Hyatt hotel but one that really delivers on all counts. From the free and ample guarded parking, to the huge rooms with beautiful views of the city, to the excellent location in the center of it all and close to the city's best restaurants, to the kind, friendly service from the staff - they really do everything right to justify the high room prices. WiFi is included in the room rate but breakfast was some exorbitant price that we decided to skip. Otherwise, the hotel is aging but kept in absolutely immaculate condition. As a "Western" refuge from the rest of colorful Morocco, it is a very worthy stop and conveniently located to practically everything.

column3: My Experience at the Hyatt in Casablanca, Morocco
column4: The Hyatt was just outstanding in every phase of my visit. From the moment I arrived at the Hyatt and welcomed at the front entrance to check-in, to my wonderful room, great view, helpful staff who really help my visit to the city and could not have been more helpful, knowledgeable and just could not do enough to "make my days".

I been in several hotel in Casablanca, but this is the best. The most cleanest hotel and most hospitable hotel in Casablanca. If comparing with some other Hyatts I been, I have to say that this one is top 3 Hyatts regency. Personal is extremely hospitable, food is excellent and cleanliness is on very very high level. Hotel interior is really beautiful it is mix of 60's, 21century and arabic influence with very fine felling of styles synergy. Really wort to stay there.

My wife and I arrived late at night and received a very friendly welcome. We were upgraded to a suite but were wary of a report of rooms smelling of cigarette smoke. Unfortunately our room did have a smell but we are in 'North Africa'. We were given another suite immediately which was perfect. It was almost midnight and yet we were able to order sandwiches and drinks. On the way to breakfast the following morning I asked the concierge if it would possible to arrange an air conditioned car with an English speaking driver to show us around Casablanca. When we left breakfast a driver and car were waiting. We were taken around many of the sights including the Mosque Hassan II - the guided tour was excellent - by the driver ' Fettah ' who was fantastic, getting us to places which we…

Quite a nice hotel with friendly staff- nice pool & gym Breakfast & food was average The night club & disc at venue was nice The hotel is centrally located - with local shopping sookhs - close by. The trams station is present right in front of the hotel - a city tour can be taken on that. The beach area has good clubs is about 20 mts drive on taxi from the hotel Do not carry lots of money in the pockets - or your passports - there are lots of pick pokets around:)

column3: What you expect of a Hyatt
column4: Overall very good and what you expect from a Hyatt. I was there for five days for a conference and at times some of the staff seem clueless but there were plenty of others there to show them the way. The location was great in the heart of town and right next to the bazaar and if I were to travel to Casablanca again I would stay at the Hyatt.

Hyatt Regency is a well positioned oasis that takes you away from the hustle and bustle of Casablanca. Good rooms, nice lobby, with bars and nightclub. Great swimming pool, just a little deep. Pool side bar is good too. Staff very helpful. Food was a little bland however, and they had minimal stock of things like beers. After a couple they would run out and offer you an alternative. Nothing major however and overall a very nice hotel.

Overall I was disappointed with the Hyatt Casablanca. First, the positives - there are some really nice staff at the hotel from concierge to front desk to the executive lounge. They were helpful in doing things like getting medicine from the pharmacy, moving rooms, and helping in the lounge. Now, the downside. Overall the hotel is quite uncomfortable. If you are a non-smoker, this hotel is not for you. There is smoke everywhere including in the rooms that are non-smoking (it filters in through the vents and under the door). Second, the beds are extremely uncomfortable and I am not usually a troubled sleeper. The worst part was there was someone that had rented out the entire top floor for the month and was up partying every night with his guests until the wee hours of the…

Just had a one day stop over in Casablanca. service form the staff in the hotel was excellent, although the rooms are a little dated, the service from the concierge and other staff was excellent. Has a decent gym

Only spent one night in this hotel. It is very modern and well kept in a good location across the street from the old city. We had a view over the old city with the Hassan II Mosque in the distance. Our room was very crowded but comfortable with a well appointed bathroom. The breakfast was fine but the available seating is very limited and the overflow was forced to sit in the lobby.

column3: Great Location, excellent for business travel.
column4: Stayed twice in this hotel. The location is superb if you are into discover the city. It is on the edge of Al Madina Al Qadima (the old city), which is a maze of souks and bazaars where you can bargain your way into buying some of the best moroccan souvenirs for the fraction of the price you'd find anywhere else. The souk is just across the street! The staff was friendly, they spoke english (not all of them), breakfast venue was a bit tiny and I could do with a bit more international variety. But overall, my stay was very satisfactory. Also, across the square where the hotel is, there is a small and very traditional moroccan restaurant. The food there is to die for!!! Sadly, i can't recall the name, but it is very famous and concierge should be able to help you.

column3: I got to see Tom Hanks here!
column4: This is a nice hotel. The rooms were comfortable, staff were very friendly and the food pretty good. The highlight of my trip was that Tom Hanks was filming a movie at the hotel and I got to see him in action over 2 days!

Typically difficult to get to in the Casablanca traffic, you'll be pleased when you arrive. Service is great and the hotel itself from the Lobby to the rooms are of good quality. It's the only hotel I will stay in when I travel (regularly) to Casablanca for business. The best example I can give of the quality of services is when they had run out of Casablanca beer at the end of Eid. Typically things run slower the week after Ramadan as many people (including suppliers) take time out. I casually mentioned this to the assistant manager who was walking by "how can your run out of your cities namesake beverage", she enquired my name, explained the situation (suppliers on holiday) and apologized. I thought nothing of it until I received an email from the General Manager…

It is my third stay at Hyatt regency casablanca and everytime i check in, i receive an excellent welcome and help, the staff are so friendly and helpful and you can not but be good friends with them, they continuously ask about the guests' satisfaction they always address you with a smile. I certainly will not stay in any other other when i visit Morocco.

I was fortunate enough to experience this hotel twice during my trip. The management was excellent and the service was friendly and efficient. It was the best hotel we stayed at in Morocco. I would recommend it unconditionally.

A very professional outfit with decent sized rooms and bathrooms. Service was great and staff friendly and attentive and always willing to help. The location is central enough to most businesses within the CBD, making for an ideal business hotel. Unrelated to the hotel are the mini taxis that wait outside the hotel - if they are not metered, then agree a price upfront or you will get ripped off. Even better, refuse to use a non-metered mini taxi..

I had an amazing experience at the hotel. Excellent staff and service. I stayed at the hotel twice in 2 weeks and had consistent good experience. The staff were very helpful as it was my first time in Casablanca and had answers to all my questions.

The 5* Hyatt Regency is centrally located in Casablanca near the old souk. The hotel itself is of high standards and appeals to International travelers. The late night room service menu is quite large. The rooms are spacious as well designed.

Excellent facility located in a very convenient part of the city. Service is impeccable, security is absolute, food is very good, and we will stay there again the next time we visit Casablanca. The regency club is small, so would recommend using the regular restaurant.

clean hotel, nice location , very limited facilities there`s no heated swimming pool the steam room was broken when i tried to use it as a muslim i didn`t like to find A pork meat on the same tray besides the halal food

I stayed there for 3 nights on a business trip. The hotel was clean and the staff were very processional and friendly. Free WIFI internet all around the hotel was great and the breakfast buffet was good as well. My room was a corner on the 5th floor, room 501, make sure not to take it or any other room in similar location, it is near the service door and you always hear smashing and doors closing and people talking. Rooms facing the main street are a bit noisy so try and get a higher room if possible.

We stayed one night at this hotel during a business trip to Casablanca. The Hotel is very conveniently located in the center of Casablanca. The rooms are updated, big and very clean. The lobby and the restaurants are elegant and the breakfast was great. There is a nice pool with a pool bar in the back of the Hotel. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We for sure will stay at this Hotel again.

Beautiful elegant hotel, nicely decorated room, spacious and clear room. Food is superb. All conferences rooms are very well equipped and elegantly decorated. Lobby area is very welcoming and friendly. Outside walking is beautiful to wAtch.

We stayed six nights on a business trip. The rooms were large and very airy, and spotlessly clean. Service in the bar was very good, but at breakfast a bit hit and miss. It was difficult to get our tea served before we had finished eating. The Moroccan restaurant downstairs was rather fun, with its evening entertainment. The first belly dancer had no belly and didn't seem to dance much, but as there were only a few guests maybe she found it uninspiring. It must be difficult to dance when your audience is so small. The second, on the other hand, was great to watch, and the food was excellent. One time to beware of: after around 11:00 pm there were lots of unaccompanied very skimpily dressed "ladies" in the Moroccan restaurant, so as a woman I was glad to leave at that point. On…

The Hyatt Regency Casablanca is a good quality business hotel. Service is always impeccable with the staff being friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good (apart from the dodgy toaster!) and the on-site Moroccan restaurant is very good in the evenings. I go monthly and find the on-site French restaurant to be a bit hit and miss. This isn't a problem to me as we now just avoid it. Rooms are comfortable if a little bit dated but nothing to worry about. If you're lucky enough to get an upgrade, the suites are lovely. Overall a really good hotel.

Excellent on all point of view. Quiet , clean, nice, very pleasant place to stay for business or vacation. I recommend it strongly. Dinner are very good in all restaurant and people very pleased to serve and answer questions. No real issues for this place.

column3: Great location, pool nice, breakfast buffet great
column4: We enjoyed our stay. The rooms are fairly large and quiet, despite being located on a busy street. There is wifi in the rooms - although it does randomly disconnect so you need to re- sign in. Bathrooms are large with a big shower with good water pressure. The tile floors can get slippery and there are no grab bars in the shower, so be careful. Toiletries are plentiful and smell nice. The beds are super comfortable. The breakfast buffet has lots of variety. It is about $30, although there are some expensive items such as smoked salmon and fresh strawberries - and great chocolate muffins. Also, a mix of breakfast and lunch items. Very good. The gym has a number of cardio machines and weights and the pool is big, with nice lounge chairs in the area. A drawback: people smoking…

One of the older chain hotels in Casablanca. Excellent property. Comfortable bedrooms. Outstanding service. One bad feature...all parts of the hotel are smoker-friendly. Yes, you can smoke anywhere in the hotel including the lobby, bar, restaurants...everywhere. Wouldn't bring my kids here. I'd give the hotel 5 stars if it wasn't for this policy. I smoke too but hate sitting in a place full of smoke. Though they control it reasonably well through ventilation and air freshners on the walls every 3 metres.

column3: Seems like the place to be seen in Casablanca
column4: When I checked in, I was really skeptical, as the front desk staff were not very friendly. I arrived late, and when I got to my room, I was desperate to brush my teeth and go to bed. I wanted to use bottled water to brush my teeth, but put my mini bar was locked. When I called downstairs, they said it was locked because they did not have a credit card on file. This was not true, as I had just checked in and given them my corporate Amex card. They send someone up to open the door, but this took him about 20 minutes. Eventually, I was able to brush my teeth and go to bed. The rest of my stay was much better, and I enjoyed the meals in the hotel restaurant. This hotel seems to be THE place to be seen in Casablanca, as Tom Hanks and John Kerry were both there during my stay.

column3: Club Services and Fitness Center Lacking
column4: If you stay on the club level and plan to visit the club room in the evening, make sure you arrive early. The first night food and beverage was replenished; however, on the second night nothing was replenished. For those of us arriving midway through the evening there was little left. The fitness center is way in the back of the hotel. There is some exercise equipment, lockers and spa related facilities, but the quality is severely lacking. It's not an inviting place to visit. I stayed on the side facing the tram and found my room to be noisy. Friends staying on the side facing the mosque said their room was quiet.

If i can sum it to few lines, then i will say that the service in Hyatt Casablanca is extremely friendly, especially in the Business Club and SPA. The breakfast in the club was great, the team is helping you in any task i had, such as business meeting room in the club, beverages, coffee tea and snacks, business services etc.

In general the hotel is fine, little pricy outlet. The staff are helpful but below the five stars standards. The issue is about hotel Spa which really need complete renovation in all aspect. The location is very fine for people walk in for business purposes.

Second year running staying at this hotel, nice clean hotel in good location to the medina and port.We stayed in the suites which are at the top end of the accommodation, so all facilities are going to be excellent. As it was a working trip i did not have the luxury to use as a normal holiday hotel, but that said we made use of the swimming pool,gym and various restaurants in the hotel with our clients. I found there were enough front of house english speaking members of staff at the hotel, and were very willing to help and assist me in any way they could at anytime of day or night. Would book here for myself if going for a personal trip.

Although there are a few more alternatives such as Sofitel and Sheraton, Hyatt is the better choice in Casablanca. It is located next to Old Medina and in a rather poor section of the city. I have to say it is quite expensive and VERY expensive in Moroccan standards. However, if you will be in Casablanca for business get a Club Level room if you can afford it. It comes with free wireless Internet (good speed) and use of the lounge. Lounge cocktail hours are quite limited (6-8 pm) and not much food, but it is not too bad for breakfast except there is no hot food.Service in general is quite attentive and rooms are fair size, however the plumbing is rather noisy.Overall not a bad place to stay in Casablanca.

column3: Excellent Location, but not perfect 5 stars service
column4: I stayed in Hyatt Regency Casablanca for three nights. The location of the hotel is very good. It's actually the most strategic place for a hotel in Casablanca. The location will provide you with access to Tramway, the Old City, Hassan the 2nd Mosque and basically everything is close to you. On the other hand comes the quality of service. In my point of view this hotel doesn't really worth 5 stars because in my case the room services didn't clean the room everyday, and we didn't have enough bottles of waters sometimes because obviously they didn't come except twice out of four days. The food they provided for breakfast wasn't 5 stars service. Once I had piece of rotten strawberry, and sometimes when a certain type of foods runs out, they are slow to refill it, so you end up…

column3: Excellent; ideal location for business & pleasure
column4: Great base for business and ideal for free time activities ie Medina and a short walk to Ricks, Atlantic Coast, Corniche etc. Easy access to other areas via the tram. Friendly and efficient service. Good selection of restaurants and great value & quality.

column3: The Best Five Star Hotel In Africa
column4: I recommend this hotel highly. It was one of the best experiences of my life. You will not be disappointed with the management, staff and quality of rooms provided. I travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels around the world. When it comes to the best, you have found it. I felt I found an African gem of a hotel. Plenty to do also as there are shops and shopping within walking distance of the hotel. If security is an issue for you the hotel is well guarded by top notch security professionals. The rooms are excellent (don't forget a nice hot bubble bath), clean and have most everything you need. Even if you forgot something the front desk staff does no use the word no. They will find a way to get if for you. Room service and dinning in the hotel lobby are also very…

column3: Good for a couple of days
column4: very well stayed at the center. Very good welcome at reception. Bathroom towels are gray and not smell good. Rich fitness center but not working properly spa and sauna. Rich breakfast and very good night bar.

column3: Best hotel in Hotel in Casablanca for business trip
column4: I had a great experience in this hotel. Bedrooms really nice. Staff available at any time Nice Fitness center The next time i will find time to have a massage Moreover this hotel is well placed in Casablanca If i travel with my wife and childrens, i could let them in this hotel during the day. they will be able to visit Casablanca, and for sure the staff will help them

Once again , im glad to be back to the hyatt casablanca , i had enjoyed the dinner at the lobby bar the staff was amazing everybody smile and work professionaly .. i had also enjoyed the delicious cocktails that Amine made specialy for me and my friend 3 hours talking about averything , the bartender was very nice and professional with us Feth the manager was nice too he was so helpfull . I promised em to be back again but next time it will be with familly . I can't wait next april to be there again

Very clean hotel with a friendly staff and easy access to the local market and shops. The location was close to the beach and to Rick's Cafe. I wish the taxi could get closer to the hotel so that guests would not have to get wet in the rain.

column3: This place is why I love Hyatt
