column4: My husband, 3 year old, and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt Casablanca in January 2014. Our stay was flawless. The hotel has a touch of Morocco overlaying the traditional Hyatt style, but if you are looking for a more authentic or exotic feel, this might not be the hotel for you. If you want high end, dependable quality, though, I can't recommend this hotel enough. We were upgraded to a suite immediately upon checking in, and it was lovely. There was an extra bed (twin) put in the spacious living room area for my daughter, and she loved it. The helpful desk team presented her with a flower each time we stopped at the desk, and a waiter gave her a small teddy bear at breakfast. Though we stayed in Casablanca only 1 night, our daughter begged to return to the…

I don't normally stay at super high-end chain resorts but stayed at the Hyatt Casablanca on the recommendation of a CIA agent (long story) after I got mugged in Marrakech (in feb. 2008) and needed to get a new passport at the US Citizens Services building. Apparently it's the safest place to stay, and after being mugged at knifepoint, safe sounded great to me. But anyway! The food here was delicious, the staff was really helpful with arranging for cabs to take me to get my new passport, and even had one of their doormen walk with me to a trusted photography studio to get a new passport picture taken. They were SO helpful and understanding about my situation, which was much appreciated. The rooms were super nice and comfortable, and the decor throughout the hotel was really…

The staff and service are beyond belief, truly wonderful. Amenities and comfort are top class, which you would expect for the price. The view from windows is average, but you can't get good view in Casablanca. Staff is amazing, very responsive and very nice. It's right next to the big market, make sure to visit it. Don't forget to bargain hard!

column3: One of the best among excellent Hyatt hotels
column4: Excellent service. Staff very friendly and very reposnsive and accomodating. Consierge is very responsive and helpful. Breakfast is excellent, they have real honey at the breakfast, thats a real treat.

Our first hotel on a tour of Morocco. We arrived very late for night one and had a nice sized room with a view of the city street. No problem with noise. Nice sized bathroom. Breakfast was great with beautiful public rooms for eating and using the free WIFI. No complaints except it was an expensive night ($400+ per night) to add on to our tour. Not the hotel's fault. After reading some previous reviews I was apprehensive about beginning our tour in this hotel. It was a wonderful stay with good food for breakfast and comfortable, clean bed.

We had a nice stay at this hotel. The staff was helpful and the service excellent. The food in the hotel restaurant lobby was good. The bed very comfortable and the room spacious. We truly enjoy the buffet breakfast. It offers quite a selection of food, local produces of good quality.

After 2 weeks of traveling this beautiful country in back packing conditions, this hotel was the TLC I needed! Fantastic location and beautiful hotel. The service was outstanding! I would stay here again and recommend it highly.

Good conference support, good food service, expensive bar service, good location of shopping at Median and Souk. Nightclub is "dead", with no draught beers, Good variety at breakfast buffet. Quiet, comfortable rooms.

The staff here really stands out as excellent. Especially Kareema in the spa/gym. Breakfast is nice although it is a bit disorganized if you come right at 6:30 and it seems tough to get coffee. Close to the Medina and great inexpensive sidewalk Cafe's and restaurants. Will definitely stay again!!

Hyatt hotel in Casa is the best in town. It is very close to the Medina and is only few minutes away from the Corniche and the key shopping areas. It also offers a wonderful service and top quality food.

Decor a little oldie (dark and dimmed light everywhere), loads of security, fitness is far far away from rooms, you'd better use a bike to get there... Excellent food at room service + nice people on the phone when you call them

I have stayed at this hotel at least ten times, mainly because there are not really many options for a good hotel in Casablanca. The stay I have just taken will be my last. Firstly it is way overpriced for what it is. Yes the location is good and the rooms quite comfortable but the hotel is starting to get very tatty i.e. stains on many chairs in the lounge area, chipped furniture, old fashioned bathrooms..... absolutely miserable security staff....slow service....and worst of all the low slug chairs everywhere in reception, breakfast room and the Moroccan restaurant,,,,these have not changed in years and they are very uncomfortable INDEED. The breakfast is a total rip off and not that great. My colleague and I ordered lunch in the reception area...two risottos...what did…

The overall quality of service is good but could be improved with creating dedicated smoking areas. it is important that the waiters have some level of functional English. The waiters must be commended for the effort they took to try and solve a problem even though this resulted in wasted time

column3: Atrocious, expensive and to be avoided
column4: It started by the hotel informing me on arrival at 10.00 pm that my room had been cancelled and so could they drive me to another hotel!! After a 12 hour journey and total confidence that I had paid for the room I was not going to be moved that easily. I was there as part of a business delegation staying for 3 nights. Somehow with the help of the organisers of the conference - not the hotel who had given up on finding me a room - I was finally given a room two hours after arriving. I suspect that they gave away the discounted rooms to guests who booked in at the full tariff - an outrageous thing to do. Anyway my stay continued without incident however the hotel let the conference organisers badly down with cancelled conference room bookings, damaged equipment etc. Clearly the…

column3: Good hotel let down by house staff theft.
column4: Very good hotel and typical of Hyatt quality of service. The Der Beida Moroccan restaurant was fantastic with authentic Moroccan food and live entertainment. This was let down by a case of food poisoning of a signature dish from the Der Beida restaurant menu. Further, early in the morning before checking out, I had my electric shaver stolen from the bathroom of my room. I did not report immediately as I was a little late for my flight. I reported these two incidences via the Hyatt feedback form and have not yet received a reply. All hotel staff should be searched by hotel security to ensure hotel guests are not stolen from. I am waiting for the hotel to reply. So, be especially vigilant to secure any valuables and I mean anything of value from thieving house staff.

column3: Beautiful Hotel in the middle of Casablanca
column4: Beautiful Hotel in the middle of Casablanca. Excellent interior of the hotel. Nice restaurants and bars in the hotel. People are friendly and helpful. The hotel is a bit expensive, but it is worth. Only negative part are the taxi drivers in front of the hotel , who try to cheat you. Hotel said 250dhs for a ride to the airport while the guys try to charge you double price.

As far as hotels are concerned (not Riad's) this was by far our best experience for business conferencing. The staff was friendly and extermely helpful and understanding! A first in Morrocco! Kamal Bouhrim who was in charge of our group was very profesionnal and attentive to our needs. Conferencing amenities were of good quality and technicians handy, the food was superb and generous and catered for any dietary requierements. The room I had was quite big and nice albeit no view to speak of. I had the biggest macaron as welcome sweet awaiting me. Bathroom "goodies" were of good quality. The hotel is of course superbly located, a couple of teps away from the medina for your shopping and just accross the street from the tram station. Though pricey, I would definitely recommend…

If you want to stay in a clean, luxurious hotel with fabulous service, stay at the Hyatt Regency. There are 4 places to eat within the hotel and a good fitness center with several treadmills, free weights and machines. Complementary water and towels are made available. Spa offers massages. Within walking distance of many things.

Excellent hotel for business or leisure travels to Casablanca. Friendly staff, good food and beverage options and great rooms. Suites are the best and high floor rooms have great views of the square and old town.

The location is convenient for those in business downtown and the hotel is OK overall. Definitely not a 5 star, may be a 4 star hotel. Service was ok but not outstanding and the rooms should definitely get a face lift soon (old carpet, plumbing in the bathroom making noise and not working properly, etc.) I'll most likely be staying elsewhere next time in Casablanca.

A nice hotel in Casa Port area with friendly and helpful staff. Hotel is clean and rooms are business friendly. Close to the train station and just an hour away from the airport. Breakfast was good with plenty of choices and dining staff are super friendly. I also liked the fact that the hotel is just next to the big Medina with lots of leather goods and souvenir items.

We arrived here after four days in Morocco and found it to be a good place to stay. By now my wife had a sprained ankle and a large blister on her foot and the front desk staff were most helpful in providing a medical kit and even assisting with applying iodine to the area - service that was way beyond expectations. We were on the Club Floor and the first night just stayed in the Club and had wine and appetizers for dinner. The other folks we were travelling with went to the Moroccan restaurant and had a good evening. We also just had breakfast on the Club Floor and that was fine as well. The fitness centre was large and up to date and the service was great. We even had a shower for the first time in quite a few days. Very happy with this stay.

We stayed at the hotel Sunday November 3, 2013. The staff at the front desk was helpful and other staff members were belligerent. The business office is very small; the computers are out of date. We were not able to print our boarding passes. Breakfast was terrible. My wife and I could not eat the food. We have received a bill of $ 120 for the room which was prepaid. This is not a good hotel.

Having stayed at many Hyatt's around the world over the past 30 years (Life Time Diamond Member) I was disappointed by the Room that we stayed in 917. Not up to Hyatt Regency Standards more like a Holiday Inn! Small dated room with a Bathroom that was smaller then an Airplane Toilet. Small Regency Club that offered ok food but nothing to write home about it. The Entry Hall is beautiful and huge, the best part of the Hotel indeed. Really not a Hotel for the Holidays as 90% of the Guest are on business. Dr. K

There are two restaurants in the Hyatt, one of which is Moroccan themed. The decor is beautiful with draped ceilings and moorish lights. A man plays some kind of local pianocord and at random intervals a belly dancer appears. The couscous is fantastic as is the chocolate fondant.

Very quite night time . very noisy the morning ,i had enjoyed the moroccan food at moroccan restaurant ,the room was clean and nice looking .. the livingroom bar was lovely and i cannot forget the very long conversation that i had with the lovely and and soo nice bartender "anine" ... the overal experience was good and i hope go back again in the futur .

column3: High end hotel in downtown Casa
column4: Good facilities with lobby bar, separate loud music / sports bar, nightclub open until late. You do pay a premium here for everything. Rooms are 50% more than other comparable hotels, drinks are more expensive than in London or New York, hotel cars much more than local taxis...be careful to check your bill when checking out. Rooms are spacious and facilities are good, only complaint is old plumbing with variable shower temperatures (be careful!) and corrosion marks on bath. Recommended if you don't mind paying a premium. I note the manager seems to copy & paste the same bog-standard positive or negative reply each time, and wonder if these comments are actually noted. Better not to reply than paste the same thing every time!

I stayed one night in this hotel in the heart of casablanca. they upgraded me in a very nice suite. service was impeccable. good breakfast. the room was clean with a confortable bed. Eventually i would suggest to put the shower a little higher.. for the rest all was good.

Shabby rooms, very very dated. I paid about $400 for the pleasure of staying in a room I wish I had not stepped foot in. The bathroom was very attractive but the shower pulsed hot and cold both times, so did my colleagues'. The bed was ok, the room just looked dirty. I had pants and a polo laundered for my departure the next morning and they forgot to get it to me on time. When I called to remind them I needed it immediately, it came back folded perfectly - but still wet. I had no choice but to wear it, what a gross feeling. I was still charged about fifty bucks for that express service. There is an attractive bar off the lobby and if you're into overpriced bar food and twenty dollar drinks I highly recommend it.

column3: The Hyatt Regency Casablanca is one of the World's finest hotels
column4: Having stayed at literally hundreds of 5 star hotels over the past two or three decades, I'm guess I've become pretty jaded. It takes a lot to impress me. I can tell you that the Hyatt Regency Casablanca did a lot more than just impress me. It blew me away! As soon as we arrived at the front desk, the Manager was immediately summoned and appeared within seconds to personally and effusively greet us and upgraded us to just one notch below the Presidential Suite (called the Ambassador Suite at that hotel). Our suite was a magnificent Regency Executive Suite on one of the top floors and with stunning views of the Grand Mosque and the Sea including full breakfasts each morning, access to the Executive Lounge including free drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The entire…

We traveled for over a week around Morocco and tried to stay in Riads in the smaller areas of Fez and Marrakesh and for Casablanca we chose Hyatt and know why we like to spoil ourselves occasionally and splurge on a Hyatt room. The location is excellent and the view is just incredible! The staff is always so friendly and I was so blown away by one staff member (Reda) when he remembered me by name the next morning when I showed up for breakfast, WOW! We had dinner one night at their belly dancing restaurant and thought it was entertaining with fabulous food! They have another bar and they serve watermelon mojitos that go down waaaayyyyyy toooooo easy, YIKES! The only down part of staying at the Hyatt in Casablanca is that the taxi drivers try to charge you an arm and a leg as…

I stayed 1 night for a business trip. The staff were exceptionally friendly and welcoming and the service generally very good. I got upgraded to a suite which was a nice, comfortable room but the decor was perhaps a bit out of date. The breakfast was served in the beautiful plush restaurant and was of high standard with lots of choice. When I ordered egg white omelette with herbs they didn't bat an eyelid and it arrived within minutes perfect. Overall good experience.

column3: Believe the hype - Best in Casablanca
column4: Just got back from a wonderful week long stay at the Hyatt. Travelled with my wife and two children and was upgraded from a club room to a suite. Highly recommend getting a suite if travelling with small children. Ample space and friendly staff. My children were so happy with the hotel they didnt want to venture out! Good food and facilities. Swimming pool area was especially nice, spent many hours by the pool relaxing and mingling with other families. We didnt speak french or arabic but we managed to get by just fine and had little difficulty in getting our message across. I've stayed in many Hyatts across the world and this one didnt let me down and re-affirmed why Hyatt is my chosen hotel as a business traveller. After a late night flight from london (00.25) we were picked…

It doesnt get better than the lobby. Beautiful, often bustling, modern and inviting. Front desk is friendly and helpful. Rooms are ok. Rather large but a tad dated and tired. Comfortable though, especially those o the city side. Medina side, they are noisy. Service is friendly,and occasionally dysfunctional, as you'd expect around here. Altogether, a nice place, but well below Hyatt standards. A serious shake up is called for. Come here if you cant afford the Sofitel.

This hotel is really beautiful, and the staff is wonderful. The rooms are clean, and air conditioning is great. The only thing that we had a hard time with was, being American, we were not used to having just a toilet (with no sink), completely separate from the rest of the bathroom area. The hotel is in a great location and the noise didn't bother us. I would highly recommend this hotel.

I have stayed in this hotel three times, I have been told its the best 5 stars hotel in Casablanca but its not, the rooms are just normal, for me the facilities is not that important, what is important is the hotel's staff, all receptionists at the front desk don't know how to treat the guests, very slow check-in and checkout service, even they don't know what does a smile means, at the lobby you can see the laundry trolley passing by which I don't like, food quality and services are good, they do have an amazing Moroccan restaurant, its highly recommended to visit this restaurant even if you are not a resident, the bellmen, housekeeping, room service staff all are great. In short, if you are in business trip, this hotel could serve the purpose, and if you are in leisure one…

Enjoyed my stay and the friendliness of the staff. Check-in was quick but check-out was a bit slow. The view and the air-conditioning was excellent! The only downside was the construction noise outside. It started early in the morning and lasted late in the evening.

My girlfriends and I stayed at the hyatt, the only international chain throughout our recent visit to morocco. The rooms were crampy for triple share & the toilet doors were see through. A bit odd for friends sharing room. We stayed the 1st night in Casablanca and our last night. On our last night upon arrival from marrakech, we informed reception that we didn't want a room with transparent toilet doors. She said ok and yet assigned such a room to us. We had to call reception to change room, asked for front office manager Armando but he instead of offering solution, gave us excuses, ie said only 10 rooms in hotel with non transparent toilet doors and all were full. my friends spoke with another reception Zara who assigned another room but with strong food stench and we called…

column3: A wonderful experience - what an awesome service!
column4: The location is marvelous just next to the basar and the service is awesome. I had a suite on the 11th floor and i was impressed by the view from my room over the basar towards the sea. I also very much liked the Nespresso machine in the room, but the best was the piltes mat, so I could do my morning exercise in style. I did not like that there was a carpet, but to be honest it looked fresh and clean. The internet was fast. The mattress a little bit too hard. The room might need some renovation within the next 2 years, but for the moment it is still ok. The breakfast in the executive lounge was great and the service was awesome. I will come back.

I've been going to the Hyatt for the last 10 years. I've seen the upgrades being done to the hotel. I have a special bond with the hotel: I can't put my finger on it, but it makes me feel at home. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The staff is very, very friendly. I'm always impressed that they greet me by name. The hotel is clean. The little touch that makes it for me is the lounge music throughout the entire hotel. Breakfast is elaborate but rather expensive at 260DHR. As well, it's funny but sad to see that the staff easily looses control during the morning rush. Glasses are not added fast enough, the jar of orange juice remains empty for too long... Nothing a good manager wouldn't be able to fix though. The attached Café M is worth the visit! The menu is awesome. I…

I have visited Casa 2-3 times per year for the past 6 years, usually alternating b/w the hotels on Ave. d' Anfa. The Hyatt was a very pleasant surprise, with clean modern rooms, fast Internet, good restaurants, and friendly service ( although painfully slow at times) The Hyatt is now my preferred option for my business trips.

column3: Not a typical Hyatt, and not in a good way.
column4: i chose the hyatt for my recent work trip to casablanca as it was the hotel with the best reviews of the options provided by my company (the others including le meridien so still other good intl chains). as soon as i arrived around 6:30p to check-in after a very long flight and a full day of work mtgs, i was impressed by the very nice lobby and the smiling mgr. i had requested a quiet non-smoking room as i was there for work and needed to sleep well and focus w/o much noise. however, as soon as i went into the room (201) at the very end of the hallway RIGHT near the emergency stairwell exit, i was disappointed after the first impression of the hotel. it was SO loud with staff constantly coming and going with banging so loud of the emergency exit doors as well as talking on cell…

i stayed for a couple of nights in Casa ( as the locals usually call Casablanca ) recently and found out after some unpleasant experiences, that nighlife in Casa was dangerous & treacherous unless I was recommended to visit Black House after midnight. Prior to that I visited the corniche ( Ain Diab) along the Atlantic coast, which had a mushroom growth of bars, night clubs, karaoke clubs etc. These places were infested with men & women looking for lonely foriegners to cheat & rob them of their money and other valuables.The Black House was real fun and an upscale place to drink, dance and meet beautiful & young Moroccan women. You need to buy an entry ticket of 150 MAD ( residents are entitled to free entry ) which comes with a free drink and its non-stop thrill till 3:30 in the…

I started off my tour of Morocco in Casablanca. It's not the greatest city by any means, but the Hyatt there is decadent. We were in a Regency Club Room which was very nice, modern and upscale. We arrived in the early morning, so we had breakfast at the hotel. It was like a gourmet meal with service to boot! Later that evening, we had cocktails in their lounge, which was so nice. If you have to be in Casablanca, I would recommend this hotel.

column3: best service ever-a safe reference in asablanca
column4: I spent 2 nights in the Hyatt and expect the check in maybe a little bit longer than normal everything was perfect. The lobby is amazing, food is very high quality (would recommend to try the pastries), my bedroom was perfect and the service the best ever. Staff is very well trained, there is nothing wrong about anyone in the staff. The gym is good and the area around the pool very pleasant. I would also mentioned the breakfast which can't be missed. The cooker can make wafles, pancakes, omelettes ans again the quality of products is very high. Breakfast can be continental, English or more local. The breakfast is adapted to everyone. I had a very nice experience is the Hyatt and I think is my No 1 so far.

This is a beautiful hotel adjacent to the Medina. It has a fantastic lobby, but the rooms are a bit shabby for the price (e.g. stains on rug, poorly draining shower). The gym is excellent and the employees are very helpful, however. Overall a nice hotel, but I found the price a tad steep for the quality of the room itself.

The Hyatt Casablanca: excellent service with caring staff. Perfect central location, close to the old medina as well as walking distance from the great art deco public buildings and business area. The rooms are large, with good bathroom. Good breakfast. Large meeting rooms for business events. Don't go there for the swimming pool, however, as it is rather small, and more the background to the pool restaurant than a relaxing holiday place. DO NOT use the ground line for confcalls, as they will bill you over 100 Euros per hour! Outrageous! If you do have confcalls, you would rather rent for the price of 2 or 3 confcalls a proper meeting room, telephone included.

column3: Large western style hotel in city centre
column4: Stayed on business for 3 nights. This is big hotel, within easy walking distance of the shops & the port. Its not cheap, but the facilities seem pretty good - although we did not get chance to use many of them. Room and bathroom were clean & quite plush. Everything (aircon, TV, WiFi) worked perfectly, and the bathroom had a separate bathtub & shower. The breakfast buffet was OK, with European & African options - but the service was a bit chaotic. It took ages to get tables cleared & re-laid. The bar near the lobby is a good spot for a beer or a glass of wine. Most of the staff speak reasonable English - but this is a great place to practice your schoolboy French !

column3: Excellent service and great location in center of town
column4: Brilliant service and very nice location close to everything and with great views (Ask for a floor above 7 and with sea view) you will see the city skyline (Low) the mosque and the ocean The staff was amazing at the regency club and at checking. My room had a bit of smoke smell and I was assisted immediately and upgraded with no questions asked I was greated by name at the regency club at all times and the staff was truly amazing - I'm a black member with GHA program and several others and Hyatt became now my choice as well

column3: Slightly dated and in the wrong part of town
column4: The hotel is slightly dated and the room I was in faced the main street so was loud. What was also an issue was the fumigation that started sometime at 5am that woke me up. All I could see outside the window was white clouds of gas. I assume that this is needed to control mosquitoes, but residents should be informed about this the night before. The night club attached to the hotel is dreadful.

column3: Hotel is fine but like rest of Casa, it is wearing out
column4: Casablanca for a night.... waiting for a flight to Paris we stayed here for one one night. I admit I am angry with the front desk still so should not be writing this review so focused on them but dang it, they blew it!!!! The rpoom is fine, standard overseas Hyatt/Hilton/Sheraton stock. Blah Blah Blah. One thing I have learned form my travel is that the standard business hotel "gets it" when it comes to service items like hotel transfers, flight stuff, quiet time after a day of meetings etc. I am not here for luxury, spa, beach etc. I am here to catch a flight first thing in the morning. Soon after arrival I asked to arrange transfer to the airport early in the morning. The gentleman at the front desk "poopoo'd" me and said "of course I will have this all arranged etc.…

Don't let the outside trick you. The inside is extremely nice and up to the hotel stars. I had only breakfast and it was very good with a nice buffet as well as with a menu a la carte. Rooms are big with all is needed. The hotel provides limousine services a bit expensive but with nice car and extremely useful if you want to avoid local taxis. Public transportation is available right outside the hotel.

I say that only if you have to go. There is nothing to see in this town that makes it worth going out of your way for. If you have any romantic ideas from the movie they will soon be shattered. This is one of the dirtiest uninteresting cities I have ever been. The only interesting thing to see there is the Hassan ll Mosque.

column3: The best in Casablanca, so be ready to pay for it.
column4: Just ended my 3nights stay at the Hyatt, had a Regency Club room. Breakfast is provided in the Club Lounge even though the one provided in the main restaurant is better (you'll be charged extra on a Club Room BB basis if you choose to try the one in the main restaurant). A great aperitif is offered from 6pm to 8pm with a good variety of wines and fresh juices, really good finger food as well. Get there early as the lounge is quite small and with only a few tables. Extremely NOISY rooms overlooking the main entrance, make sure you bring your earplugs and ask for the ones overlooking the back of the building. Club rooms are not as big as I expected, Nespresso coffe is provided. Conveniently located a few steps away the historical Bab Marrakech and the old medina. Probably the…

i stayed in this hotel 3times.it is really my favourite hotel in Casablanca . everything is good,especially the lobby staff can call my name after few months when i checked.in again.i was touched by them. only thing not good to me is the breakfast never change. i can take any.food by closing my eyes and wouldn't be wrong since their layout never change as well. for one time stayer it is not a concern anyway a very good hotel in Casablanca .

The Hyatt Regency has been my hotel in Casablanca for well over 25 years now. It is centrally located and offers an excellent stay. Professional and polite staff, comfortable rooms, good restaurants and bar.

On a trip 2 week trip to Morocco, this was the highlight! Was able to get an incredible room with a great view of the Hassan II Masjid. The hotel was classy, comfortable and a short distance away from the most authentic (madinah (inner city) and souks (stores)) with many hundreds of years of history. Visiting the Hassan II Masjid was amazing! and is a absolute must see. The hotel was beautifully decorated and had good wholesome entertainment. I can't wait to return.

My first impression of the hotel was good. No issues with the airport pick-up - great car. The hotel is also extremely well appointed in the heart of the city overlooking the recently upgraded United Nations Square; which is very pretty. The hotel is simply lacking a quality management presence. There is no shortage of staff but they are badly organised and rarely were we attended to without prompting in the hotel bar and cafe. At no point did we see any senior member of the hotel team making their presence felt to either guests or more importantly staff. If they were doing so, it was extremely discreet and was not having any impact. By no standard could the property boast genuine 5 star service. I also had pretty serious issues with room keys; which needed to be reissued…

column3: Great Hotel in a not so great city
column4: The Hyatt Regency in Casablanca really is a lovely hotel. The reception area is really nice and welcoming, with beautiful dark wood walls and stunning decor. The breakfast was sublime, and the rooms are very nice. We had 5 great nights here and really enjoyed our stay. The location is great as it is literally over the road from the square where the tram stops, however the city itself isn't that great and there's not that much to do overall. To summarise, it's great hotel !

Good service Great food at room service and in the resturant New and great room. Bathroom was big and new. Im not so shure about the location but i did not like to walk in the streets around the hotel. I could not walk in peace

Spent my last night in Casablanca, before leaving Morocco to return home: this was my pre-planned splurge! While not the typical Moroccan experience by any stretch, the Hyatt made every effort to afford it guests an attentive, luxurious experience in the heart of town, next to the medina: new meets old! Staff was wonderful, everyone knew my name, and looked after me with both good grace and diligence. It was a great choice for my final night, well worth the price. Room, dinner, and lounge "mint tea" we're all excellent! Recommended!

This is a great hotel not because of the setting or hardware but because of the staff. Stayed two nights and can only rave about the level of attention from the staff from the night we checked (wonderfully cheerful and personalised greeting from the receptionist) to the great service in the Regency club lounge to the wait staff at the bar where we asked for Moroccan tapis to the wonderful food, ambiance and staff at Cafe M, to one of the best concierge we have ever encountered in our travels. The hotel is in a good location the rooms are very comfortable and well kept it is safe, secure and a pleasure - highly, highly recommended.

The hotel facilities and location is quite good, but again ,you will have to pay deposit while checking in ,even if you will not use such facility ,and the problem when you are checking-out you will receive the local currency while you are in your way to the airport ,thus you are forced to use it or change it with lowest rate because you have any other option .

I unfortunately missed a connecting flight after returning from a splendid ski touring trip in the High Atlas Mountains. I checked with the airlines (EK) to find what recommendation they had, I asked for 5 star, and the Hyatt Regency was recommended. Reviewed trip advisor, it was ranked 3rd, but went with it, because I had a frequent guest registration......mistake. Could not pull the taxi up to the front door because of security, unless one was in a limousine. I had to carry my board bag and backpack myself. The check in was prolonged, there were three desks operating with one on client at each desk, and it seemed that the staff were trying to go slowly so that someone else had the duty of checking me in. The staff recognized my displeasure, and I was upgraded to…

column3: Best choice and location in Casablanca
column4: In the center of Casablanca across from the Medina and old souk lies this attractive hotel. You enter into a impressive lobby with striking floral arrangements and furnishings.The reception is gracious and attentive.The rooms are well appointed though I felt a bit cramped. I had a late night snack downstairs in the lounge,sitting on plush cushions,sipping my first Moroccan tea , tasty squash soup with chicken on a bagel. Back upstairs to a sound sleep on a plush well appointed bed Pleasant dreams

I'm a frequent traveller to these types of business hotels. From my physical look around its the nicest place to stay in Casa. That said it's not quite at the same standard as other properties, other's correctly noted a mix of very luxurious finishings and somewhat dated ones. Slept well on the 3rd floor facing the tram line, noise was within expectations (its very central and the old souk is close by). The staff were very helpful and worked to help us find a few innovative solutions to those little problems that occur first day in a new place. When in Casa again we will return for sure. Be aware though, we didn't really find that Casablanca had much to offer tourists, and a day was very sufficent for us.

column3: Lower your expectations, the hotel have low cielings anyway.
column4: It is the best hotel the city can offer, but lower your expectations when you go there. some parts are dated some are luxurious giving a mixed and uncomfortable feeling On the good side, staff is friendly and tries to go the extra mile to meet your needs. The hotel location is in the center of everything and right in front of the new Metro line. Breakfast is okay, loved the fresh raspberry juice ;) On the negative side, -This hotel is not for claustrophobics!! The floors ceiling is 230cms high and feels even lower with the carpet floors and long coridors. -Housekeeping needs to improve, the minibar and toiletries were not replaced for two consuquetive days. -Nice big wall for the TV and get a tiny 30" screen installed on it, the hotel should go for bigger sized screens.…

Having said that, I haven't stayed at any other hotel in Casablanca, but the Hyatt lives up to its reputation. Rooms are both spacious and clean. Breakfast buffet offers a number of excellent options. Staff is extremely helpful and courteous. What more could a traveller ask for?

The hotel seems to have had a recent facelift. It has a modern decor. Nothing spectacular but quite nice overall. The room is decent sized and has all the stuff that you would expect from Hyatt. Really liked it that the temp in the room was turned up way high when I entered so did not have to spend the first hour freezing. The room overlooked the road with distant views of the sea/minarets. A check-in/check-out the staff was friendly. There was a confusion in my booking which they took care of very professionally. The hotel is pretty central, so was a relatively short rides to meetings through the crazy traffic in the city. The highlight was the dinner. The food at the Moroccan restaurant was really nice. They have Moroccan musicians and belly-dancers. Not something I really…

Arrived late evening and the staff was friendly and efficient. Suggested room service since we were jet lagged and this was just what we needed. Beautiful king size bed and fabulous marble and granite bathroom with fully enclosed shower. The breakfast ( included ) was the best we had in Morocco...all kinds of eggs, soups, pastries, fruit, meats, cheeses, cereals and coffees. Do not miss a dinner at one of their restaurants...Cafe M. This small, but elegant room was a calm oasis in the bustle of Casablanca. Excellent wine list with many Moroccan wines ( try some of the Medallions ). The lobby lounge/bar is full of overstuffed chairs and sofas...perfect place for a pre or post dinner drink.

column3: Luxury in the Midst of Chaos
column4: The hotel is this ourcropping of luxury in the middle of the chaos of Casablanca. While the traffic honks their horns outside, the hotel offers beautifully spaious rooms with separate showers and bath tubs. The room service is also delicious with local cuisine presented beautifull. Check in and out were easy and smmoth and all of the staff was friendly and helpful. I would higly recommend it.

Hyatt Regency has been the best place in our trip to Marrocco. The staff was extremely friendly and service was without any flaws. Also the food in the Marroccanian Restaurant was outstanding The staff was falling in love to our baby and all of our 5 person family had a great time and we wished to stay longer at this place.

column3: Warm and friendly service with a clean modern look.
column4: We are a family of four that stayed on the Regency Floor for a weekend. Our welcome into the hotel during check in and room orientation was extremely personal and detailed. During check-in, the Guest Services Manager came to introduce himself and explained that they had set up an extra bed in our room in anticipation of our arrival with our two small boys. He provided his card and asked that we call him if it was not sufficient. The gentleman that escorted us to our room provided a clear, personal and detailed room orientation. Our guest room was located on the 8th floor (Regency Floor). We found the room to be clean, sleek and a with a view of Hassan II Mosque. The extra bed was exactly what we needed for our boys and it fit fine in the room. Breakfast was enjoyed in…

My daughter and I treated ourselves to brunch at the Hyatt's restaurant after attending services at St. John, a nearby Episcopalian chapel hidden among palm trees at the far side of the hotel's parking lot. (If you do want to visit the church grounds and you ask for directions, the locals will tell you, "There's no church there, it's only a cemetery." But persevere! There are many gravestones among the greenery but there is also a building which only holds about 60 people.) Back to the lunch: we were the first to come to brunch and the maitre d', even tho' he knew we were not hotel guests, treated us with highest regard. The food offered was breakfast, lunch and dinner fare, nothing was missing, everything tasted super. I wished for an endless capacity. A crepe and…

The Hyatt is a Hyatt: i.e. It has the great architecture, the amazing bars and restaurants, the breath taking lobby. However, service is not to the standard of a five star hotel. Our travel companion's luggage didn't arrive. She speaks fluent French and asked the receptionist for a toothbrush, she was sent back and forth, nobody provided her with a toothbrush. Long and short, we had to go out to the street late in the night looking for a store to get a toothbrush. Our room was for 3 people, but when we got to our room, he extra bed was missing. we had to call twice to get the bed delivered and unfortunately, the person bringing it had a strong B.O. we had to leave the room for a while and open the windows. The next day at breakfast we had to order 5 different waiters for coffee…

column3: Probably not worth the price paid
column4: It is true that the Hyatt's location and overall property (especially public spaces) are excellent particularly for a business visit to Casablanca, but for price paid, I think there may be other alternatives that will serve you better. Overall, the rooms are certainly above average, with very comfortable beds and nice amenities. BUT, make sure you get a room with working Air Conditioning. I didn't and two other members of our business group also did not have functioning air conditioning. On my first morning, I asked the front desk to send a technician to fix the problem. The problem was not fixed. Rather than move rooms, I was able to mitigate the problem by opening my windows (to a noisy street) and allowing cool nighttime air to come in, until I went to sleep and did…

column3: A much needed shot of the US
column4: We stayed here our last night in Morocco. I thought perhaps we should book another riad but decided to book the Hyatt instead because of location. Are we glad we did! After 8 night in Morocco we needed a shot of westernization and this provided it beautifully. The rooms were air conditioned, the beds were so comfortable, the linens very nice and the staff was superbly helpful. We had lunch and breakfast there and food, service and ambiance were great. Highly recommended.

The staff are friendly but sometimes a bit distracted. The food was ok but better can be found elsewhere along the beach with 2kms. The bar is not very accommodating and closes at 11pm after which you can only order room service. However, a lovely location, super surfing beach behind and nice swimming pool also.

My first visit to Casablanca and I decide to stay in Hyatt as the brand name is valuable but I was surprised With service they provide to their guest the hotel doesn’t look hyatt at all. • In my 2nd night 08Dec there was electricity shut down in the night and I try to reach call center with no answer from their side • Again there was electricity shut down on 10th Dec day time with no any apologize letter from Hotel Management • On 10th Dec I went to have lunch at the restaurant they have and they said we are sorry only a la carte menu no Buffet I was shocked as I know many hotels doing the a la carte menu for lunch during the low season only but in hyatt here they do it even if the run high occupancy as per their staff when the replay to a walk in guest we are sorry no rooms…

Excellent location close enough to some of Casablanca best attractions, yet outside the gruesome old Casablanca area. Definitely one of the best breakfast menus you can hope to get in Morocco. Generously sized rooms with a comfortable desk and fast Wi-Fi internet connection. Spacious walk-in shower, well-sized bathtub and high quality bathroom accessories.

At the end of our Moroccan trip we stayed one night in this hotel in October 2012. Check-in was smooth and we did not wait too long. Our room was clean and spacious; bathroom is large. However, the toilet was at another location and there is no washbasin in there so we had to go to the bathroom to wash hands, that was a bit awkward. We had a queen size bed and bed was firm, bed linen, towels were clean. The sleep quality in that room was good, did not hear any noises at night. After changed some money at the front desk, we went out to the Old Medina, which is at the other side of street, only 5 minutes away. We arrived late that night and only strolled around a little bit in the market. The continental buffet style breakfast next morning was good and the dinning area was…

This is a review from an unabashed fan of Hyatt -- I travel a lot for work, stay at Hyatts around the world, Diamond on the rewards scale, love the brand. The Hyatt Regency Casablanca has the worst service of any Hyatt I have stayed at worldwide. I stayed here for two nights on business this past summer. First night, arrived at 10 PM. No one in line for reservations, was asked to wait 20 minutes for unclear reasons for check-in. Was essentially fluffed off by the woman at the counter when I asked for separate twins (as I had requested by telephone 3 days prior, and advised them of the late check-in). Was told that there were rooms with separate beds, but I had not requested them previously, and hence they could not place me in one. Not sure what that was about, but I asked to…

column3: Flying insects and cockroaches in restaurant!
column4: I stayed at Hyatt Regency Casablanca for business and received a room overlooking the city, which was good. The hotel facilities were not matching its price and I didn't receive any Platinum member services during my stay. The bathrooms were not properly cleaned and only received minimal care. The food variety for breakfast was also not sufficient at all. All was fine until I spotted flying insects roaming around the food at the buffet and a cockroach by the piano which is located right outside the dining area. I asked to have the food removed and changed, which actually happened. My problem was that this was the norm there at the restaurant every day. However, I have to say that the staff at the restaurant are very nice. This is my second time in Casa and I was hoping to get…

First of all I must say that there really arent a whole lot of good options in Casablanca. The city is dirty, noisy and generally not very safe. The Hyatt probably is the only decent option which could be why the staff has such a "whatever" attitude. We checked in a day prior to our tour and our tour director was actually the one who checked us in with the staff. This was all prepaid by the tour company. We were told that the club lounge was not open for drinks for the next 2 nights and not for breakfast the next morning. We were given other options. No problem. The next afternoon my husband and I decided to relax and have lunch by the pool. We waited OVER 45 minutes for service. The staff only seemed to concentrate on a couple of tables, the rest of the staff just hung around.…

We stayed at the Hyatt in Casablanca for a long weekend and although it was Ramadan and the restauramts were either closed or very busy, the stay was very enjoyable. The rooms were very nice and clean and the pool area / bar / restaurant was the same. Staff were helpful although English is not perfectively spoken it is certainly acceptable and knowing a little french goes a long way. There are a lot of nearby restaurants and cafes and a large medina is opposite the hotel. We visited "Ricks Cafe" which, albeit not the original from the film (there never was a Ricks in Casablanca), was a really good night out and everything you would have expected from the film version.

For a Hyatt, I must say the hotel is disappointing! The lobby is nice with a nice warm feel to it with lots of comfy sofas, the staff are smiley & the Moroccan restaurant is really good, the hotel is 2 min walk from Medina, but that's about it!!! I stayed in room number 100 where one of the phones was missing, the other broken which means you can't even call the reception when there's a problem! The sink didn't drain water & internet could not be accessed due to "interface" issues that needed at least 2 requests & 30 min to fix but worst of all, almost unbearable the AC was broken & released exhaust fumes into the room. Worst of all, when you inform the duty manager about all this, you'd imagine he'd be appalled & actually do something (he did fix internet though) …

column3: Excellent hotel in a great location
column4: Stayed for 5 nights October 2012. For visiting Casa, the location is excellent. Check in and service were of a very high standard. Pool is lovely,especially considering you are in the middle of a major city, close by the Old Medina.

I was looking for a quiet and relaxing hotel in the fairly chaotic city of Casablanca and found the "Hyatt Regency" where I got the opportunity to make use of massages and a SPA area. My Junior Suite in the upper floor was modern and well furnished. The view on the Medina and the mosque "Hassan II" is just awesome from the suites. The provided meals were good, as was the breakfast. The hotel's staff is a great find, very capable.

column3: Falls short of the normal Hyatt experience
column4: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in October 2012 as it was recommended by the client I was visiting. The choices in Casablanca are limited for "5 Star" hotels as although this is advertized as 5 star it certainly falls short of the label. I booked a club level room and the quality of the room and amenities did not feel like a $400 per night hotel. The furniture and bedding was dated. The club lounge was actually very good and the service was also good. As Casablanca is a smoking environment having the club with its non-smoking rule was worth the extra room cost. All the hotel restaurants and bars have smoking in all areas even though they have the "non-smoking areas". The hotel does not have a turn-down service unless you ask for it..................strange for a 5 star…

column3: I like this hotel so much.
column4: I'd has been there once in the year 1995, (long time ago). I like this hotel so much. They have best service, very nice location, quite place, clean room, and very good food. I will go back to Casablanca and stay at Hyatt Regency Casablanca Hotel again..........@Tony King

During my stay in the hotel , I was happy with the room , the bathroom is separated into 2 units (very strange) . they have a very nice Moroccan restaurant , you have to try the bastela and the lamb rips . the breakfast is extremely poor with very low varieties and small aarea

Room : Nice room, modern, clean, very good bed. It might be nice to change the carpet in the rooms to wooden floors. View from my room was not nice but I guess all rooms have a bad view (my room was 312) Service : good. The ladies at the front desk are always very friendly. Breakfast : good. Everything you need : fresh, variety etc... Hotel might be a bit expensive (my employer paid for it.... not sure if I would like to pay as much money for a hotel in case I would go there in my private time ...)

Read the reviews about this hotel before arriving so probably set my expectations much higher than they should.. This is not the best hotel in casablanca and if it is oh dear! I arrived at around 1 am and it took about 10 minutes to check me in. The reception told me there were no room so he would give me a junior suite for 1 night BUT I have to leave it the second night and go to a room. My answer was but I am only staying 3 nights and I don't want to move about?! He was not too happy but reluctantly agreed. It's not my fault they had no rooms! I had booked well in advance.... Upon coming to the suite was thankful I didn't get a room! Refurbishing is badly needed for a Hyatt am surprised of the conditions. No locks on the door meant that in the 3 nights countless people walked…

In May 2012, I have travelled, with couple of my colleagues, to Morocco for business and stayed two nights at the Hayatt Regency; it was really a bad experience! We reached the hotel after 12 hours flying, we were all looking forward to go to our rooms to take rest and we thought that checking in would hardly take 5 or 10 mn since payment was done at the time of booking. It actually took one hour! First the receptionist said that there were no booking in the name of our company, I asked her to double check but she said that as per her system no booking was there. I asked her to call her manager and again we had to wait and finally they confirmed that our booking was there in their system. The Key in hand and happy to finally go to my room, When I reached, I couldn’t open the…

Stayed one night at the end of a tour. Helpful staff, great location with clean tidy rooms. We got a free upgrade on check-in which was a pleasant surprise. Breakfast provided was varied and tasty. Front of house also booked a table for dinner out and arranged our transport. Thanks

Hotel was just as expected. Pictures do not lie. Room was clean and comfortable. TV was quite small but no biggie. Food was wayyyy over priced, especially breakfast. Expect to pay over $30pp for simple meal of pastries, coffee, eggs, and potatoes. Total rip off. Lounge area was nice but beware this is a smoking hotel and people in Casablanca LOVE to smoke. Yassine (our concierge) took excellent care of us. He recommended an awesome restaurant called Cebastan on the water for dinner. Wonderful experience, about a 15 taxi ride from the hotel. Always take the red taxi and negoiate the price before getting in. Any trip less than 15 mins should only cost around 30DH. We paid 50DH from the Casa Voyeurs (sp) train station to the hotel. If you fly into Casablanca, take the train which…

column3: Nice but watch out for "helpful" valets
column4: The hotel is beautiful, centrally located and the food is reasonable. There is a common area in front of he hotel for catching taxis. The hotel valets were extremely willing to help us get a taxi. However, it wasnt until the third day there that we realized that the valets and taxi drivers were badly overcharging us. We paid anywhere from 80 to 100 MAD when in reality we should have been paying 30 to 50 MAD. We realized that the valets were getting kickbacks from the taxi drivers. While this is a very common thing in Morocco, I feel that the hotel should have done a better job at protecting their patrons and ensuring that they were not taken advantage of.

I always stay at the Hyatt Regency when in Casablanca. It is an excellent hotel with wonderful rooms, excellent service and a really first class Moroccan restaurant. Also, great breakfasts. The rooms are very quiet and comfortable and I've always been able to get a lot of work done. Casablanca is probably the least picturesque city in all of Morocco and, for me the hotel is a welcome refuge from the urban ugliness. At the same time, it is right beside the old traditional market, which can't match Fas or Marrakesh but does have a certain amount of charm. At the moment the hotel is fronted by massive construction of a metro system, which will almost certainly improve the public area but is presently a pain. I think there is pretty much a consensus that this is the best hotel in…

My standard-level room was utterly immaculate, with luxurious amenities and a stone bathroom. The pool side restaurant offered a tranquil, relaxed atmosphere, a menu with interesting and imaginative selections, and the food was excellent quality and delicious. Service was gracious and friendly - my waiter even offered to help troubleshoot my Mac when it could not connect to the wifi (which he was successful with). Thank you! The staff thoughtfully ensured transportation to the airport was arranged to allow for traffic delays and that the price was a customary fare, due to me traveling alone and not speaking French. My travel should always include such a great place to rest. Thank you to the staff at Hyatt Casablanca.

This hotel has many advantages: very convenient location for exploring the center, great lobby area (ideal for meetings), excellent service, very nice standing showers. It is in my mind the best business hotel in the city.

column3: First class hotel - fabulous lobby area & lovely pool
column4: Ended up staying here by accident as the hotel we were booked to stay at was not finished on time. Unfortunately we had a very brief stopover due to late flight in & early meeting but the public areas were all beautiful; service in the bar was prompt & friendly ( a lovely selection of free nibbles with the drinks); room was spacious and luxurious and the pool area was lovely. I didn't visit the gym! My colleagues had breakfast in the restaurant and there was a fantastic selection of very fresh food.

I stayed in this hotel as part of a business trip for me it was very convenient as it was walking distance to most of my meetings The staff were very helpful and accommodating. They picked up from the first day that I wasn't a french speaker and remembered that throughout my stay. Hotel pub was a great relaxing place and u have to try the morrocan restaurant. Room service was quick and very tasty. Pool was magnificent. I didst try the gym or spas but was told by colleagues that they are great. I would highly recommend this hotel for anybody visiting Casablanca.

column3: Wonderful beginning to our time in morocco!
column4: Lovely hotel. We stayed on the club floor which worked well for us. We were tired from the flights, and the small plates they served in the evening with a wide assortment of drinks was just right. Breakfast was excellent s well. The room itself was perfect in every way. Our only regret was that we only got to stay one before we moved on to other parts of Morocco.
Clean hotel, nice rooms, experienced staff, central location.

column3: A very good place to stay in Central Casabalnca
column4: Very modern hotel that would make you feel in any large US or European city, if not the specific marocco atmosphear. Place des Nation unies is under serious renovation, especially with the construction of the new Tramway, and is it better to go to the street behind the hotel if you need to take a cab or be picked up by your chauffeur. Rooms are large, comfortable, well cooled down, rather quiet (you can still hear the muezzin). Bathroom is large with a nice shower. Breakfast is very tasty, as room service featuring local dishes. A near-to-perfect business hotel.

Arrived after ten pm and had no trouble getting decent room service. Room clean spacious and high tech...flat screen tv, good wifi. Breakfast fine in am. Far from airport but it was a very nice bed and entirely international standard. Agree with another writer that the surrounding area is completely under construction, and the general impression of Casablanca is that it is easily missed.
This is a top notch hotel. Very luxurious but the price is too high even for that category. Almost nothing else to complain about.

column3: Very nice hotel, location leaves something to be desired
column4: My wife and I stayed here for a night before flying out of Morocco after our honeymoon. The hotel was quite upscale and the service was very good. The prices are comparable to upscale hotels in the US. However, there is some construction going on in the surrounding streets, and the traffic and chaos around the building were a bit much. I would recommend the hotel itself, but the location was undesirable, in my opinion.

The staff at this hotel is incredible, they will bend over backwards to get you what you want, even if it means sending someone out to get you something that isn't on the menu. Laundry service is excellent, and very fast! I would definitely recommend this hotel for the business traveler, spending time in Casablanca. Ask for a room with a Mosque view in the immediate future, as the construction that was already mentioned is ongoing.

This hotel is great! The room was huge, very clean, modern and updated with great service. The food was good too. The restaurant / bar staff was very friendly and helpful. This is the only place in Casablanca we will stay if we return.

This is a lovely hotel in noisy Casablanca. It is situated near the Place de united nations and the medina. The hotel itself is opulent and extravagant luxury with a marble foyer. There are plentiful bars and sumptuous chairs and loungers to sink into. The staff are helpful. The rooms are as one would expect of a 5 star hotel. As a bonus this hotel has a lovely swimming pool area where you can eat and relax. It makes the hustle and bustle of Casablanca seem a world away.

Though I did not find Casablanca to be a pretty city, the Hyatt is a very fine hotel. The lobby is nicely decorated and the rooms are comfortable. There is construction going on in the street but its not that difficult to deal with. Food in both the main restaurant as well as the pool restaurant was excellent and the service was fine. I must comment on the fact that high speed internet service was free and could be accessed in the room and even at the pool. Why is this not the norm in all five star hotels? At this point in time, free internet service should be as common as TV.

Currently there is a lot of construction surrounding the Hyatt in Casablanca, but once you get beyond the traffic congestion the hotel is a lovely oasis. The Moroccan restuarant serves wonderful food and French wines and the staff of both the hotel and restaurant and very helpful and speak several languages. The best food I had in Morocco I ate here. Great olives! Their lounge is rather dimly lit, and the music gets loud. However, the music and dancing in the Moroccan restuarant is better (authentic) and really relaxes the weary traveller. I would definately stay at the Hyatt again if I return to Morocco.

Property is recently remodeled and very tastefully done. Bedding super comfy. Forgot my converter and hotel immediately brought one to the room. Awesome breakfast buffet. Have stayed here all three trips in past year!

Beneath the nondescript exterior of this 45-year old hotel is a classy interior. The room facing the Hassan mosque has excellent view. The service of the staff especially at the breakfast lounge is excellent! The two strange thing are first, there is no complimentary mineral water and the two small bottles in the minibar cost USD 5 each! There is no kettle for guests to make tea; only a nespresso machine with limited choice of flavour. Secondly, it is intriguing to see th toilet is separated from the bathroom, with separate entrances far apart.

As the city is dirty as the hotel is exceptional ! The construction just in front of the Hotel and the all city will not deserve it but if you look for great place to be in city center, Hyatt is certainly the place to be ! The staff is absolutely fantastic, always asking for support and very attentive. The room are clean, large and very well equipped. Breakfast at the ground floor is great and you can even ask for "french toast" at the chef ! If the background music was less strong this will be perfect ! Dinner at Café M was really great ! Nice hotel with very good service !

column3: When you want the best and money is no issue
column4: I stayed in the Hyatt for a business trip and enjoyed the stay very much. Rooms are perfect, modern, large and of very high standard. Big LCD screen, separate shower (with amazing power) and separate toilet. Different restaurant and bars, which are all perfect. Staff is extremely friendly and attentive, always prepared to help you. Good hotel-pool, with deck-chairs makes your stay also very relaxing. I did not use the Spa etc. Location of the hotel is in the midst of everything. A few steps away from the (old) medina, and a short ride to the Hassan II Mosque. At the moment the city of Casa is building a tram-track just in from of the hotel which makes it a little noisy after 7.30 in the morning, if you have room on the front-side. If you want perfect silence ask for a room on…

Everyone there was super nice and the rooms are deluxe! The only challenge we had was finding our way around and getting recommendations for a vegetarian restaurant...but everything within the hotel was super. Great bathrooms and products. Wonderful view of the medina and ocean. Very central to the medina and restaurants. We used points and got a super room with fruit and cookies.

My understanding is this is the best hotel in Casablanca. I stayed here for a week for business. If you dont have a car picking you up at the airport, you should spend about 200 - 300 MAD for a taxi. The hotel is right by the bizarre which is great if you want to go shopping for souvenirs. The staff: concierge, doorman, front desk are all very helpful and friendly. They even helped us get tickets to Cirque du Solieil. The rooms are nice, cleaned perfectly daily, comfortable beds, shower & bath. I belong to their loyalty programme so there was something special in my room most days: macaroons, chocolates for easter, fresh flowers - so lovely! I would recommend the 2 restaurants in the hotel - French Cafe M and Arabic Dar Beida. Their breakfast is also lovely with…

The hotel staff and service that we received in this hotel is second to none that I have experienced in the world. No matter the request, it was attended to immediately, and resolved to our satisfaction. Almost without exception, when we as travellers stay in hotels we experience some sort of issue with some aspect of our stay in a hotel, but to have any issue, no matter how small attended to immediately, with a smile and to get follow up to ensure satisfaction is to me the test of an exceptionally well run hotel. Food was good, cleanliness great, location good.

I decided to book a night here since I had an early flight the next day back to Detorit via Paris from afternoon flight into Casablanca from Agadir. The place didn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is quite beautiful. The rooms are very well kept and clean. King sized bed was comfortable. Out of the three cities I spent time in, I found Casablanca to have the fewest English speaking folks but the desk staff did speak English. On the plus side, there is more Spanish spoken in Casablanca than in Agadir or Marrakech. The noise below is there - it's in a very busy part of town. The call to prayer is quite loud but I had no issue with this as it is part of the culture. The Hyatt is in walking distance from lots of shopping and restaurtants. I gave the…

If you can afford it, this is the best place to stay in Casablanca. Very friendly service, nice rooms, good restaurants, great pool. Everything, even the internet works. The rooms on the old city side are noisy because of the calls to prayer, but worth it because of the superb views over the old city. The rooms are a tad functional and charmless, but spacious enough (just) and very comfortable and clean. Location is perfect. A very good hotel, and a delightful introduction to Moroccan hospitality.

What a wonderfull stay in Hyatt. Warm welcome, clean room, fantastic food and great team to look after us. Thank you to Fanny, Zahra, Souraina and Abderrahmen for making my birthday trip such a fantastic experience. I could not imagine being pampered better:):):). X

column3: Business Trip was Turned into a Memorable Experience
column4: I had the privilege to stay at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca for business. I can not say enough good thing about this hotel and the amazing staff. As an American who is not fluent in French or Arabic, this hotel made me feel welcome, at home and safe. They guided me how to enjoy Casablanca safely and I fell in love with the people. Thank You Brian

I had an excellent experience at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca. The staff at the reception desk was very friendly and helpful. We were checked in quickly and were able to go straight to our rooms. The rooms were spacious and nice size bathroom with the toilet in a separate room. The bed was really comfortable with a firm mattress. The rooms were clean and tidy. There was internet connection in the room, which I had no difficulty with. There is also internet in the lobby. The restaurants in the hotel were nice, we ate at 2 of the restaurants and had room service. The staff in the restaurants and room service was helpful and accommodating. There was a good selection of food at breakfast. There isn’t anything with the hotel which I would personally fault.

I spent three nights in this hotel for a business trip. I had a "king room". I felt myself so comfortable there. It is a Hyatt Regency and I suppose that’s explaining everything and is not necessary to write much detailed. Rooms are very big and very well equipped. Bed is so comfortable which made me so happy because I was extremely tired during this trip. Meals and the service are excellent, the staff is friendly. Unfortunately I spent my birthday there and was a nice surprise when a staff member knocked on the door and came with a delicious cake and a kind gift. Hotel is well situated however I don’t consider Casablanca as a touristic place. One thing I did not like was the Internet. Hotel provides internet access everywhere by wifi and by cable in the room. But wifi didn’t…

I Occasionally go to Casablanca on business, and I usually stay in the Hyatt, for several reasons... Best thing about the hotel is the spacious and comfortable rooms, not to mention the great view of the - not very distant - Hassan II mosque and the ocean. Meals and the service are extremely good, and the staff is friendly. The location of the hotel has a good side and a bad side: one way, it is located downtown where one can get close to anything no sweat, however, and because of the civil works downtown Casablanca - specifically around the hotel - the area is always jammed with traffic. All in all, it is the best hotel I stayed in while in Casablanca. Highly recommended

I often go to Casablanca for Business and I find that the Hyatt Regency is probably your best bet for international standards and overall good hotel. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable and the staff is attentive and nice.

column3: It was fine - very good staff - Roadworks uggh!!
column4: The hotel is fine - It is a Hyatt Regency so you expect it to be nice - and it is fully adequate. I had a superior room and was kind of disappointed with the view - it looked out over the Place des Nations Unies which is being totally torn up at the moment - the square is strewn with barriers as they lay tram lines over the area. The surrounding area is very picturesque - nice parks and squares all within walking distance. The restaurants in the hotel are very good - though expensive by local standards. The grand taxis congregate right outside the front door and of course try to charge you outrageous prices to go the smallest distance. The staff at the hotel are wonderful - especially the concierge. My luggage was completely lost someplace along my long journey from…

The Hyatt Casablanca is very nice. My room was clean and large, very comfortable. I have no complaints. Bottled water was free, there was free, fast wired internet in the room, and there is ample room in the very nice lobby for impromptu meetings with colleagues. When I was there in December the computer was down at checkout, which meant we got only handwritten receipts until a regular receipt was emailed several days later. The elevators were broken and being repaired, so there were queues. Breakfast was not included and expensive, and the room was expensive. There is road construction in front which makes crossing the street to a regular breakfast restaurant tricky but possible. You can walk to the medina. Since then I also have stayed at the Kenzi Tower, where the…

column3: Very good, but not the best for Hyatt
column4: Hyatt in Casablanca lives overall up to what you would expect of a Hyatt Regency standard. Especially the breakfast area with it's classic-style dome, as well as the restaurant and fireside-area in the lobby were warmly appreciated. The main (big if you're here for leisure and not business) is the pool, which is in a small fenced of area by the back of the building, separated from the road noise by a fence and bushes (feels like standing in the middle of the intersection). Still, besides this, another good side is the location right off the old Medina, inviting for a casual stroll.

column3: Nice lobby, comfortable room, average check-in
column4: Pros: - Nice lobby and decoration - good bkfast - Comfortable room Cons: - Very poor welcome and check-in for this hotel category. Patronizing reception staff attitude, no genuine care for clients. - Expensive rates (2500 MAD / night without bkfast). IMO, rooms should not be more than 2000 MAD for the comfort, country, and level of rendered service. Still, one of the good hotels of Casablanca...for the moment.

column3: The best business hotel in Casablanca
column4: Nice hotel, they upgraded me to a suite to say sorry for shifting me to another hotel the previous night (because the King was in town). bar and food is good. Memorable night with colleagues watching belly dancing while a 30 American retirees shared their life stories over a loud microphone. Pool was closed due to a conference for Thoracic surgeons. The gym is a small room with one running machine and a sofa.

column3: A Great Hotel for a Few Nights in Casablanca
column4: The Hyatt Regency Casablanca is a stunning hotel in downtown Casablanca. The rooms are very modern and extremely clean. The mini bar selection is nice (But pricey) and the bed was extremely comfortable (I am a fussy sleeper). The rooms are quiet and the decor is modern. The separate toilet room at the entrance of the room is a nice touch. The corridors are dark, but feel luxurious. The lobby is a snapshot of the 50's in the US... Loads of leather couches and chairs and smoking is perfectly acceptable (this bothered me, but to each his own). Meals were lovely but expensive. Walking distance to some local attractions and luxury shopping. Stay here if you want luxury on your stay in Casablanca!

our experience was very very good, the staff was very kind, the decoration is modern but with influence of the culture from morroco. the cafe m restaurant inside the hotel is fantastic and the food super international.

column3: Nice hotel, but bring a thick wallet
column4: The Hyatt Casablanca is a very nice hotel, but very pricey. Pros: Very nice interior, helpful staff and free wifi. Cons: Pricey (breakfast buffet - semi-nice) cost $32 USD and lunch and drinks were expensive, the breakfest, lunch and dinner locations are smoke filled with many people smoking. Kind of surprising, most highly rated hotels around the world have banned smoking in eating places. The smoke was so think it hung in the air and made the eating area cloudy. The main elevators were not working and the eating locations were limited.

column3: Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location
column4: Even though originally from Casablanca, I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 1 night on my last trip back home. The staff was very welcoming and helpful, in particular Mr. Abderrahmane Benmansour, the Duty Manager. He was very attentive to each and every requests, while being very courteous and professional. My suite was overlooking the souk (bazaar market), with the Hassan II mosque in the background.. The view is particularly breathtaking in the evening, when it is dark but the lights are still on. The "6pm" bar-lounge tends to be very crowded with local people in the evening, but it is a very nice spot to see and be seen. It is also open for Brunch, which I would also highly recommend. All in all, the Hyatt Regency is probably one of the best address in town, thanks to…

column3: Great Hotel, great location, awesome service
column4: We stayed here on the last day of our whirlwind 6 day 5 city tour of Morroco and after trying out various types of accommodations in the different cities of Morroco we felt that this one was the best. We stayed at sofitels as well as 5 star riads and Hyatt Casablanca was just a class apart. I have always noticed that for some reason the Hyatts outside of the US seem much better, the staff seems to try so hard to assist with everything that you feel taken care of. The service was impeccable, the hotel was absolutely beautiful from the inside, the rooms were quite large and well appointed. After trying out various other types of accommodations throughout Morroco this was such a welcome change. Pretty much each and every member of the staff that we interacted spoke perfect…
stayed for a stopover, the food at the hotel restaurants and lobby is good, rooms are spacious and comfortable

This is my third visit to the Hyatt and Casablanca the last one being in mid-2011. The hotel continues to be in good shape and the service up to the mark. The Club floor rooms are spacious and the views are nice (either city view or Mosque view). Rooms have generous sized showers and ameminities. Includes writing desk, complementary wifi, water and nespresso coffee machines. Staff are friendly. Fitness center has good services. Tried the "Cafe M" French restruarant last night and it was excellent. The Club Lounge has complementary cocktails and drinks in the evening which is a nice treat.

well its the hyatt , so you would expect 5 star class service, which you get room are spacious, right beside the old market, but very expensive ..!! even for Hyatt prices, staff are friendly, but for me there are a few hotels close by that are much cheaper and not much a diff...
I stayed there with my collegues for business. Staff were really helpful and they provided all the necessary information. They organized guided tours and restaurants around. Recomended...

column3: Good hotel, but just below expectations
column4: Stayed here for 3 nights. It is actually a very good hotel, but just below expectations for 'the best hotel in town'. Hotel services were attentive and helpful, its location very good (easily reachable) and breakfast in the lounge was very fine indeed, offering a range of Arabic as well as European foods to choose from, along with Nespresso coffee. The hotel also features several restaurants, and the one we tried served decent french cuisine. The room itself was spacious and offered all amenities you'd otherwise expect, but also displayed a kind of neglect and lack of maintenance that was also apparent in the rest of the hotel. This is a pity for an upmarket hotel like this. Although I certainly would not recommend against this hotel, there is still room for improvement.

This was my first visit to Hyatt Regency in Casablanca and I was not disappointed. The staff is pleasant and efficient and the breakfast was of top quality. However, I missed cold cuts and smokeds salmon, but had well prepared poached eggs. I was offered an upgrade so my room was probably better equipped than standard, and the hotel offered free broadband wireless. I hope they do that for all the guests since paying for wireless when the roomrate is above 250 euros seems a little cheap. The Hyatt is not the cheapest business hotel, but sometimes a little luxury might be allowed even for business travellers.

column3: A great hotel with a caring service to match
column4: I have to travel to Casablanca on frequent business trips and have stayed at the Hyatt every time.
